original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: the fruit of entering the stream,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dam /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dam /
translated: the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, arhatship,

original: rang byang chub bam /
analyzed: rang byang chub bam /
translated: individual enlightenment,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar ram /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar ram /
translated: or unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: chos gang la'ang mngon par chags par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos gang la'ang mngon par chags par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: or any dharma at all.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis chos thams cad kyis stong ste /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis chos thams cad kyis stong ste /
translated: it is because all dharmas are empty of all dharmas by intrinsic nature.

original: stong pa nyid ni stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Emptiness does not settle down on emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang dmigs su med na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang dmigs su med na /
translated: Since emptiness is not apprehended,

original: gang stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba lta ci smos te /
analyzed: gang stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba lta ci smos te /
translated: what should settle down on emptiness?

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med par chos thams cad kyis rnam par spyod do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med par chos thams cad kyis rnam par spyod do //
translated: Subhūti, in that way bodhisattva great beings, without settling down on any dharma, practice all dharmas.

original: de bslab pa 'di la gnas shing sems can 'di dag ci la spyod ces sems can gyi spyod pa la lta ste; de 'di snyam du /
analyzed: de bslab pa 'di la gnas shing sems can 'di dag ci la spyod ces sems can gyi spyod pa la lta ste; de 'di snyam du /
translated: Abiding in this training, he will look at the conduct of sentient beings, thinking, ‘What are these sentient beings doing?’

original: kye ma sems can 'di dag ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i 'dzin pa la spyod de /
analyzed: kye ma sems can 'di dag ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i 'dzin pa la spyod de /
translated: He will think, ‘Alas, these sentient beings are engaged in incorrect grasping.

original: kye ma sems can 'di dag ni yang dag pa ma yin @421b pa'i 'dzin pa las dgrol bar bya na dka' ba byed do zhes nas /
analyzed: kye ma sems can 'di dag ni yang dag pa ma yin @421b pa'i 'dzin pa las dgrol bar bya na dka' ba byed do zhes nas /
translated: Alas, it is difficult to liberate these sentient beings from incorrect grasping.’

original: de'i tshe thabs mkhas pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
analyzed: de'i tshe thabs mkhas pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
translated: At that time, through skillful means, he will abide in the perfection of wisdom

original: 'di skad du ston to //
analyzed: 'di skad du ston to //
translated: and teach as follows:

original: kye sems can dag /
analyzed: kye sems can dag /
translated: ‘Come, sentient beings!

original: tshur gshegs / sbyin pa byin cig /
analyzed: tshur gshegs / sbyin pa byin cig /
translated: Give gifts!

original: des khyod longs spyod dang ldan par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: des khyod longs spyod dang ldan par 'gyur gyi /

original: longs spyod des kyang rlom sems su ma byed cig /
analyzed: longs spyod des kyang rlom sems su ma byed cig /

analyzed: de la snying po gang yang med do //
translated: There is nothing substantial in that.🔽’

original: de la snying po gang yang med do //

original: de bzhin du 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: In the same way, they encourage them in the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the liberations, the  bases of mastery, the spheres of totalities, emptiness, signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la 'dems te /
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la 'dems te /
translated: wishlessness, the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: kye sems can dag /
analyzed: kye sems can dag /
translated: They say, ‘Come here, beings!

original: tshur gshegs / gzungs kyi sgo rnams sgoms shig /
analyzed: tshur gshegs / gzungs kyi sgo rnams sgoms shig /
translated: Meditate on the dhāraṇī gateways!

original: gzungs kyi sgo de dag gis kyang rlom sems su ma byed cig /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo de dag gis kyang rlom sems su ma byed cig /
translated: But do not be proud because of those dhāraṇī gateways!

original: de la snying po gang yang med do //
analyzed: de la snying po gang yang med do //
translated: They have no essence at all!’

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la 'dems te /🔽kye sems can dag /
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la 'dems te / kye sems can dag /
translated: In the same way, they encourage them with regard to the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, the great friendliness, the great compassion, and the eighteen special qualities of the buddhas.

original: tshur @422b gshegs /
analyzed: tshur @422b gshegs /
translated: They say, ‘Come here, beings!

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams sgoms shig /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams sgoms shig /
translated: Meditate on the eighteen special qualities of the buddhas!

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa de dag gis kyang rlom sems su ma byed cig /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa de dag gis kyang rlom sems su ma byed cig /
translated: But do not get conceited about those eighteen special qualities of the buddhas!

original: de la snying po gang yang med do //
analyzed: de la snying po gang yang med do //
translated: There is nothing substantial there at all!

original: de bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la 'dems te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la 'dems te /
translated: In the same way, they encourage them with regard to the fruit of entering the stream.

original: kye sems can dag /
analyzed: kye sems can dag /
translated: They say, ‘Come here, beings!

original: tshur gshegs / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu sgoms shig /
analyzed: tshur gshegs / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu sgoms shig /
translated: Meditate on the fruit of entering the stream!

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu des kyang rlom sems su ma byed cig /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu des kyang rlom sems su ma byed cig /
translated: But do not get conceited about the fruit of entering the stream!

original: de la snying po gang yang med do //
analyzed: de la snying po gang yang med do //
translated: There is nothing substantial there at all!

original: de bzhin du lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub la 'dems te; kye sems can dag /
analyzed: de bzhin du lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub la 'dems te; kye sems can dag /
translated: In the same way, they encourage them in the fruit of once-returner, the fruit of non-returner, the fruit of a worthy one, and individual enlightenment, saying:🔽‘Come here, beings!

original: tshur gshegs / rang byang chub sgoms shig /
analyzed: tshur gshegs / rang byang chub sgoms shig /
translated: Meditate on individual enlightenment!

original: rang byang chub des kyang rlom sems su ma byed cig /
analyzed: rang byang chub des kyang rlom sems su ma byed cig /
translated: But do not get conceited about that individual enlightenment!

original: de la snying po gang yang med do //
analyzed: de la snying po gang yang med do //
translated: There is nothing substantial there at all!

original: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la 'dems te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la 'dems te /
translated: In the same way, they encourage them in , up to and including omniscience, saying:

original: kye sems can dag /🔽tshur gshegs / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid sgoms shig /
analyzed: kye sems can dag / tshur gshegs / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid sgoms shig /
translated: ‘Come here, beings!🔽Meditate on omniscience!

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid des kyang rlom sems su ma byed cig /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid des kyang rlom sems su ma byed cig /
translated: But do not get conceited about that omniscience!

original: de la snying po gang yang med do //
analyzed: de la snying po gang yang med do //
translated: There is nothing substantial there at all!

original: zhes de de ltar sems can rnams la 'dems pa dang / rjes su ston pa byed cing /
analyzed: zhes de de ltar sems can rnams la 'dems pa dang / rjes su ston pa byed cing /
translated: ’ In this way, they encourage and teach beings,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lam la spyod kyang gang la'ang mngon par zhen pa med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lam la spyod kyang gang la'ang mngon par zhen pa med do //
translated: and they practice the bodhisattva path without settling down on anything at all.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos thams cad ni mngon par zhen pa med pa ste /🔽de ni 'di ltar de dag la stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir gang gis mngon par zhen par bya ba'i ngo @423a *//
analyzed: chos thams cad ni mngon par zhen pa med pa ste / de ni 'di ltar de dag la stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir gang gis mngon par zhen par bya ba'i ngo @423a *//
translated: Subhūti, all phenomena are without attachment.

original: bo nyid med do //
analyzed: bo nyid med do //
translated: It is because their essential nature is emptiness, and so there is no essential nature that could be attached to.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi lam la spyod kyang gang la'ang mi gnas te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi lam la spyod kyang gang la'ang mi gnas te /
translated: Subhūti, in that way, although bodhisattva great beings practice the path to awakening, they do not rest on anything.

original: de gnas pa med pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de la mi gnas so //
analyzed: de gnas pa med pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de la mi gnas so //
translated: They practice the perfection of generosity without resting on it, and so on up to

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de la mi gnas so //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de la mi gnas so //
translated: they practice the perfection of wisdom without resting on it.

original: de bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug kyang de la mi gnas te /
analyzed: de bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug kyang de la mi gnas te /
translated: He enters into the first concentration, but does not remain in it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar bsam gtan dang po ni bsam gtan gyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar bsam gtan dang po ni bsam gtan gyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: It is because the first concentration is empty of the intrinsic nature of the first concentration.

original: gang mnyam par gzhog pa de'ang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: gang mnyam par gzhog pa de'ang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: The one who enters into concentration is also empty of an intrinsic nature.

original: rnam pa gang gis mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnam pa de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnam pa de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: The aspects in which he enters into concentration are also empty of an intrinsic nature.

original: de bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par 'jug /
analyzed: de bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par 'jug /
translated: He enters into the second concentration, the third concentration, and the fourth concentration.

original: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms la snyoms par 'jug /
analyzed: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms la snyoms par 'jug /
translated: He enters into loving kindness, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la snyoms par 'jug /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la snyoms par 'jug /
translated: He enters into the sphere of infinite space, the sphere of infinite consciousness, the sphere of nothingness, and the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / byang @423b chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / byang @423b chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang /
translated: the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions, the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the four noble truths, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness,

original: mngon par shes pa la snyoms par 'jug kyang de la mi gnas te /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa la snyoms par 'jug kyang de la mi gnas te /
translated: and the clairvoyances, but they do not rest in them.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: de ni 'di ltar mngon par shes pa rnams ni /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar mngon par shes pa rnams ni /
translated: it is because the clairvoyances

original: mngon par shes pa rnams kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //🔽gang mnyam par gzhog pa de'ang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo // gang mnyam par gzhog pa de'ang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: are empty of the intrinsic nature of the clairvoyances.🔽That which enters into those states is also empty of intrinsic nature.

original: rnam pa gang gis mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnam pa de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnam pa de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: The aspects by which one enters into those states are also empty of intrinsic nature.

original: de rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'thob kyang de la mi gnas so //
analyzed: de rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'thob kyang de la mi gnas so //
translated: Although they attain the fruit of entering the stream, they do not rest in it.

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong pa'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid 'thob kyang de la mi gnas so //
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong pa'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid 'thob kyang de la mi gnas so //
translated: They attain the fruit of once-returner, the fruit of non-returner, and the fruit of arhat, but they do not rest in them.

original: de rang byang chub 'thob kyang de la mi gnas so //
analyzed: de rang byang chub 'thob kyang de la mi gnas so //
translated: They attain individual enlightenment, but they do not rest in it.

original: gsol pa / de ci'i slad du mi gnas /
analyzed: gsol pa / de ci'i slad du mi gnas /
translated: ” asked, “Why do they not rest in them?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir mi gnas te /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir mi gnas te /
translated: “They do not rest in them for two reasons.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: ngo bo nyid dang / ngo bo nyid med pa ste /🔽de gnyis kyi phyir gang la gnas pa'am /🔽gang gis gnas pa'am /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang / ngo bo nyid med pa ste / de gnyis kyi phyir gang la gnas pa'am / gang gis gnas pa'am /
translated: They are the intrinsic nature and the absence of intrinsic nature.

original: gang gnas par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i 'bras bu de dag la med do //
analyzed: gang gnas par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i 'bras bu de dag la med do //
translated: For those reasons, those fruits do not exist in any way that they could be rested in,🔽that they could rest in,🔽or that they could be rested upon.

original: de tsam gyis dga' bar yang mi 'dzin te /
analyzed: de tsam gyis dga' bar yang mi 'dzin te /
translated: They do not take delight in that alone.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de 'di snyam du bdag gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par mi bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de 'di snyam du bdag gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par mi bya ba ma yin te /
translated: It is because they think, ‘I should not fail to attain the fruit of stream enterer.

original: de la gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: But I should not rest in it.

original: bdag gis lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid @424a *//
analyzed: bdag gis lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid @424a *//
translated: I should not fail to attain the fruit of a once-returner, the fruit of a non-returner,

original: thob par mi bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: thob par mi bya ba ma yin te /
translated: or the state of a worthy one.

original: de dag la gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de dag la gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: But I should not rest content with those.

original: bdag gis rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar du thob bar mi bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag gis rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar du thob bar mi bya ba ma yin te /
translated: I should not fail to attain the level of a pratyekabuddha.

original: de la gnas par mi bya'o /
analyzed: de la gnas par mi bya'o /
translated: But I should not rest content with that.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o //
translated: I should fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: bdag gis ni sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: bdag gis ni sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: From the time I first began to set my mind on enlightenment,🔽I have not given rise to any other thought

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ma gtogs par /🔽sems gzhan gang yang ma bskyed do //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ma gtogs par / sems gzhan gang yang ma bskyed do //
translated: except the thought of unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: bdag gis ni sa dang po nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: bdag gis ni sa dang po nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: From the first level

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ma gtogs par /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ma gtogs par /
translated: except for arousing the mind of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: sems gzhan gang yang ma bskyed do //🔽bdag gis ni sa bcu pa'i bar nas nye bar bzung ste /🔽bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ma gtogs par /
analyzed: sems gzhan gang yang ma bskyed do // bdag gis ni sa bcu pa'i bar nas nye bar bzung ste / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ma gtogs par /
translated: I have not aroused any other mind.

original: sems gzhan gang yang ma bskyed do //🔽byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs nas /
analyzed: sems gzhan gang yang ma bskyed do // byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs nas /
translated: I have not aroused any other mind, except for arousing the mind of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, starting from the tenth stage.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ma gtogs par /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ma gtogs par /
translated: I have not aroused any other mind, except for arousing the mind of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, having entered into the faultlessness of a bodhisattva.

original: sems gzhan gang yang ma bskyed do snyam ste /🔽rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems g-yeng ba med par lus sam /
analyzed: sems gzhan gang yang ma bskyed do snyam ste / rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems g-yeng ba med par lus sam /
translated: I have not aroused any other mind.”

original: ngag gam / yid kyis las gang spyod kyang rung ste /
analyzed: ngag gam / yid kyis las gang spyod kyang rung ste /
translated: Subhūti, whatever actions a bodhisattva great being performs with body, speech, or mind, without a distracted mind,🔽except for arousing the mind of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: byang chub kyi sems kyis mi spyod pa med de /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyis mi spyod pa med de /
translated: there is nothing that is not done with the mind of awakening.

original: byang @424b chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni byang chub kyi sems la gnas nas /
analyzed: byang @424b chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni byang chub kyi sems la gnas nas /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva, having remained in the mind of awakening,

original: yid g-yeng ba med par yang byang chub kyi lam sgrub bo //
analyzed: yid g-yeng ba med par yang byang chub kyi lam sgrub bo //
translated: without distraction, accomplishes the path to awakening.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Blessed One,

original: gal te chos thams cad ma skyes pa lags na /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad ma skyes pa lags na /
translated: if all phenomena are unborn,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos /
translated: how will the bodhisattva mahāsattvas

original: byang chub kyi lam ji ltar bsgrub par bgyi /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam ji ltar bsgrub par bgyi / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: accomplish the path to awakening?”🔽The Blessed One said, “Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said!

original: chos thams cad ni ma skyes pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni ma skyes pa ste /
translated: All phenomena are unborn.

original: de ji lta bu zhes byas na /
analyzed: de ji lta bu zhes byas na /
translated: What is it like?

original: gang mngon par 'du mi byed pa de dag ni chos thams cad ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: gang mngon par 'du mi byed pa de dag ni chos thams cad ma skyes pa'o //
translated: Those who do not form anything have all phenomena as unborn.

original: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Blessed One,

original: 'o na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
analyzed: 'o na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
translated: whether the tathāgatas appear

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste /
translated: or the tathāgatas do not appear,

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid de bzhin gshegs pa ma lags sam /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid de bzhin gshegs pa ma lags sam /
translated: is it not the case that the true nature of phenomena is the tathāgata?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
analyzed: de de bzhin te / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste /
translated: Whether the Tathāgatas arise or do not arise,

original: chos rnams kyi gnas nyid ni de bzhin du gnas so //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi gnas nyid ni de bzhin du gnas so //
translated: the abiding of dharmas in their very own abiding is just that.

original: de la'ang gang chos kyi gnas nyid de lta bu mi shes pa de dag gi don du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi lam bskyed de /
analyzed: de la'ang gang chos kyi gnas nyid de lta bu mi shes pa de dag gi don du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi lam bskyed de /
translated: And for the sake of those who do not know that such is the abiding of dharmas, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas generate the path to awakening.

original: lam des sems can rnams 'khor ba las yongs su thar bar byed do //
analyzed: lam des sems can rnams 'khor ba las yongs su thar bar byed do //
translated: And by that path they liberate beings from saṃsāra.”🔽He said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /🔽ci lags / skyes par gyur pa'i lam gyis @425a *//
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / ci lags / skyes par gyur pa'i lam gyis @425a *//
translated: “Blessed One,

original: byang chub thob par 'gyur ba lags sam /
analyzed: byang chub thob par 'gyur ba lags sam /
translated: is awakening attained by a path that has arisen?🔽”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: “No.”🔽He said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: 'o na ma skyes pa'i lam gyis byang chub thob par 'gyur ba lags sam /
analyzed: 'o na ma skyes pa'i lam gyis byang chub thob par 'gyur ba lags sam /
translated: is awakening attained by a path that has not arisen?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: “No.”🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /🔽'o na skyes kyang skyes la /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / 'o na skyes kyang skyes la /
translated: “Blessed One,🔽is awakening attained by a path that is arisen and also not arisen,

original: ma skyes kyang ma skyes pa'i lam gyis byang chub thob par 'gyur ba lags sam /
analyzed: ma skyes kyang ma skyes pa'i lam gyis byang chub thob par 'gyur ba lags sam /
translated: and that is not arisen and also not not arisen?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: “No.”🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /🔽'o na skyes pa'ang ma lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / 'o na skyes pa'ang ma lags /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ma skyes pa'ang ma lags pa'i lam gyis byang chub thob par 'gyur ba lags sam /
analyzed: ma skyes pa'ang ma lags pa'i lam gyis byang chub thob par 'gyur ba lags sam /
translated: is awakening attained by a path that is not arisen and also not not arisen?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: “No.”🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: 'o na byang chub ji ltar thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'o na byang chub ji ltar thob par 'gyur /
translated: how is awakening attained?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub ni lam gyis 'thob pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub ni lam gyis 'thob pa'ang ma yin /
translated: “Subhūti, awakening is not attained by a path,

original: lam ma yin pas 'thob pa'ang ma yin te /🔽byang chub nyid kyang lam mo //
analyzed: lam ma yin pas 'thob pa'ang ma yin te / byang chub nyid kyang lam mo //
translated: nor is it attained by a non-path.🔽Awakening itself is the path.

original: lam nyid kyang byang chub bo //
analyzed: lam nyid kyang byang chub bo //
translated: The path itself is awakening.”🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gal te de ltar byang chub nyid kyang lam la /
analyzed: gal te de ltar byang chub nyid kyang lam la /
translated: If enlightenment is the path,

original: lam nyid kyang byang chub lags na /
analyzed: lam nyid kyang byang chub lags na /
translated: and the path is enlightenment,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos byang chub snga nas thob par 'gyur na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos byang chub snga nas thob par 'gyur na /
translated: then the bodhisattva great beings would have attained enlightenment long ago.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su mi chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa @425b gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su mi chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa @425b gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
translated: Why is it taught that the tathāgatas, arhats, genuinely perfect buddhas are described in terms of the thirty-two major marks of a great being, the eighty minor marks, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge,

original: snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyis brjod do zhes kyang ci'i slad du bstan /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyis brjod do zhes kyang ci'i slad du bstan / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: great compassion, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas?”

original: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
translated: The Blessed One replied, “Subhūti, what do you think?

original: sangs rgyas shig byang chub thob par byed pa yin nam /
analyzed: sangs rgyas shig byang chub thob par byed pa yin nam /
translated: Is it that a buddha causes the attainment of enlightenment?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

original: de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma lags so //
translated: it is not so.”

original: sangs rgyas ni byang chub thob par mi mdzad de /🔽sangs rgyas nyid kyang byang chub po //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni byang chub thob par mi mdzad de / sangs rgyas nyid kyang byang chub po //
translated: The Buddha does not make enlightenment.🔽Buddhahood is enlightenment.

original: byang chub nyid kyang sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: byang chub nyid kyang sangs rgyas so //
translated: Enlightenment is buddhahood.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: rab 'byor / gang khyod kyis 'di skad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos byang chub snga nas thob par 'gyur ro zhes smras pa; rab 'byor /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang khyod kyis 'di skad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos byang chub snga nas thob par 'gyur ro zhes smras pa; rab 'byor /
translated: “Subhūti, you have said, ‘The bodhisattva great being will have attained enlightenment long ago.’

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byas /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byas /
translated: Subhūti, here the bodhisattva great being has completed the perfections,

original: stong pa nyid thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byas /
analyzed: stong pa nyid thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byas /
translated: has completed all the emptinesses,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yongs su rdzogs par byas /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yongs su rdzogs par byas /
translated: has completed the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / @426a *//
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / @426a *//
translated: wishlessness, the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations,

original: gzungs kyi sgo rnams yongs su rdzogs par byas /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo rnams yongs su rdzogs par byas /
translated: and the dhāraṇī gateways;

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par byas shing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par byas shing /
translated: he perfected the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha;

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis /
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis /
translated: and with the vajra-like samādhi, with the wisdom that is conjoined with a single instant,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /🔽bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas phyin chad de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad gzigs pa /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas phyin chad de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad gzigs pa /
translated: they will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: chos thams cad dbang sgyur ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad dbang sgyur ba zhes bya'o //
translated: After they have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, they will be called ‘thus-gone, all-seeing, and masters of all dharmas.’

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dben pa lags na /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dben pa lags na /
translated: if all dharmas are isolated from their intrinsic nature,

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bgyi /
translated: how will bodhisattva great beings purify a buddhafield?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: “Subhūti, here, starting from the first production of the thought,

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi lus kyi gnas ngan len dang / ngag gi gnas ngan len dang / yid kyi gnas ngan len yongs su sbyong ste /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi lus kyi gnas ngan len dang / ngag gi gnas ngan len dang / yid kyi gnas ngan len yongs su sbyong ste /
translated: He purifies the negative tendencies of body, speech, and mind.

original: de yongs su dag par byas pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do ////
analyzed: de yongs su dag par byas pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do ////
translated: And by purifying them, he purifies the Buddha-field.🔽PART IV

original: @426b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa /
analyzed: @426b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa /
translated: THE PERFECTION OF WISDOM

original: bam po bdun cu gsum pa /
analyzed: bam po bdun cu gsum pa /
translated: CHAPTER XXIX

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: lus kyi gnas ngan len ni gang lags /
analyzed: lus kyi gnas ngan len ni gang lags /
translated: What is the negative tendency of the body?

original: ngag gi gnas ngan len ni gang lags /
analyzed: ngag gi gnas ngan len ni gang lags /
translated: What is the negative tendency of speech?

original: yid kyi gnas len ni gang lags /
analyzed: yid kyi gnas len ni gang lags /
translated: What is the negative tendency of mind?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽lus kyi las mi dge ba srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa spyod pa ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / lus kyi las mi dge ba srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa spyod pa ni /
translated: The Lord said:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lus kyi gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lus kyi gnas ngan len to //
translated: The negative tendency of the body is the unwholesome deed of taking life, taking what is not given, and sexual misconduct.

original: ngag gi las mi dge ba brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / zhe gcod pa'i tshig dang / tshig kyal pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i ngag gi gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: ngag gi las mi dge ba brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / zhe gcod pa'i tshig dang / tshig kyal pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i ngag gi gnas ngan len to //
translated: The unwholesome verbal actions of lying, slander, harsh speech, and idle talk are verbal misdeeds of a bodhisattva.

original: yid kyi las mi dge ba chags sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i yid kyi gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: yid kyi las mi dge ba chags sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i yid kyi gnas ngan len to //
translated: The unwholesome mental actions of covetousness, ill will, and wrong views are mental misdeeds of a bodhisattva.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang ser sna'i sems ni byang chub sems dpa'i yid kyi gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang ser sna'i sems ni byang chub sems dpa'i yid kyi gnas ngan len to //
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, a miserly mind is a mental misdeed of a bodhisattva.

original: tshul khrims ngan pa'i sems dang / 'khrug pa'i sems dang / le lo'i sems dang / g-yeng ba'i sems dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems dang / shes rab 'chal ba'i sems ni byang chub sems dpa'i yid kyi gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: tshul khrims ngan pa'i sems dang / 'khrug pa'i sems dang / le lo'i sems dang / g-yeng ba'i sems dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems dang / shes rab 'chal ba'i sems ni byang chub sems dpa'i yid kyi gnas ngan len to //
translated: A mind of bad moral discipline, a mind of anger, a mind of laziness, a mind of distraction, an unbalanced mind, and a mind of poor wisdom are mental misdeeds of a bodhisattva.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang tshul khrims yongs su ma dag pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang tshul khrims yongs su ma dag pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas ngan len to //
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, impure moral discipline is a misdeed of a bodhisattva.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang bral ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang bral ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas ngan len to //
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, the bodhisattva’s negative reflex is to be without the four applications of mindfulness.

original: yang dag par spong @427a *//
analyzed: yang dag par spong @427a *//
translated: It is to be without the four right efforts,

original: ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang bral ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang bral ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas ngan len to //
translated: the four legs of supernatural power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven aspects of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path.🔽It is to be without the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the liberations, the serial absorptions, emptiness,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: signlessness, and

original: smon pa med pa dang bral ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang bral ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas ngan len to //
translated: wishlessness.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du byed pa'am /🔽de la 'dod pa bskyed pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du byed pa'am / de la 'dod pa bskyed pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas ngan len to //
translated: or for the production of a desire for the realization of the fruit of a Once-returner,🔽or for the production of a desire for the realization of the fruit of a Never-returner,🔽or for the production of a desire for the realization of the fruit of a Worthy One,🔽or for the production of a desire for Pratyekabuddhahood,🔽or for the production of a desire for the realization of the fruit of a Streamwinner,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du byed pa'am /🔽de la 'dod pa bskyed pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du byed pa'am / de la 'dod pa bskyed pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas ngan len to //
translated: or for the production of a desire for the realization of the fruit of a Once-returner,🔽or for the production of a desire for the realization of the fruit of a Never-returner,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du byed pa'am /🔽de la 'dod pa bskyed pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du byed pa'am / de la 'dod pa bskyed pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas ngan len to //
translated: or for the production of a desire for the realization of the fruit of a Worthy One,🔽or for the production of a desire for Pratyekabuddhahood,🔽or for the production of a desire for the realization of the fruit of a Streamwinner,🔽or for the production of a desire for the realization of the fruit of a Once-returner,🔽or for the production of a desire for the realization of the fruit of a Never-returner,🔽or for the production of a desire for the realization of the fruit of a Worthy One,

original: dgra bcom pa nyid mngon du byed pa'am /🔽de la 'dod pa bskyed pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid mngon du byed pa'am / de la 'dod pa bskyed pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas ngan len to //
translated: or for the production of a desire for Pratyekabuddhahood,🔽or for the production of a desire for the realization of the fruit of a Streamwinner,🔽or for the production of a desire for the realization of the fruit of a Once-returner,🔽or for the production of a desire for the realization of the fruit of a Never-returner,🔽or for the production of a desire for the realization of the fruit of a Worthy One,🔽or for the production of a desire for Pratyekabuddhahood,🔽or for the production of a desire for the realization of the fruit of a Streamwinner,🔽or for the production of a desire for the realization of the fruit of a Once-returner,🔽or for the production of a desire for the realization of the fruit of a Never-returner,🔽or for the production of a desire for the realization of the fruit of a Worthy One,

original: rang byang chub mngon du byed pa'am /
analyzed: rang byang chub mngon du byed pa'am /
translated: or for the production of a desire for Pratyekabuddhahood,🔽or for the production of a desire for the realization of the fruit of a Streamwinner,

original: de la 'dod pa bskyed pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas ngan len to //🔽rab 'byor / gzhan yang gzugs kyi 'du shes ni gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa bskyed pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas ngan len to //🔽rab 'byor / gzhan yang gzugs kyi 'du shes ni gnas ngan len to //
translated: or for the production of a desire for the

original: tshor ba dang / @427b 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i 'du shes ni gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / @427b 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i 'du shes ni gnas ngan len to //
translated: The notion of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness is a negative influence.

original: mig gi 'du shes ni gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: mig gi 'du shes ni gnas ngan len to //
translated: The notion of the eye is a negative influence.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'du shes ni gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'du shes ni gnas ngan len to //
translated: The notion of the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind is a negative influence.

original: gzugs kyi 'du shes ni gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'du shes ni gnas ngan len to //
translated: The notion of form is a negative influence.

original: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos kyi 'du shes ni gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos kyi 'du shes ni gnas ngan len to //
translated: The notion of sound, smell, taste, texture, and mental object is a negative influence.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i 'du shes ni gnas ngan len to; ;rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i 'du shes ni gnas ngan len to /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i 'du shes ni gnas ngan len to; ;rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i 'du shes ni gnas ngan len to /
translated: The notion of eye consciousness is a negative influence. The notion of ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind consciousness is a negative influence.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i 'du shes ni gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i 'du shes ni gnas ngan len to //
translated: The notion of eye contact is a negative influence.

original: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i 'du shes ni gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i 'du shes ni gnas ngan len to //
translated: and the perception of the sensory contact of the mind is a negative conditioning.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'i 'du shes ni gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'i 'du shes ni gnas ngan len to //
translated: The perception of the feeling that arises from the condition of the sensory contact of the eye is a negative conditioning.

original: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'i 'du shes ni gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'i 'du shes ni gnas ngan len to //
translated: The perception of the feeling that arises from the condition of the sensory contact of the ear, the perception of the feeling that arises from the condition of the sensory contact of the nose, the perception of the feeling that arises from the condition of the sensory contact of the tongue, the perception of the feeling that arises from the condition of the sensory contact of the body, and the perception of the feeling that arises from the condition of the sensory contact of the mind is a negative conditioning.

original: sa'i khams kyi 'du shes ni gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: sa'i khams kyi 'du shes ni gnas ngan len to //
translated: The perception of the earth element is a negative conditioning.

original: chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes @428a *//
analyzed: chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes @428a *//
translated: The perception of the water element, the perception of the fire element, the perception of the wind element, the perception of the space element, and the perception of the consciousness element is a negative conditioning.

original: pa'i khams kyi 'du shes ni gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: pa'i khams kyi 'du shes ni gnas ngan len to //
translated: The notion of the element of form is a negative reflex.

original: ma rig pa'i 'du shes ni gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i 'du shes ni gnas ngan len to //
translated: The notion of ignorance is a negative reflex.

original: 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi'i 'du shes ni gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi'i 'du shes ni gnas ngan len to //
translated: The notion of volitions, consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense fields, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, and old age and death is a negative reflex.

original: bud med kyi 'du shes ni gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: bud med kyi 'du shes ni gnas ngan len to //
translated: The notion of a woman is a negative reflex.

original: skyes pa'i 'du shes ni gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: skyes pa'i 'du shes ni gnas ngan len to //
translated: The notion of a man is a negative reflex.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'du shes ni gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'du shes ni gnas ngan len to //
translated: The notion of the desire realm is a negative reflex.

original: gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi 'du shes ni gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi 'du shes ni gnas ngan len to //
translated: The notion of the form realm and the formless realm is a negative reflex.

original: dge ba'i 'du shes dang / mi dge ba'i 'du shes dang / 'jig rten pa'i 'du shes dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'du shes dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'du shes dang / zag pa med pa'i 'du shes dang / 'dus byas kyi 'du shes dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i 'du shes dang / mi dge ba'i 'du shes dang / 'jig rten pa'i 'du shes dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'du shes dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'du shes dang / zag pa med pa'i 'du shes dang / 'dus byas kyi 'du shes dang /
translated: the notion of virtue, the notion of non-virtue, the notion of the mundane, the notion of the supramundane, the notion of the contaminated, the notion of the uncontaminated, the notion of the conditioned,

original: 'dus ma byas kyi 'du shes ni gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi 'du shes ni gnas ngan len to //
translated: the notion of the unconditioned,

original: rab 'byor / de dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i lus kyi gnas ngan len dang / ngag gi gnas ngan len dang / yid kyi gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i lus kyi gnas ngan len dang / ngag gi gnas ngan len dang / yid kyi gnas ngan len to //
translated: Subhūti, these are the bodhisatvas’ physical, verbal, and mental unwholesome actions.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: When bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: gnas ngan len de thams cad rnam par spangs shing bdag kyang sbyin pa yongs su gtong /
analyzed: gnas ngan len de thams cad rnam par spangs shing bdag kyang sbyin pa yongs su gtong /
translated: they completely abandon all those unwholesome actions and also give gifts themselves.

original: gzhan yang sbyin pa la yang dag par bskul te /🔽de zas @428b 'dod pa la ni zas yongs su gtong ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang sbyin pa la yang dag par bskul te / de zas @428b 'dod pa la ni zas yongs su gtong ngo //
translated: They also encourage others to give gifts.🔽To those who want food they give food,

original: skom 'dod pa la ni skom /
analyzed: skom 'dod pa la ni skom /
translated: to those who want drink they give drink,

original: gos 'dod pa la ni gos yongs su gtong /
analyzed: gos 'dod pa la ni gos yongs su gtong /
translated: to those who want clothes, he gives clothes;

original: mi'i rkyen dang / yo byad gang ci'ang rung ba'i bar du 'dod pa la ni de dag yongs su gtong ste /
analyzed: mi'i rkyen dang / yo byad gang ci'ang rung ba'i bar du 'dod pa la ni de dag yongs su gtong ste /
translated: to those who want any kind of human necessities and implements, he gives them.

original: gzhan yang mi'i rkyen dang / yo byad gang ci'ang rung ba'i bar du yongs su gtong ba la yang dag par bskul zhing rab tu 'god de /
analyzed: gzhan yang mi'i rkyen dang / yo byad gang ci'ang rung ba'i bar du yongs su gtong ba la yang dag par bskul zhing rab tu 'god de /
translated: He also encourages and establishes others in giving away any kind of human necessities and implements.

original: de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ji snyed pa de dag kyang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas shing /
analyzed: de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ji snyed pa de dag kyang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas shing /
translated: Whatever roots of virtue he has, he makes common with all beings.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: He dedicates them to the purification of the Buddha-field.

original: de bdag nyid kyang tshul khrims srung ngo //
analyzed: de bdag nyid kyang tshul khrims srung ngo //
translated: He himself keeps morality.

original: gzhan yang tshul khrims la yang dag par bskul lo //
analyzed: gzhan yang tshul khrims la yang dag par bskul lo //
translated: He encourages others in morality.

original: bdag kyang bzod pa sgom mo //
analyzed: bdag kyang bzod pa sgom mo //
translated: He himself cultivates patience.

original: gzhan yang bzod pa la yang dag par bskul lo //
analyzed: gzhan yang bzod pa la yang dag par bskul lo //
translated: He encourages others in patience.

original: bdag kyang brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
analyzed: bdag kyang brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: He himself makes an effort at perseverance.

original: gzhan yang brtson 'grus la yang dag par bskul lo //
analyzed: gzhan yang brtson 'grus la yang dag par bskul lo //
translated: He encourages others in perseverance.

original: bdag kyang bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug go /
analyzed: bdag kyang bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug go /
translated: I too will enter into the absorptions.

original: gzhan yang bsam gtan la yang dag par bskul lo //
analyzed: gzhan yang bsam gtan la yang dag par bskul lo //
translated: I will encourage others to enter into the absorptions.

original: bdag kyang shes rab sgom mo //🔽gzhan yang shes rab la yang dag par bskul zhing gzhog go /
analyzed: bdag kyang shes rab sgom mo // gzhan yang shes rab la yang dag par bskul zhing gzhog go /
translated: I will cultivate wisdom.🔽I will encourage others to cultivate wisdom.

original: 'dul lo // rab tu 'god do //🔽dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas shing /
analyzed: 'dul lo // rab tu 'god do // dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas shing /
translated: I will establish others in wisdom.🔽I will dedicate all these roots of virtue to the purification of the buddha-field,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo ste /
translated: making them common to all beings.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che sna bdun gyis yongs su bkang zhing /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che sna bdun gyis yongs su bkang zhing /
translated: Even if I were to fill the great billion-world universe with the seven precious substances

original: dkon mchog gsum la 'bul @429a *//
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la 'bul @429a *//
translated: and offer it to the Three Jewels,

original: ba byed kyang de 'di snyam du dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing rin po che sna bdun gyi rgyu las grub par gyur cig ces bya bar sems bskyed do //
analyzed: ba byed kyang de 'di snyam du dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing rin po che sna bdun gyi rgyu las grub par gyur cig ces bya bar sems bskyed do //
translated: I would not thereby arouse the thought: ‘By these roots of virtue may my buddha-field be made of the essence of the seven precious substances.’

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas kyi spyan snga'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas kyi spyan snga'am /
translated: Furthermore, Subhuti, a Bodhisattva, a great being, should, in the presence of the Tathagata,🔽

original: sangs rgyas kyi mchod rten gyi drung du lha rdzas kyi rol mo brdung ba dang dkrol ba byed kyang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mchod rten gyi drung du lha rdzas kyi rol mo brdung ba dang dkrol ba byed kyang /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, when a bodhisattva great being plays divine music in the presence of a buddha or in front of a stūpa of the Tathāgata,

original: de 'di snyam du dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du lha rdzas kyi sgra yid du 'ong ba rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung bar gyur cig ces bya bar sems bskyed do //🔽rab 'byor / gzhan yang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams lha rdzas kyi spos kyis yongs su bkang zhing /🔽sangs rgyas rnams sam /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du lha rdzas kyi sgra yid du 'ong ba rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung bar gyur cig ces bya bar sems bskyed do // rab 'byor / gzhan yang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams lha rdzas kyi spos kyis yongs su bkang zhing / sangs rgyas rnams sam /
translated: he should arouse his mind with the thought, “By this root of virtue, may divine music, pleasing to the mind, always and continuously occur in my buddhafield.”

original: sangs rgyas kyi mchod rten dag la 'bul ba byed kyang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mchod rten dag la 'bul ba byed kyang /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, when a bodhisattva great being fills the great billionfold world system with divine incense and offers it to the buddhas or to stūpas of the Tathāgata,🔽he should arouse his mind with the thought, “By this root of virtue, may the fragrance of morality, learning, generosity, and wisdom spread in my buddhafield.”

original: de 'di snyam du dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing der rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par lha rdzas kyi spos kyi ngad ldang bar gyur cig ces bya bar sems bskyed do //
analyzed: de 'di snyam du dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing der rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par lha rdzas kyi spos kyi ngad ldang bar gyur cig ces bya bar sems bskyed do //
translated: He should arouse his mind to the thought: ‘By this wholesome root, may the fragrance of divine perfumes constantly and always arise in that buddhafield of mine.’

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ro brgya dang ldan pa'i kha zas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ro brgya dang ldan pa'i kha zas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sam /
translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, a bodhisattva great being should offer that food with a hundred flavors to the tathāgatas or

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos la 'bul ba byed cing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos la 'bul ba byed cing /
translated: to the tathāgatas’ śrāvakas,

original: de 'di snyam du dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing der bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu @429b mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur pa dang / nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa la kha zas ro brgya dang ldan pa mngon par grub par gyur cig ces bya bar sems bskyed do //
analyzed: de 'di snyam du dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing der bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu @429b mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur pa dang / nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa la kha zas ro brgya dang ldan pa mngon par grub par gyur cig ces bya bar sems bskyed do //
translated: and should arouse his mind to the thought: ‘By this wholesome root, when I have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, may food with a hundred flavors be produced for me and the community of śrāvakas in that buddhafield of mine.’

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sam /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten dag la lha rdzas kyi byug pa yongs su 'bul ba byed kyang de 'di snyam du dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sam / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten dag la lha rdzas kyi byug pa yongs su 'bul ba byed kyang de 'di snyam du dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, when the bodhisattva mahāsattva offers divine ointments to the tathāgatas or to the tathāgata stūpas, he should arouse his mind to complete enlightenment in this way:

original: zhing de'i sems can thams cad lha rdzas kyi byug pa dang ldan par gyur cig ces bya bar sems bskyed do //
analyzed: zhing de'i sems can thams cad lha rdzas kyi byug pa dang ldan par gyur cig ces bya bar sems bskyed do //
translated: ‘May I, through this wholesome action, when I have attained manifestly perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment, ensure that all the sentient beings in my buddhafield possess divine ointments.’

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di snyam du /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di snyam du /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, when the bodhisattva mahāsattva offers divine flowers to the tathāgatas or to the tathāgata stūpas, he should arouse his mind to complete enlightenment in this way:

original: yid kyis bsams pa tsam gyis yid du 'ong ba'i gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg rnams sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / nyan thos rnams dang / sems can thams cad la dbul zhing yongs su gtang bar bya'o snyam du sems te /
analyzed: yid kyis bsams pa tsam gyis yid du 'ong ba'i gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg rnams sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / nyan thos rnams dang / sems can thams cad la dbul zhing yongs su gtang bar bya'o snyam du sems te /
translated: With the thought, “I will give and offer to the Blessed Buddhas, to the śrāvakas, and to all sentient beings whatever forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and tangibles are pleasing, merely by thinking of them,”

original: de de ltar sems pa'i tshe 'di snyam du dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing der bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dang / nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: de de ltar sems pa'i tshe 'di snyam du dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing der bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dang / nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa dang /
translated: “When I have aroused the Awakening Mind in this way, then by this wholesome action may I, in that buddhafield, fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect awakening, together with the community of śrāvakas,

original: sems can thams cad kyang yid kyis @430a *//
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang yid kyis @430a *//
translated: and may all sentient beings also, merely by thinking of them,

original: bsams pa tsam gyis yid du 'ong ba'i gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg yongs su grub par gyur cig ces bya bar sems bskyed do //
analyzed: bsams pa tsam gyis yid du 'ong ba'i gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg yongs su grub par gyur cig ces bya bar sems bskyed do //
translated: obtain whatever forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and tangibles they desire.”

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: they think like this:

original: ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang bsam gtan dang po la mnyam par bzhag go /
analyzed: ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang bsam gtan dang po la mnyam par bzhag go /
translated: “I myself will enter into the first concentration,

original: sems can thams cad kyang bsam gtan dang po la 'god do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang bsam gtan dang po la 'god do //
translated: and I will establish all sentient beings in the first concentration.

original: ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa la mnyam par bzhag go /
analyzed: ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa la mnyam par bzhag go /
translated: I myself will enter into the second, third, and fourth concentrations,

original: sems can thams cad kyang bsam gtan bzhi pa la dgod do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang bsam gtan bzhi pa la dgod do //
translated: and I will establish all sentient beings in the fourth concentration.🔽I myself will enter into loving kindness,

original: ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang byams pa la mnyam par bzhag go ;sems can thams cad kyang byams pa la dgod do //
analyzed: ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang byams pa la mnyam par bzhag go ;sems can thams cad kyang byams pa la dgod do //
translated: and I will establish all sentient beings in loving kindness.

original: ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms la mnyam par bzhag go /
analyzed: ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms la mnyam par bzhag go /
translated: I myself will enter into compassion, joy, and equanimity,

original: sems can thams cad kyang btang snyoms la dgod do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang btang snyoms la dgod do //
translated: and I will establish all sentient beings in equanimity.”

original: ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la mnyam par bzhag go /
analyzed: ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la mnyam par bzhag go /
translated: Now I myself will enter the concentration of infinite space.

original: sems can thams cad kyang nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la dgod do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la dgod do //
translated: I will establish all sentient beings in the concentration of infinite space.

original: ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la mnyam @430b par bzhag go /
analyzed: ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la mnyam @430b par bzhag go /
translated: Now I myself will enter the concentrations of infinite consciousness, nothing but nothingness, and neither perception nor nonperception.

original: sems can thams cad kyang 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la dgod do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la dgod do //
translated: I will establish all sentient beings in the concentration of neither perception nor nonperception.

original: ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Now I myself will cultivate the applications of mindfulness.

original: sems can thams cad kyang dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la dgod do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la dgod do //
translated: I will establish all sentient beings in the applications of mindfulness.

original: ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la bsgom par bya'o //
translated: the branches of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path.

original: sems can thams cad kyang 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la dgod do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la dgod do //
translated: I too should establish all sentient beings in the noble eightfold path.🔽I too should cultivate the emptiness gate of liberation,

original: ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: the signless gate of liberation, and the wishless gate of liberation.🔽I too should establish all sentient beings in the emptiness gate of liberation,

original: sems can thams cad kyang rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la dgod do snyam ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la dgod do snyam ste /
translated: the signless gate of liberation, and the wishless gate of liberation.’

original: de de ltar sems pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de de ltar sems pa'i tshe /
translated: When he thinks in this way,

original: de 'di snyam du dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de'i sems can thams cad bsam gtan bzhi dang mi 'bral zhing /🔽tshad med pa bzhi dang mi 'bral ba dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dag dang mi 'bral bar shog cig /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de'i sems can thams cad bsam gtan bzhi dang mi 'bral zhing / tshad med pa bzhi dang mi 'bral ba dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dag dang mi 'bral bar shog cig /
translated: They should arouse the following thought: ‘Through these wholesome roots, may all the sentient beings in that buddha-field of mine, when I have attained unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, never be separated from the four concentrations,

original: @431a *// ces bya bar sems bskyed do //
analyzed: @431a *// ces bya bar sems bskyed do //
translated: never be separated from the four immeasurables, never be separated from the four formless absorptions, never be separated from the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, and never be separated from the emptiness gate to liberation, the signlessness gate to liberation, and the wishlessness gate to liberation.’

original: rab 'byor / de de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i che /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i che /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom like that

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed de /
translated: purify a buddha-field.

original: de nam bsams pa de dag thams cad yongs su rdzogs par ma gyur gyi bar du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ste /
analyzed: de nam bsams pa de dag thams cad yongs su rdzogs par ma gyur gyi bar du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ste /
translated: until all those thoughts are completely fulfilled, he does not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de bdag nyid kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: de bdag nyid kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad dang ldan pa yin /
translated: He himself is endowed with all the roots of virtue,

original: sems can de dag thams cad kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ldan par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: sems can de dag thams cad kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ldan par byed pa yin te /
translated: and he causes all those sentient beings to be endowed with the roots of virtue.

original: de bdag nyid kyi lus kyang mdzes pa yin /
analyzed: de bdag nyid kyi lus kyang mdzes pa yin /
translated: He himself has a beautiful body,

original: sems can gang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des yongs su smin par byas pa de dag kyang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sems can gang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des yongs su smin par byas pa de dag kyang 'di lta ste /
translated: and those sentient beings who are matured by that bodhisattva great being also have a beautiful body,🔽that is to say, they have a beautiful body, a lovely body, a body that is attractive,

original: bsod nams kyis yongs su bzung ba'i phyir /🔽gzugs bzang zhing mdzes la yid du 'ong ba'i gzugs mngon par 'grub ste /
analyzed: bsod nams kyis yongs su bzung ba'i phyir / gzugs bzang zhing mdzes la yid du 'ong ba'i gzugs mngon par 'grub ste /
translated: because they are held by merit.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing de ltar yongs su dag par byed de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing de ltar yongs su dag par byed de /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings purify a buddhafield like that.

original: ci nas kyang ngan song gsum du gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid pa dang / lta ba'i rnam par gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid pa dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug tu gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid pa dang /
