analyzed: ci nas kyang ngan song gsum du gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid pa dang / lta ba'i rnam par gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid pa dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug tu gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid pa dang /
translated: “ ‘In such a way, the very names of the three lower realms will be impossible, the very names of the different views will be impossible, the very names of attachment, anger, and delusion will be impossible,

original: bud med dang / skyes par gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid pa dang / theg pa gnyis su @431b gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med par gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid pa dang /
analyzed: bud med dang / skyes par gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid pa dang / theg pa gnyis su @431b gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med par gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid pa dang /
translated: the very names of women and men will be impossible, the very names of the two vehicles will be impossible, the very names of impermanence, suffering, and no-self will be impossible,

original: yongs su 'dzin par gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid pa dang / bdag dang bdag gir bya bar gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid pa dang / bag la nyal dang kun nas ldang bar gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid pa dang / phyin ci log tu gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid pa dang /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin par gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid pa dang / bdag dang bdag gir bya bar gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid pa dang / bag la nyal dang kun nas ldang bar gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid pa dang / phyin ci log tu gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid pa dang /
translated: the very names of grasping will be impossible, the very names of “I” and “mine” will be impossible, the very names of latent tendencies and afflictive emotions will be impossible, the very names of mistaken views will be impossible,

original: 'bras bur gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid cing /
analyzed: 'bras bur gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid cing /
translated: and it would be impossible to designate them as results.

original: gzhan du na sems can de dag 'dod pa bzhin du shing rlung gis btab pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan du na sems can de dag 'dod pa bzhin du shing rlung gis btab pa'am /
translated: Otherwise, those sentient beings would be like trees shaken by the wind,

original: phyi nang gi dngos po dag las 'di lta ste; stong pa nyid kyi sgra dang / mtshan ma med pa'i sgra dang / smon pa med pa'i sgra dang / mi skye mi 'gog pa'i sgra dang / chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa'i sgra dang /
analyzed: phyi nang gi dngos po dag las 'di lta ste; stong pa nyid kyi sgra dang / mtshan ma med pa'i sgra dang / smon pa med pa'i sgra dang / mi skye mi 'gog pa'i sgra dang / chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa'i sgra dang /
translated: or like sounds that come from things, both external and internal, such as the sound of emptiness, the sound of signlessness, the sound of wishlessness, the sound of non-arising and non-cessation, the sound of the intrinsic realitylessness of all phenomena,

original: chos thams cad chos thams cad kyis stong pa'i sgra 'byung ba dang / chos de dag gi ngo bo nyid ji lta ba bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pa'i sgra dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad chos thams cad kyis stong pa'i sgra 'byung ba dang / chos de dag gi ngo bo nyid ji lta ba bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pa'i sgra dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste /
translated: the sound of all phenomena being empty of all phenomena, the sound of the intrinsic realitylessness of those phenomena just as they are, and the sound of the fact that whether the Tathāgatas arise or do not arise

original: chos thams cad chos thams cad kyis stong ngo //🔽gang stong pa de la ni mtshan ma med do //
analyzed: chos thams cad chos thams cad kyis stong ngo //🔽gang stong pa de la ni mtshan ma med do //
translated: all phenomena are empty of all phenomena.🔽“

original: gang la mtshan ma med pa de la ni smon pa med do zhes bya bar chos bstan pa'i sgra nyin mtshan rgyun mi 'chad par 'gro'ang rung /🔽'dug kyang rung /🔽sdod kyang rung /
analyzed: gang la mtshan ma med pa de la ni smon pa med do zhes bya bar chos bstan pa'i sgra nyin mtshan rgyun mi 'chad par 'gro'ang rung / 'dug kyang rung / sdod kyang rung /
translated: “In that buddha realm, the sound of the Dharma teaching ‘That which is signless is also wishless’ will constantly be heard, whether one is walking,🔽sitting,🔽standing,

original: nyal yang rung ste /
analyzed: nyal yang rung ste /
translated: or lying down.

original: rtag tu 'byung bar 'gyur ba de lta bur sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs @432a *//🔽su spyod de /
analyzed: rtag tu 'byung bar 'gyur ba de lta bur sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs @432a *// su spyod de /
translated: “When one has purified a buddha realm in that way,

original: de lta bu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing der bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang /
analyzed: de lta bu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing der bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang /
translated: one will fully awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood in that buddha realm.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de la phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs pa de dag thams cad legs par brjod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de la phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs pa de dag thams cad legs par brjod par 'gyur te /
translated: Then, the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas in the worlds of the ten directions will all praise one.

original: sems can gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa de'i mtshan thos pa de thams cad kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa de'i mtshan thos pa de thams cad kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'gyur te /
translated: Any sentient beings who hear the name of that thus-gone one will all become destined for unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas des chos bstan na /🔽sems can gang yang 'di ni chos so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas des chos bstan na / sems can gang yang 'di ni chos so //
translated: When that thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha teaches the Dharma,🔽no sentient being will have any doubt, thinking, ‘This is the Dharma’

original: 'di ni chos ma yin zhes bya bar the tshom za bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni chos ma yin zhes bya bar the tshom za bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: or ‘This is not the Dharma.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar chos rnams kyi chos nyid gang yin pa de la ni /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar chos rnams kyi chos nyid gang yin pa de la ni /
translated: It is because in the true nature of phenomena,

original: chos ma yin pa gang yang med de /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa gang yang med de /
translated: there is nothing that is not the Dharma.

original: chos thams cad kyang chos so //🔽de la sems can gang mi dge ba'i rtsa bas non pa dang / sangs rgyas sam /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang chos so // de la sems can gang mi dge ba'i rtsa bas non pa dang / sangs rgyas sam /
translated: All phenomena are the Dharma.🔽Among them, those sentient beings who are overcome by unwholesome roots, who have not planted roots of virtue with the buddhas

original: sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa /
translated: or with the hearers of the buddhas, who are under the care of unwholesome companions,

original: bdag tu lta bar bying ba nas lta ba'i rnam pa thams cad kyi bar du bying ba rtag pa'am /
analyzed: bdag tu lta bar bying ba nas lta ba'i rnam pa thams cad kyi bar du bying ba rtag pa'am /
translated: Those who are sunk in the view of a self, up to those who are sunk in all views, are either eternalists or nihilists.

original: chad pa'i mtha' la gnas pa /🔽log par 'dzin pas yang dag par rdzogs @432b pa'i sangs rgyas ma yin pa la ni /
analyzed: chad pa'i mtha' la gnas pa / log par 'dzin pas yang dag par rdzogs @432b pa'i sangs rgyas ma yin pa la ni /
translated: They are sunk in the view of a self, and they are sunk in all views. They are attached to the extremes of eternalism and nihilism.🔽They have wrong views.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yin par 'du shes pa /🔽yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yin pa la ni /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yin par 'du shes pa / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yin pa la ni /
translated: They think that those who are not perfectly awakened are perfectly awakened.🔽They think that those who are perfectly awakened are not perfectly awakened.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ma yin par 'du shes pa de dag ni chos ma yin pa la'ang chos so zhes zer /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ma yin par 'du shes pa de dag ni chos ma yin pa la'ang chos so zhes zer /
translated: They say that what is not the Dharma is the Dharma.

original: chos yin pa la'ang chos ma yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: chos yin pa la'ang chos ma yin no zhes zer te /
translated: They say that what is the Dharma is not the Dharma.

original: de dag chos spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag chos spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: They reject the Dharma.

original: de ltar chos spangs nas lus zhig pa'i 'og tu shi nas /
analyzed: de ltar chos spangs nas lus zhig pa'i 'og tu shi nas /
translated: Having rejected the Dharma, when their bodies have perished,

original: ngan song dang / ngan 'gro dang / log par ltung ba dang / sems can dmyal ba dag tu skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ngan song dang / ngan 'gro dang / log par ltung ba dang / sems can dmyal ba dag tu skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: after they die they will be born in the lower realms, in the bad places, in the lower realms, in the hells.

original: de lta bu dag la'ang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas shing /
analyzed: de lta bu dag la'ang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas shing /
translated: In those buddhafields, the blessed buddhas have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: 'khor ba'i khongs su chud pa'i sems can de dag sdig par lta ba'i rnam pa de dag las rnam par 'grol te /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i khongs su chud pa'i sems can de dag sdig par lta ba'i rnam pa de dag las rnam par 'grol te /
translated: and they liberate those beings who are within saṃsāra from those kinds of evil views.

original: de ltar rnam par bkrol nas nges pa'i phung por rab tu 'god de /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par bkrol nas nges pa'i phung por rab tu 'god de /
translated: Having liberated them in that way, they establish them in the secure state.

original: der bkod pa rnams phyin chad ngan song du ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der bkod pa rnams phyin chad ngan song du ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who have been established there will not fall back into the lower realms.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed pa yin te /
translated: Subhūti, in that way bodhisattva great beings purify a buddhafield.

original: de ltar yongs su sbyangs pas sems can rnams 'jig rten pa'i chos sam /
analyzed: de ltar yongs su sbyangs pas sems can rnams 'jig rten pa'i chos sam /
translated: Having purified it in that way, they establish beings in the worldly dharmas

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos sam /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos sam /
translated: or the transcendent dharmas,

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos sam /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos sam /
translated: or the dharmas with outflows

original: zag pa med pa'i chos sam /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos sam /
translated: or the dharmas without outflows,

original: 'dus byas kyi chos sam /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos sam /
translated: or the compounded dharmas🔽or the uncompounded dharmas.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi chos gang la'ang gnas par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi chos gang la'ang gnas par mi 'gyur te /
translated: He will not stand still for any unconditioned dharma.

original: @433a *// bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @433a *// bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will be destined for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-five Thousand Lines,

original: le'u drug cu drug go ///
analyzed: le'u drug cu drug go ///
translated: this was chapter sixty-six.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then venerable Subhūti said to the Lord,

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nges zhes bgyi'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nges zhes bgyi'am /
translated: “Lord, are bodhisattva great beings said to be definite,

original: ma nges zhes bgyi /
analyzed: ma nges zhes bgyi /
translated: or are they said to be indefinite?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni nges pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni nges pa ste /
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings are definite,

original: ma nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma nges pa ma yin no //
translated: they are not indefinite.”

original: gsol pa / nyan thos kyi phung po'am /🔽rang sangs rgyas kyi phung po'am /
analyzed: gsol pa / nyan thos kyi phung po'am / rang sangs rgyas kyi phung po'am /
translated: He said, “Are they definite in the śrāvaka heap,🔽or in the pratyekabuddha heap,

original: sangs rgyas kyi phung po'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi phung po'am /
translated: or in the buddha heap,

original: phung po gang du nges pa lags /
analyzed: phung po gang du nges pa lags /
translated: or in which heap?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,🔽“Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings are definite in the buddha heap,🔽not in the śrāvaka heap, not in the pratyekabuddha heap.”

original: rab 'byor; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni nyan thos kyi phung por nges pa'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni nyan thos kyi phung por nges pa'am /
translated: Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings are not fixed in the śrāvaka or

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi phung por nges pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi phung por nges pa ma yin gyi /
translated: pratyekabuddha vehicle,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sangs rgyas kyi phung por nges pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sangs rgyas kyi phung por nges pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings are fixed in the Buddha vehicle.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ” Subhūti said, “Lord,

original: sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nges zhes bgyi'am /🔽'on tam phyir mi ldog pa nges zhes bgyi'am /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nges zhes bgyi'am / 'on tam phyir mi ldog pa nges zhes bgyi'am /
translated: are the bodhisattva great beings who have produced the first thought fixed,🔽or are the irreversible ones fixed,

original: 'on te srid pa tha ma pa nges zhes bgyi /
analyzed: 'on te srid pa tha ma pa nges zhes bgyi /
translated: or are the ones in their last existence fixed?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Lord said, “Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / sems dang po @433b bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / sems dang po @433b bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni nges pa'o //
translated: the bodhisattva great beings who have produced the first thought are fixed,

original: phyir mi ldog pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: the irreversible ones are fixed,

original: srid pa gcig gis thogs pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa gcig gis thogs pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: and the ones in their last existence are fixed.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ” Subhūti said, “Lord,

original: nges pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ngan song rnams su skye bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: nges pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ngan song rnams su skye bar 'gyur ram /
translated: “Blessed One, will bodhisattva great beings who are certain to awaken go to the lower realms?”

original: mi 'gyur / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: mi 'gyur / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “No, they will not,” the Blessed One replied.

original: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin te /
translated: “Subhūti, that is not the case.

original: rab 'byor / ngas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni ngan song du mi skye'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / ngas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni ngan song du mi skye'o //
translated: Subhūti, I say that bodhisattva great beings will not be born in the lower realms.

original: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
translated: Subhūti, what do you think?

original: brgyad pa'am / rgyun du zhugs pa'am /
analyzed: brgyad pa'am / rgyun du zhugs pa'am /
translated: Will stream enterers,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'am /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'am /
translated: once-returners,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'am /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'am /
translated: non-returners,

original: dgra bcom pa'am /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'am /
translated: worthy ones,

original: rang sangs rgyas ngan song du skye bar 'gyur ram /🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas ngan song du skye bar 'gyur ram / gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: or pratyekabuddhas be born in the lower realms?”

original: de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma lags so //
translated: “Blessed One, they will not,” he replied.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; rab 'byor /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; rab 'byor /
translated: “Subhūti,” said the Blessed One,

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: “it is the same for bodhisattva great beings who, from the time they first give rise to the mind of awakening,

original: sbyin pa gtong ba dang / tshul khrims srung ba dang / bzod pa sgrub pa dang / brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / shes rab sgom pa dang / mi dge ba'i chos thams cad spang ba'i don du gnas pa de ni ngan song du skye bar 'gyur ba'i gnas med do //
analyzed: sbyin pa gtong ba dang / tshul khrims srung ba dang / bzod pa sgrub pa dang / brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / shes rab sgom pa dang / mi dge ba'i chos thams cad spang ba'i don du gnas pa de ni ngan song du skye bar 'gyur ba'i gnas med do //
translated: There is no possibility that one who abides in order to give gifts, to guard morality, to cultivate patience, to undertake perseverance, to become absorbed in meditation, to cultivate wisdom, and to abandon all evil dharmas will be reborn in the lower realms.

original: lha tshe ring por skye ba'i gnas med do //
analyzed: lha tshe ring por skye ba'i gnas med do //
translated: There is no possibility of being reborn among the long-lived gods.

original: gang na dge ba'i chos rnams mi spyod pa de lta bur skye ba'i gnas med do //🔽glen pa dang / lkug par 'gyur ba'i yul @434a */🔽;du skye ba'i gnas med do //
analyzed: gang na dge ba'i chos rnams mi spyod pa de lta bur skye ba'i gnas med do // glen pa dang / lkug par 'gyur ba'i yul @434a */ ;du skye ba'i gnas med do //
translated: There is no possibility of being reborn in a place where the good dharmas are not practiced.🔽There is no possibility of being reborn in a place where the four assemblies do not gather.

original: mtha' 'khob kyi kla klo dang / mi srun cing 'khor bzhir rgyur med pa'i yul du skye ba'i gnas med do //
analyzed: mtha' 'khob kyi kla klo dang / mi srun cing 'khor bzhir rgyur med pa'i yul du skye ba'i gnas med do //
translated: There is no possibility of being reborn in a border region among the barbarians.

original: log par lta ba'i rigs su skye ba'i gnas med do //
analyzed: log par lta ba'i rigs su skye ba'i gnas med do //
translated: There is no possibility of being reborn in a family with wrong views.

original: gang na sangs rgyas kyi sgra mi grag pa dang / chos kyi sgra mi grag pa dang / dge 'dun gyi sgra mi grag pa de lta bur skye ba'i gnas med do //
analyzed: gang na sangs rgyas kyi sgra mi grag pa dang / chos kyi sgra mi grag pa dang / dge 'dun gyi sgra mi grag pa de lta bur skye ba'i gnas med do //
translated: There is no place where the sound of the Buddha, the sound of the Dharma, and the sound of the Saṅgha are not heard.

original: bya ba ma yin pa'i lta bar ltung ba'i gnas med do //
analyzed: bya ba ma yin pa'i lta bar ltung ba'i gnas med do //
translated: There is no place where one falls into the view of what should not be done.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lhag pa'i bsam pas yang dag par zhugs pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lhag pa'i bsam pas yang dag par zhugs pa ni /
translated: Subhūti, from the time when a bodhisattva great being first produces the thought [of awakening], having set out with the higher intention for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la spyod ces bya ba'i gnas med do //
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la spyod ces bya ba'i gnas med do //
translated: there is no place where they engage in the ten unwholesome courses of action.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gal te de ltar nges pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de lta bu'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ldan zhing tshul dang mi 'dra ba'i gnas su mi skye ba lags na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar nges pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de lta bu'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ldan zhing tshul dang mi 'dra ba'i gnas su mi skye ba lags na /
translated: if it is so that a bodhisattva great being who is certain in this way, possessing such roots of virtue, is not born in an unsuitable place,

original: gang 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyang byol song gi rgyud du skyes pa'i rabs bstan na /
analyzed: gang 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyang byol song gi rgyud du skyes pa'i rabs bstan na /
translated: If the Tathāgata himself taught the life stories of those who were born in the animal realm,

original: de'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gang du mchis /
analyzed: de'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gang du mchis /
translated: then where did those roots of virtue go?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni mi dge ba'i las kyis byol song gi rgyud du skye ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni mi dge ba'i las kyis byol song gi rgyud du skye ba ma yin gyi /
translated: “Su­bhūti, great bodhisattva beings are not born in the animal realm due to non-virtuous karma.

original: lus gang dang gang gis sems can rnams kyi don du 'gyur ba de dang de lta bu'i lus ched du bsams shing sems can @434b rnams kyi don du yongs su 'dzin kyang /
analyzed: lus gang dang gang gis sems can rnams kyi don du 'gyur ba de dang de lta bu'i lus ched du bsams shing sems can @434b rnams kyi don du yongs su 'dzin kyang /
translated: They deliberately assume whatever bodies will benefit sentient beings, and they maintain those bodies for the sake of sentient beings.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar thabs mkhas pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byol song gi skye gnas su skyes shing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar thabs mkhas pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byol song gi skye gnas su skyes shing /
translated: Su­bhūti, in this way, through skillful means, great bodhisattva beings are born in the animal realm,

original: de la la la zhig gsod du 'ongs kyang bla na med pa'i bzod pas bdag yongs su gtong zhing sems can de dag la gnod par mi byed pa de lta bu'i thabs mkhas pa dag dgra bcom pa'am /
analyzed: de la la la zhig gsod du 'ongs kyang bla na med pa'i bzod pas bdag yongs su gtong zhing sems can de dag la gnod par mi byed pa de lta bu'i thabs mkhas pa dag dgra bcom pa'am /
translated: Even if someone comes to kill them, they give themselves up with unexcelled patience and do not harm those beings.🔽

original: rang sangs rgyas dag la yod dam /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dag la yod dam /
translated: Even if someone comes to kill him, he gives himself up to them with unexcelled patience, and does not harm those beings. Do the Arhats or Pratyekabuddhas have such skillful means?

original: rab 'byor / de bas na rnam grangs des kyang 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems can rnams kyi phyir bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi don du snying rje chen po yongs su rdzogs par byed cing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bas na rnam grangs des kyang 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems can rnams kyi phyir bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi don du snying rje chen po yongs su rdzogs par byed cing /
translated: Subhuti, for this reason, by this method, you should know that the Bodhisattva-mahasattva, for the sake of beings, in order to realize unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, perfects great compassion,

original: byol song gi skye gnas su skye'ang /
analyzed: byol song gi skye gnas su skye'ang /
translated: and even if born in the animal realm,

original: byol song gi skye gnas kyi rgyud kyi nyes pas mi gos par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byol song gi skye gnas kyi rgyud kyi nyes pas mi gos par rig par bya'o //
translated: is not tainted by the faults of the animal realm.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhuti said:

original: dge ba'i chos gang la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos gang la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin /
translated: Bhagavan, what wholesome dharmas does the Bodhisattva-mahasattva abide in, so that he can take on such a body?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yongs su rdzogs par mi bya ba'i dge ba'i chos de lta bu gang yang med de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yongs su rdzogs par mi bya ba'i dge ba'i chos de lta bu gang yang med de /
translated: “Subhūti, there is no wholesome dharma that a bodhisattva great being should not complete.

original: dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste /🔽de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste snying po byang chub la 'dug gi bar du dge ba'i chos gang @435a *//
analyzed: dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste snying po byang chub la 'dug gi bar du dge ba'i chos gang @435a *//
translated: All wholesome dharmas completed are unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment.

original: yang yongs su rdzogs par mi bya ba med do //
analyzed: yang yongs su rdzogs par mi bya ba med do //
translated: Thus, from the first production of the thought of enlightenment up to sitting on the seat of enlightenment, there is no wholesome dharma that a bodhisattva great being should not complete.

original: dge ba'i chos gang yang yongs su rdzogs par ma byas par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba de lta bu med de /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos gang yang yongs su rdzogs par ma byas par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba de lta bu med de /
translated: There is no wholesome dharma that is not completed that would cause a bodhisattva to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ni gnas ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni gnas ma yin no //
translated: That is not possible.”

original: rab 'byor / de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings, starting from the first production of the thought,

original: dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la bslab par bya ste de la bslabs na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su 'thob bo //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la bslab par bya ste de la bslabs na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su 'thob bo //
translated: should train in perfecting all wholesome dharmas, and having trained in that, they will reach the knowledge of all aspects.

original: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad kyang yongs su spong ngo //
analyzed: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad kyang yongs su spong ngo //
translated: They will also completely get rid of all the connections with residual impressions.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa'i chos dkar po zag pa ma mchis pa de lta bu dang ldan pa'ang ngan song ngam /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa'i chos dkar po zag pa ma mchis pa de lta bu dang ldan pa'ang ngan song ngam /
translated: how is it that bodhisattva great beings endowed with such pure, noble dharmas without outflows are reborn in the lower realms

original: byol song gi skye gnas su skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: byol song gi skye gnas su skye bar 'gyur /
translated: or in the animal world?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa 'phags pa zag pa med pa yin nam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa 'phags pa zag pa med pa yin nam /
translated: “Subhūti, are the Tathāgata’s pure, noble dharmas without outflows?🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: de de lags so //
analyzed: de de lags so //
translated: they are,

original: bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: Well Gone One,

original: de de lags te /
analyzed: de de lags te /
translated: they are.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'phags shing zag pa mi mnga' ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'phags shing zag pa mi mnga' ba'o //
translated: The Tathāgata is noble and does not have defilements.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pas byol song gi skye gnas su gtogs pa'i srog chags mngon par sprul pa mdzad cing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pas byol song gi skye gnas su gtogs pa'i srog chags mngon par sprul pa mdzad cing /
translated: “Subhūti, does the Tathāgata create the sentient beings who belong to the animal birth state,

original: de mngon par sprul @435b nas sangs rgyas kyi phrin las mdzad pa de lta bu yod dam med /
analyzed: de mngon par sprul @435b nas sangs rgyas kyi phrin las mdzad pa de lta bu yod dam med /
translated: and after creating them, does he perform the activities of a buddha?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /🔽mchis so // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / mchis so // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: He replied, “Lord,🔽he does.”

original: rab 'byor / des de bzhin gshegs pa byol song gi skye gnas par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: rab 'byor / des de bzhin gshegs pa byol song gi skye gnas par 'gyur ram /
translated: The Lord said, “Subhūti, does that cause the Tathāgata to become one who belongs to the animal birth state?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Lord,

original: de ni ma lags so //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de ni ma lags so // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: it does not.”

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa byol song gi skye gnas kyi sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa byol song gi skye gnas kyi sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ram /
translated: The Lord said, “Subhūti, does that cause the Tathāgata to experience the suffering of the animal birth state?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Lord,

original: de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma lags so //
translated: it does not.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,🔽“Subhūti, does the Tathāgata create the sentient beings who belong to the ghost realm,🔽and after creating them, does he perform the activities of a buddha?”

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa'i chos zag pa med pa dang ldan pa'ang ched du bsams shing de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa'i chos zag pa med pa dang ldan pa'ang ched du bsams shing de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin te /
translated: Subhūti, in the same way, even though the bodhisattva mahāsattva is endowed with the noble dharmas that are uncontaminated, he deliberately takes up such a body.

original: lus de dag gis sems can rnams ci rigs ci tshul du yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: lus de dag gis sems can rnams ci rigs ci tshul du yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: With those bodies he brings sentient beings to full maturity in whatever way is appropriate.

original: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
translated: Subhūti, what do you think?

original: dgra bcom pas sprul pa mngon par sprul na /
analyzed: dgra bcom pas sprul pa mngon par sprul na /
translated: If an arhat emanates a magical creation,

original: sprul pa des dgra bcom pa'i las byas shing las des gzhan gyi dge ba skye bar 'gyur ba yod dam /
analyzed: sprul pa des dgra bcom pa'i las byas shing las des gzhan gyi dge ba skye bar 'gyur ba yod dam /
translated: does the activity of the arhat through that magical creation, and through that activity, does the virtue of others arise?

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: it is so.

original: mchis so // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: mchis so // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: It exists.” The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa'i chos zag pa med pa dang ldan pa'ang ched du bsams shing de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa'i chos zag pa med pa dang ldan pa'ang ched du bsams shing de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin te /
translated: “Subhūti, in the same way, even though the bodhisattva mahāsattva is endowed with the noble dharmas that are uncontaminated, he deliberately takes up such a body.

original: ci rigs ci tshul du sems can rnams yongs su @436a *//
analyzed: ci rigs ci tshul du sems can rnams yongs su @436a *//
translated: In whatever way is suitable, one should completely🔽

original: smin par byed do //
analyzed: smin par byed do //
translated: and in whatever way is appropriate, he brings sentient beings to full maturity.

original: de lta bu'i lus des sdug bsngal du'ang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i lus des sdug bsngal du'ang mi 'gyur te /
translated: And with such a body, he does not suffer,

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'ang nyams su mi myong ngo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'ang nyams su mi myong ngo //
translated: and he does not experience any painful feelings.🔽Subhūti, what do you think?

original: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems sgyu ma'i mkhan pos sgyu ma las glang po'i gzugs sam /🔽rta'i gzugs sam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems sgyu ma'i mkhan pos sgyu ma las glang po'i gzugs sam / rta'i gzugs sam /
translated: If an illusionist had conjured up the form of an elephant,🔽the form of a horse,

original: glang gi gzugs shig bstan tam /
analyzed: glang gi gzugs shig bstan tam /
translated: or the form of a bull,

original: gzhan yang sgyu ma rnam pa sna tshogs bstan na /
analyzed: gzhan yang sgyu ma rnam pa sna tshogs bstan na /
translated: or had conjured up other various illusions,

original: de dag la glang po'i gzugs sam /🔽rta'i gzugs sam /
analyzed: de dag la glang po'i gzugs sam / rta'i gzugs sam /
translated: would there be any elephant form,🔽horse form,

original: glang gi gzugs sam /
analyzed: glang gi gzugs sam /
translated: bull form,

original: srog chags kyi rigs gzhan dag tu'ang 'gyur ba yod dam /🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: srog chags kyi rigs gzhan dag tu'ang 'gyur ba yod dam / gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: or any other kind of living being there?

original: de ni ma mchis so //
analyzed: de ni ma mchis so //
translated: He replied, “Blessed One, there would not be.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa'i chos zag pa med pa dang ldan pa'ang ched du bsams shing de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa'i chos zag pa med pa dang ldan pa'ang ched du bsams shing de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin te /
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being, endowed with the noble dharmas that are uncontaminated, deliberately takes up such a body.

original: lus de dag gis sems can rnams kyi don byed de /
analyzed: lus de dag gis sems can rnams kyi don byed de /
translated: With those bodies he works for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor bar 'gyur ba gang yang med do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor bar 'gyur ba gang yang med do //
translated: There is nothing at all that is a feeling of suffering.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: kye ma / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: kye ma / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Oh! Blessed One!

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa'i ye shes zag pa ma mchis pa dang / de ltar ldan zhing lus gang dang gang gis sems can rnams kyi don du 'gyur pa de dang de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin pa ni thabs shin tu mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa'i ye shes zag pa ma mchis pa dang / de ltar ldan zhing lus gang dang gang gis sems can rnams kyi don du 'gyur pa de dang de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin pa ni thabs shin tu mkhas pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattva great being, endowed with the noble wisdom that is uncontaminated, who takes up such and such a body for the welfare of sentient beings with such and such a body, is very skilled in means.

original: de ni ngo mtshar che'o //
analyzed: de ni ngo mtshar che'o //
translated: That is amazing!

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One!

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos @436b dkar po gang dang gang la gnas shing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos @436b dkar po gang dang gang la gnas shing /
translated: What are the bright dharmas that the bodhisattva great beings abide in?

original: de lta bu'i thabs mkhas pa bgyid kyang las de lta bus mi gos par spyod pa lags /
analyzed: de lta bu'i thabs mkhas pa bgyid kyang las de lta bus mi gos par spyod pa lags /
translated: “Even though they act in that way with such skillful means, they are not tainted by those actions.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who stand in the perfection of wisdom

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de lta bu'i thabs mkhas pa la spyod de thabs mkhas pa de dag gis phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re'i 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu sems can rnams kyi don byed kyang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de lta bu'i thabs mkhas pa la spyod de thabs mkhas pa de dag gis phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re'i 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu sems can rnams kyi don byed kyang /
translated: act with such skillful means, and with those skillful means they work for the welfare of beings in world systems in each of the ten directions, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River.

original: des de la gang yang reg par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: des de la gang yang reg par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: But they are not touched by any of that.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang reg par byed pa dang / gang gis reg par bya ba dang / gang la reg par bya ba de lta bu'i chos gsum po de dag thams cad mi dmigs te /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang reg par byed pa dang / gang gis reg par bya ba dang / gang la reg par bya ba de lta bu'i chos gsum po de dag thams cad mi dmigs te /
translated: Because those bodhisattva great beings do not apprehend any of those three phenomena: the one who is touched, the one who touches, and the one who is touched.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de ni 'di ltar chos gsum po de dag thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis stong pas stong pa nyid ni stong pa nyid la reg par mi byed do //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar chos gsum po de dag thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis stong pas stong pa nyid ni stong pa nyid la reg par mi byed do //
translated: Because all three of those dharmas are empty of their own-being, emptiness does not touch emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyis chos gang la'ang reg par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis chos gang la'ang reg par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Emptiness does not touch any dharma at all.

original: stong pa nyid kyang reg par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang reg par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Emptiness is not touched.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de ni 'di ltar stong pa nyid la stong pa nyid mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar stong pa nyid la stong pa nyid mi dmigs so //
translated: Because emptiness does not apprehend emptiness.

original: de ni mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: de ni mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid de /
translated: That is the emptiness of non-apprehension.

original: de la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: de la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: Abiding in that, Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /🔽ci lags / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen @437a *//
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / ci lags / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen @437a *//
translated: “Lord,

original: po chos gzhan la mi gnas kyi /
analyzed: po chos gzhan la mi gnas kyi /
translated: do Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas not stand in any other dharmas?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'ba' zhig la gnas shing rnam pa de lta bu'i thabs mkhas pa la spyod pa lags sam /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'ba' zhig la gnas shing rnam pa de lta bu'i thabs mkhas pa la spyod pa lags sam /
translated: Are they only abiding in the perfection of wisdom and practicing skillful means of that kind?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / chos gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i khongs su ma chud pa de lta bu yod dam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i khongs su ma chud pa de lta bu yod dam /
translated: “Subhūti, is there any dharma that is not included in the perfection of wisdom?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

original: gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ngo bo nyid kyis stong na /
analyzed: gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ngo bo nyid kyis stong na /
translated: if the perfection of wisdom is empty of an intrinsic nature,

original: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i khongs su chos thams cad 'du ba lags /
analyzed: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i khongs su chos thams cad 'du ba lags /
translated: how can all dharmas be included in the perfection of wisdom?

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽stong pa nyid la ni chos gang yang khongs su chud pa'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / stong pa nyid la ni chos gang yang khongs su chud pa'am /
translated: Blessed One,

original: khongs su ma chud pa zhes bgyi ba ma mchis so //
analyzed: khongs su ma chud pa zhes bgyi ba ma mchis so //
translated: in emptiness, no dharma is included or not included.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / chos thams cad chos thams cad kyis mi stong ngam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos thams cad chos thams cad kyis mi stong ngam /
translated: “Subhūti, are all dharmas not empty of all dharmas?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

original: stong ngo // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: stong ngo // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de ste chos thams cad chos thams cad kyis stong na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ste chos thams cad chos thams cad kyis stong na /
translated: “Subhūti, if all phenomena are empty of all phenomena,

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid du ma 'dus sam gsol pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid du ma 'dus sam gsol pa /
translated: are not all phenomena included in emptiness?”

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,” he replied,

original: de de lags so //
analyzed: de de lags so //
translated: “that is so.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des na khyod kyis 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing de lta bu'i thabs mkhas pa la spyod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des na khyod kyis 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing de lta bu'i thabs mkhas pa la spyod par rig par bya'o //
translated: “Subhūti, for these reasons you should know that bodhisattva great beings stand in the perfection of wisdom and practice such skillful means.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces @437b gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces @437b gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing chos thams cad stong pa nyid la gnas te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing chos thams cad stong pa nyid la gnas te /
translated: when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom and stand in the emptiness of all phenomena,

original: mngon par shes pa gang la gnas shing phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re'i 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu mchi ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams de dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa gang la gnas shing phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re'i 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu mchi ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams de dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang /
translated: “Standing in which cognition do they go to as many world systems in each of the ten directions as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River,

original: chos ston pa de dag la bsnyen bkur bgyid pa dang / chos nyan cing sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i mngon par shes pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par sgrub pa lags /
analyzed: chos ston pa de dag la bsnyen bkur bgyid pa dang / chos nyan cing sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i mngon par shes pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par sgrub pa lags /
translated: and serve the lord buddhas who are present, live, and remain in those world systems, and listen to the Dharma from those lord buddhas, and plant wholesome roots in the presence of those lord buddhas?🔽How do they accomplish the perfection of cognition that is a superknowledge?”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Lord replied to the venerable Su­bhūti as follows:

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Su­bhūti, great bodhisattva beings, when they practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom,

original: phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re'i 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed po de dag thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis stong par mthong ngo //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re'i 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed po de dag thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis stong par mthong ngo //
translated: He sees all the worlds in the ten directions, as many worlds as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā river, as empty of inherent nature.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams de dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang ngo bo nyid kyis stong par mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams de dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang ngo bo nyid kyis stong par mthong ngo //
translated: He sees all the lord buddhas, as many as there are, dwelling in those worlds, as empty of inherent nature.

original: gzhan du na ming dang brdar gdags pa nye bar bzung zhing bstan pa ma gtogs te /
analyzed: gzhan du na ming dang brdar gdags pa nye bar bzung zhing bstan pa ma gtogs te /
translated: Except for the fact that they are taught and designated by names and conventional terms,

original: gdags pa kun kyang ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: gdags pa kun kyang ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: all designations are empty of inherent nature.

original: gal te 'jig rten gyi khams de dag kyang ngo bo nyid kyis mi stong @438a *//
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten gyi khams de dag kyang ngo bo nyid kyis mi stong @438a *//
translated: If those worlds were not empty of inherent nature,

original: la; sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang ngo bo nyid kyis mi stong ste /
analyzed: la; sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang ngo bo nyid kyis mi stong ste /
translated: and if those lord buddhas were not empty of inherent nature,

original: gdags pa'i rgyud de dag kyang ngo bo nyid kyis mi stong ba zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: gdags pa'i rgyud de dag kyang ngo bo nyid kyis mi stong ba zhig yin na ni /
translated: and if those continuums of designation were not empty of inherent nature,

original: nyi tshe ba'i stong pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyi tshe ba'i stong pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: then emptiness would be partial.

original: de'ang stong pa nyi tshe ma yin no //
analyzed: de'ang stong pa nyi tshe ma yin no //
translated: It is not a mere emptiness.

original: de'i phyir chos thams cad chos thams cad kyis stong ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos thams cad chos thams cad kyis stong ste /
translated: Therefore, all phenomena are empty of all phenomena.

original: de nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: For this very reason, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who is skilled in means practices the perfection of wisdom

original: mngon par shes pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par sgrub ste /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par sgrub ste /
translated: and accomplishes the perfection of superknowledge.

original: mngon par shes pa de dag la gnas shing lha'i mig dang / lha'i rna ba dang; rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam pa dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas dran pa dang / 'chi 'pho shes pa mngon par sgrub ste /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa de dag la gnas shing lha'i mig dang / lha'i rna ba dang; rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam pa dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas dran pa dang / 'chi 'pho shes pa mngon par sgrub ste /
translated: Abiding in those superknowledges, he accomplishes the divine eye, the divine ear, the knowledge of the thoughts of others, the recollection of past lives, and the knowledge of death and rebirth.

original: mngon par shes pa med par byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa med par byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so //
translated: Without superknowledge, the bodhisattva mahāsattva cannot fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub ni mngon par shes pa'i pha rol tu phyin par 'dus te /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub ni mngon par shes pa'i pha rol tu phyin par 'dus te /
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva mahāsattva’s enlightenment is included in the perfection of the higher knowledges.

original: mngon par shes pa de dag las byang chub yongs su btsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa de dag las byang chub yongs su btsal bar bya'o //
translated: Enlightenment should be sought in those higher knowledges.

original: de 'tshol ba'i tshe lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi las 'das pas bdag nyid kyis kyang dge ba'i chos thams cad mthong /
analyzed: de 'tshol ba'i tshe lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi las 'das pas bdag nyid kyis kyang dge ba'i chos thams cad mthong /
translated: When seeking them, with the divine eye, which is pure and surpasses that of humans, he himself sees all good qualities,

original: gzhan yang dge ba'i chos thams cad la sbyor te /
analyzed: gzhan yang dge ba'i chos thams cad la sbyor te /
translated: and he also connects others to all good qualities.

original: dge ba'i chos de dag @438b la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos de dag @438b la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: But he does not settle down on those good qualities.

original: de ci'i phyir zhen /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhen /
translated: Why is that?

original: dge ba'i chos de dag thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa ste /🔽stong pa nyid ni gang la mngon par zhen cing ro myang bar byed par mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos de dag thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa ste / stong pa nyid ni gang la mngon par zhen cing ro myang bar byed par mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba med de /
translated: Because all those good qualities are empty of their own inherent nature.🔽Emptiness does not settle down on anything, nor does it settle down on savoring anything.

original: stong pa nyid ni ro myong bar byed pa med do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni ro myong bar byed pa med do //
translated: Emptiness does not savor anything.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Thus, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: lha'i mig mngon par sgrub ste /
analyzed: lha'i mig mngon par sgrub ste /
translated: they accomplish the divine eye.

original: lha'i mig des chos thams cad kyang stong pa nyid du mthong ste /
analyzed: lha'i mig des chos thams cad kyang stong pa nyid du mthong ste /
translated: With that divine eye, they see all phenomena as emptiness.

original: de chos de dag la gnas shing las mngon par sgrub bo //
analyzed: de chos de dag la gnas shing las mngon par sgrub bo //
translated: They abide in those phenomena and accomplish activity.

original: las mngon par bsgrubs pa des /
analyzed: las mngon par bsgrubs pa des /
translated: Through the accomplishment of activity,

original: sems can rnams la chos ston te /
analyzed: sems can rnams la chos ston te /
translated: they teach the Dharma to sentient beings.

original: sems can nam sems can du gdags par dmigs pa med do //
analyzed: sems can nam sems can du gdags par dmigs pa med do //
translated: But they do not apprehend sentient beings or the designation of sentient beings.

original: de ltar mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mngon par shes pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par sgrub ste /
analyzed: de ltar mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mngon par shes pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par sgrub ste /
translated: In that way, bodhisattva great beings accomplish the perfection of superknowledge without apprehending anything.

original: mngon par shes pa de dag gis mngon par shes par bya ba'i chos gang ji snyed pa de dag byed do //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa de dag gis mngon par shes par bya ba'i chos gang ji snyed pa de dag byed do //
translated: They accomplish all the phenomena that should be accomplished with those superknowledges.

original: de lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi las 'das pa de nyid kyis shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad mthong ste /
analyzed: de lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi las 'das pa de nyid kyis shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad mthong ste /
translated: With that very pure divine eye, which surpasses the human, he sees all the world systems in the eastern direction.

original: de de dag tu rdzu 'phrul gyis song zhing sbyin pa'am /
analyzed: de de dag tu rdzu 'phrul gyis song zhing sbyin pa'am /
translated: He goes to those places by means of his miraculous power and practices generosity,

original: tshul khrims sam /
analyzed: tshul khrims sam /
translated: or practices morality,🔽or practices patience,

original: bzod pa'am / brtson 'grus sam /
analyzed: bzod pa'am / brtson 'grus sam /
translated: or practices perseverance,

original: bsam gtan nam /
analyzed: bsam gtan nam /
translated: or practices concentration,

original: shes rab bam /
analyzed: shes rab bam /
translated: or practices wisdom,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams sam /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams sam /
translated: or practices the factors of awakening,

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'am /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'am /
translated: or practices the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness doors of liberation,

original: bsam gtan rnams sam /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams sam /
translated: or practices the meditative stabilizations,

original: @439a *// tshad med pa rnams sam /
analyzed: @439a *// tshad med pa rnams sam /
translated: or practices the immeasurables,

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams sam /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams sam /
translated: or practices the formless absorptions,

original: rnam par thar pa rnams sam /🔽ting nge 'dzin rnams sam /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa rnams sam / ting nge 'dzin rnams sam /
translated: or practices the liberations,🔽or practices the meditative concentrations,

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams sam /
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams sam /
translated: or practices the serial absorptions,🔽or practices the powers of the tathāgatas,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams sam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams sam /
translated: or practices the fearlessnesses,🔽or practices the detailed and thorough knowledges,🔽or practices the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,🔽or practices the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment,🔽or practices the ten powers,

original: mi 'jigs pa rnams sam /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa rnams sam /
translated: or practices the four fearlessnesses,🔽or practices the four detailed and thorough knowledges,🔽or practices the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,🔽or practices the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment,🔽or practices the ten powers,🔽or practices the four fearlessnesses,🔽or practices the four detailed and thorough knowledges,🔽or practices the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,🔽or practices the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment,🔽or practices the ten powers,🔽or practices the four fearlessnesses,🔽or practices the four detailed and thorough knowledges,🔽or practices the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,🔽or practices the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment,🔽or practices the ten powers,🔽or practices the four fearlessnesses,🔽or practices the four detailed and thorough knowledges,🔽or practices the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,🔽or practices the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment,🔽or practices the ten powers,🔽or practices the four fearlessnesses,🔽or practices the four detailed and thorough knowledges,🔽or practices the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,🔽or practices the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment,🔽or practices the ten powers,🔽or practices the four fearlessnesses,🔽or practices the four detailed and thorough knowledges,🔽or practices the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,🔽or practices the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment,🔽or practices the ten powers,🔽or practices the four fearlessnesses,

original: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams sam /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams sam /
translated: or practices the four detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams sam /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams sam /
translated: or the unshared qualities of the Buddha,

original: nyan thos kyi chos sam /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi chos sam /
translated: or the qualities of the śrāvakas,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos sam /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos sam /
translated: or the qualities of the pratyekabuddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos sam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos sam /
translated: or the qualities of the bodhisattvas,🔽or the qualities of the buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyis sems can rnams kyi don byed cing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyis sems can rnams kyi don byed cing /
translated: and they do so for the sake of sentient beings.

original: sems can de dag gi bya ba byed de /
analyzed: sems can de dag gi bya ba byed de /
translated: They do what needs to be done for those sentient beings.

original: de la sems can ser sna can gang ji snyed pa de dag la 'di skad du chos ston te /
analyzed: de la sems can ser sna can gang ji snyed pa de dag la 'di skad du chos ston te /
translated: To those sentient beings who are stingy, they teach the Dharma like this:

original: sbyin pa byin cig /
analyzed: sbyin pa byin cig /
translated: ‘Give gifts!

original: phongs pa ni sdug bsngal ba ste /
analyzed: phongs pa ni sdug bsngal ba ste /
translated: Poverty is suffering.

original: phongs pas ni bdag gi don kyang bya bar mi nus na /
analyzed: phongs pas ni bdag gi don kyang bya bar mi nus na /
translated: When you are poor, you are not even able to do what needs to be done for yourself,

original: gzhan gyi don lta ci smos kyi /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don lta ci smos kyi /
translated: let alone for others.

original: de ltar khyod kyis sbyin pa byin la bdag kyang bde bar gyis shig /
analyzed: de ltar khyod kyis sbyin pa byin la bdag kyang bde bar gyis shig /
translated: So, having given gifts, make yourself happy,

original: gzhan yang bde bar gyis shig /
analyzed: gzhan yang bde bar gyis shig /
translated: and make others happy too.

original: phongs pas zil gyis non cing nying sha nying gis zos te /
analyzed: phongs pas zil gyis non cing nying sha nying gis zos te /
translated: Do not be overcome by poverty, and do not eat your own flesh.

original: ngan song gsum las mi thar par gyur ta re /
analyzed: ngan song gsum las mi thar par gyur ta re /
translated: Do not fall into the three lower realms.’

original: zhes chos ston to //
analyzed: zhes chos ston to //
translated: They teach the Dharma like this.

original: sems can tshul khrims ngan pa can ji snyed pa de dag la 'di skad du chos ston te /
analyzed: sems can tshul khrims ngan pa can ji snyed pa de dag la 'di skad du chos ston te /
translated: To as many sentient beings as there are with faulty discipline, they teach the Dharma like this:

original: kye skyes bu dag /
analyzed: kye skyes bu dag /
translated: ‘Oh, beings!

original: tshul khrims ngan pa ni sdug bsngal ba ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims ngan pa ni sdug bsngal ba ste /
translated: Faulty discipline is suffering.

original: tshul khrims ngan pas ni bdag gi don kyang bya bar mi nus na /
analyzed: tshul khrims ngan pas ni bdag gi don kyang bya bar mi nus na /
translated: With faulty discipline, you cannot accomplish even your own purpose,

original: gzhan gyi don lta ci smos te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don lta ci smos te /
translated: let alone the purpose of others.

original: tshul khrims ngan @439b pa'i rnam par smin pa ni /🔽sems can dmyal ba'am /🔽byol song gi skye gnas sam /
analyzed: tshul khrims ngan @439b pa'i rnam par smin pa ni / sems can dmyal ba'am / byol song gi skye gnas sam /
translated: The karmic maturation of faulty discipline🔽is the world of the hells,🔽the animal world,

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten yin te /
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten yin te /
translated: or the world of Yama.

original: de ltar khyod ngan song gsum du lhung na bdag cag kyang gdon par mi nus na; gzhan gdon pa lta ci smos kyi /
analyzed: de ltar khyod ngan song gsum du lhung na bdag cag kyang gdon par mi nus na; gzhan gdon pa lta ci smos kyi /
translated: If you fall into the three lower realms, we will not be able to save you, let alone others.

original: de'i phyir khyed kyis tshul khrims ngan pa'i sems 'ga' tsam gyi go skabs kyang mi dbye'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyed kyis tshul khrims ngan pa'i sems 'ga' tsam gyi go skabs kyang mi dbye'o //
translated: Therefore, you must not give an opportunity to even a single thought of faulty discipline.

original: phyis 'gyod pa can du gyur ta re /🔽zhes chos ston to //
analyzed: phyis 'gyod pa can du gyur ta re /🔽zhes chos ston to //
translated: Later on, you will regret it.🔽’

original: sems can phan tshun gnod sems su gyur pa ji snyed pa de dag la 'di skad du chos ston te /
analyzed: sems can phan tshun gnod sems su gyur pa ji snyed pa de dag la 'di skad du chos ston te /
translated: To those sentient beings who have harmful thoughts toward each other, he teaches the Dharma like this:

original: de ltar khyed gcig la gcig gnod sems su ma byed cig /
analyzed: de ltar khyed gcig la gcig gnod sems su ma byed cig /
translated: ‘Do not have harmful thoughts toward each other like this.

original: sems 'khrugs par gyur pa la dge ba'i chos gang yang skye bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems 'khrugs par gyur pa la dge ba'i chos gang yang skye bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: When the mind is disturbed, no wholesome dharmas arise at all.

original: de lta bas na khyed phan tshun sems 'khrugs par gyur pa sems can dmyal bar skye ba'am /🔽byol song gi skye gnas su skye ba'am /
analyzed: de lta bas na khyed phan tshun sems 'khrugs par gyur pa sems can dmyal bar skye ba'am / byol song gi skye gnas su skye ba'am /
translated: Therefore, if you have a disturbed mind, you will be reborn in the hells,🔽or you will be reborn in the animal realm,

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten du skye ba'i gnas yin gyi /
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten du skye ba'i gnas yin gyi /
translated: or you will be reborn in the world of Yama.

original: de bas na khyed kyis 'khrugs pa'i sems ni 'ga' tsam kyi go skabs kyang mi dbye'o //
analyzed: de bas na khyed kyis 'khrugs pa'i sems ni 'ga' tsam kyi go skabs kyang mi dbye'o //
translated: Therefore, you should not give an opportunity to even a little disturbed mind.

original: phyis 'gyod pa can du gyur ta re /
analyzed: phyis 'gyod pa can du gyur ta re /
translated: Later on, you will regret it.🔽’

original: zhes chos ston to //
analyzed: zhes chos ston to //
translated: He teaches the Dharma like this.

original: sems can le lo can gang ji snyed pa de dag la 'di skad du chos ston to //
analyzed: sems can le lo can gang ji snyed pa de dag la 'di skad du chos ston to //
translated: To those sentient beings who are lazy, he teaches the Dharma like this:

original: kye skyes bu dag /
analyzed: kye skyes bu dag /
translated: ‘Oh people!

original: le lo ni sdug bsngal ba ste /
analyzed: le lo ni sdug bsngal ba ste /
translated: Laziness is suffering.

original: le los ni bdag gi don kyang bya bar mi nus na gzhan gyi don lta ci smos te /🔽le lo'i rnam par smin pa ni sems can dmyal ba'am /
analyzed: le los ni bdag gi don kyang bya bar mi nus na gzhan gyi don lta ci smos te / le lo'i rnam par smin pa ni sems can dmyal ba'am /
translated: “ ‘Laziness is unable to accomplish even one’s own aims, let alone the aims of others.🔽The ripening of laziness is rebirth as a hell being,

original: byol song gi skye gnas sam /
analyzed: byol song gi skye gnas sam /
translated: an animal, or

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten yin te /
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten yin te /
translated: a hungry ghost.

original: de ltar khyod ngan song gsum du lhung na /
analyzed: de ltar khyod ngan song gsum du lhung na /
translated: If you fall into the three lower realms,

original: bdag cag kyang gdon par mi nus na /
analyzed: bdag cag kyang gdon par mi nus na /
translated: we will not be able to save you,

original: gzhan @440a *// gdon pa lta ci smos kyi /
analyzed: gzhan @440a *// gdon pa lta ci smos kyi /
translated: let alone save others.

original: de'i phyir khyed kyis le lo'i sems 'ga' tsam gyi go skabs kyang mi dbye'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyed kyis le lo'i sems 'ga' tsam gyi go skabs kyang mi dbye'o //
translated: Therefore, you must not allow even the slightest opportunity for laziness.

original: phyis 'gyod pa can du gyur ta re /🔽zhes chos ston to //
analyzed: phyis 'gyod pa can du gyur ta re / zhes chos ston to //
translated: Later, you will regret it.🔽’🔽“In this way, they teach the Dharma to those who are distracted.

original: sems can sems g-yeng ba gang ji snyed pa de dag la 'di skad du chos ston te /
analyzed: sems can sems g-yeng ba gang ji snyed pa de dag la 'di skad du chos ston te /
translated: They teach the Dharma to those who are distracted, saying:

original: kye skyes bu dag /
analyzed: kye skyes bu dag /
translated: ‘Oh beings,

original: sems g-yeng ba ni sdug bsngal ba ste /🔽gang sems g-yeng ba'i rnam par smin pa ni sems can dmyal ba'am /
analyzed: sems g-yeng ba ni sdug bsngal ba ste / gang sems g-yeng ba'i rnam par smin pa ni sems can dmyal ba'am /
translated: distraction is suffering.🔽The ripening of distraction is rebirth as a hell being,

original: byol song gi skye gnas sam /
analyzed: byol song gi skye gnas sam /
translated: an animal, or

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten yin te /
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten yin te /
translated: a hungry ghost.

original: de ltar khyed ngan song gsum du lhung na /
analyzed: de ltar khyed ngan song gsum du lhung na /
translated: If you fall into the three lower realms,

original: bdag cag kyang gdon par mi nus na /
analyzed: bdag cag kyang gdon par mi nus na /
translated: we will not be able to save you,

original: gzhan gdon pa lta ci smos kyi /
analyzed: gzhan gdon pa lta ci smos kyi /
translated: let alone others.

original: de'i phyir khyed kyis g-yeng ba'i sems 'ga' tsam gyi go skabs kyang mi dbye'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyed kyis g-yeng ba'i sems 'ga' tsam gyi go skabs kyang mi dbye'o //
translated: Therefore, you must not allow even the slightest opportunity for distraction.

original: phyis 'gyod pa can du gyur ta re /🔽zhes chos ston to //
analyzed: phyis 'gyod pa can du gyur ta re / zhes chos ston to //
translated: Later, you will regret it.🔽’

original: sems can shes rab 'chal pa can gang ji snyed pa de dag la 'di skad du chos ston te /
analyzed: sems can shes rab 'chal pa can gang ji snyed pa de dag la 'di skad du chos ston te /
translated: To those sentient beings who have faulty wisdom, they teach the Dharma as follows:

original: kye skyes bu dag /
analyzed: kye skyes bu dag /
translated: ‘Oh beings!

original: shes rab 'chal pa ni sdug bsngal ba ste /
analyzed: shes rab 'chal pa ni sdug bsngal ba ste /
translated: Faulty wisdom is suffering.

original: shes rab 'chal bas ni bdag gi don kyang bya bar mi nus na; gzhan gyi don lta ci smos te /
analyzed: shes rab 'chal bas ni bdag gi don kyang bya bar mi nus na; gzhan gyi don lta ci smos te /
translated: If you cannot accomplish your own purpose because of faulty wisdom, what need is there to mention accomplishing the purpose of others?

original: gang shes rab 'chal ba'i rnam par smin pa ni sems can dmyal ba'am /🔽byol song gi skye gnas sam /
analyzed: gang shes rab 'chal ba'i rnam par smin pa ni sems can dmyal ba'am / byol song gi skye gnas sam /
translated: The result of faulty wisdom is rebirth as a sentient being in the hells,🔽as an animal,

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten yin te /
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten yin te /
translated: or in the world of Yama.

original: de ltar khyed kyis shes rab 'chal pa'i sems 'ga' tsam gyi go skabs kyang mi dbye'o //
analyzed: de ltar khyed kyis shes rab 'chal pa'i sems 'ga' tsam gyi go skabs kyang mi dbye'o //
translated: Therefore, you must not allow even the slightest opportunity for a thought of faulty wisdom.

original: phyis 'gyod pa can du gyur ta re /
analyzed: phyis 'gyod pa can du gyur ta re /
translated: Do not later become regretful.

original: zhes chos ston to //
analyzed: zhes chos ston to //
translated: He teaches the Dharma in this way.

original: 'dod chags kyi spyod pa can gang ji snyed pa @440b de dag ni mi sdug pa la sbyor ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi spyod pa can gang ji snyed pa @440b de dag ni mi sdug pa la sbyor ro //
translated: Those who engage in desire he connects to the practice of repulsiveness.

original: zhe sdang gi spyod pa can gang ji snyed pa de dag ni byams pa la sbyor ro //
analyzed: zhe sdang gi spyod pa can gang ji snyed pa de dag ni byams pa la sbyor ro //
translated: Those who engage in anger he connects to the practice of loving kindness.

original: gti mug gi spyod pa can gang ji snyed pa de dag ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la sbyor ro; ;lam ngan par zhugs pa gang ji snyed pa de dag ni yang dag pa'i lam la sbyor te /
analyzed: gti mug gi spyod pa can gang ji snyed pa de dag ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la sbyor ro; ;lam ngan par zhugs pa gang ji snyed pa de dag ni yang dag pa'i lam la sbyor te /
translated: Those who engage in delusion he connects to the practice of dependent origination. Those who have entered bad paths he connects to the true path,

original: nyan thos kyi lam mam /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi lam mam /
translated: whether it be the path of the śrāvakas,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi lam mam /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi lam mam /
translated: the path of the pratyekabuddhas,🔽or the path of the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi lam la sbyor zhing de dag la 'di skad du chos ston te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi lam la sbyor zhing de dag la 'di skad du chos ston te /
translated: He teaches them the Dharma like this:

original: khyed cag chos gang la mngon par zhen par gyur pa'i chos de dag ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong ste /
analyzed: khyed cag chos gang la mngon par zhen par gyur pa'i chos de dag ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong ste /
translated: ‘Those phenomena that you are fixated on are empty of their own intrinsic reality.
