original: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i chos rnams ni mngon par zhen par mi nus te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i chos rnams ni mngon par zhen par mi nus te /
translated: Phenomena that are empty of their own intrinsic reality cannot be fixated on.

original: stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa med do zhes chos ston te //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa med do zhes chos ston te //
translated: and they teach the doctrine as follows: ‘There is no attachment to emptiness.’

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti, in this way, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: mngon par shes pa rnams la gnas shing sems can rnams kyi don byed pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams la gnas shing sems can rnams kyi don byed pa yin no //
translated: they benefit beings by remaining in the superknowledges.

original: de lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi las 'das pa de nyid kyis /
analyzed: de lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi las 'das pa de nyid kyis /
translated: “With that very pure divine eye, which surpasses the human,

original: lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad mthong ste /
analyzed: lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad mthong ste /
translated: they see all the world systems in the south, west, and north, in the nadir and the zenith.

original: de de dag tu rdzu 'phrul gyis song zhing sbyin pa'am /
analyzed: de de dag tu rdzu 'phrul gyis song zhing sbyin pa'am /
translated: They go there by means of their miraculous powers and give gifts,

original: tshul khrims sam /🔽bzod pa'am / brtson 'grus sam /
analyzed: tshul khrims sam / bzod pa'am / brtson 'grus sam /
translated: or they practice discipline,🔽or they cultivate patience,

original: bsam gtan nam /
analyzed: bsam gtan nam /
translated: or they make an effort,🔽or they become absorbed in concentration,

original: shes rab bam /
analyzed: shes rab bam /
translated: or they cultivate wisdom,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams sam /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams sam /
translated: or they cultivate the dharmas on the side of awakening.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'am /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'am /
translated: the signless gate of liberation, and the wishless gate of liberation;

original: @441a *// bsam gtan rnams sam /
analyzed: @441a *// bsam gtan rnams sam /
translated: the meditative stabilities;

original: tshad med pa rnams sam /
analyzed: tshad med pa rnams sam /
translated: the immeasurable aspirations;

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams sam /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams sam /
translated: the formless absorptions;🔽the liberations;

original: rnam par thar pa rnams sam; ting nge 'dzin rnams sam /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa rnams sam; ting nge 'dzin rnams sam /
translated: the meditative concentrations;

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams sam /
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams sam /
translated: the stages of meditative absorption;

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams sam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams sam /
translated: the powers of the tathāgatas;

original: mi 'jigs pa rnams sam /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa rnams sam /
translated: the fearlessnesses;

original: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams sam /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams sam /
translated: the detailed and thorough knowledges;

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams sam /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams sam /
translated: the distinct attributes of the buddhas;

original: nyan thos kyi chos sam /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi chos sam /
translated: the dharmas of śrāvakas;

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos sam /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos sam /
translated: the dharmas of pratyekabuddhas;

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos sam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos sam /
translated: the dharmas of bodhisattvas;🔽and the dharmas of buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyis sems can rnams kyi don byed cing sems can de dag gi bya ba byed de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyis sems can rnams kyi don byed cing sems can de dag gi bya ba byed de /
translated: “He benefits beings through the dharmas of śrāvakas, the dharmas of pratyekabuddhas, the dharmas of bodhisattvas, and the dharmas of buddhas.

original: de la sems can ser sna can gang ji snyed pa de dag la 'di skad du chos ston te /
analyzed: de la sems can ser sna can gang ji snyed pa de dag la 'di skad du chos ston te /
translated: “To those beings who are stingy he teaches the Dharma like this:

original: sbyin pa byin cig /
analyzed: sbyin pa byin cig /
translated: Give generously!

original: phongs pa ni sdug bsngal ba ste /
analyzed: phongs pa ni sdug bsngal ba ste /
translated: “ ‘Poverty is suffering.

original: phongs pas ni bdag gi don kyang bya bar mi nus na /
analyzed: phongs pas ni bdag gi don kyang bya bar mi nus na /
translated: If you are poor, you will not be able to accomplish your own goals,

original: gzhan gyi don lta ci smos kyi /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don lta ci smos kyi /
translated: let alone the goals of others.

original: de ltar khyed kyis sbyin pa byin la bdag kyang bde bar gyis shig /
analyzed: de ltar khyed kyis sbyin pa byin la bdag kyang bde bar gyis shig /
translated: Therefore, you should give generously and make yourselves happy.

original: gzhan yang bde bar gyis shig /
analyzed: gzhan yang bde bar gyis shig /

original: phongs pas zil gyis non cing nying sha nying gis zos te /
analyzed: phongs pas zil gyis non cing nying sha nying gis zos te /
translated: If you are overcome by poverty and eat your own flesh,

original: ngan song gsum las mi thar bar gyur ta re /
analyzed: ngan song gsum las mi thar bar gyur ta re /
translated: you will not be liberated from the three lower realms.

original: zhes chos ston to; ;sems can tshul khrims ngan pa can ji snyed pa de dag la 'di skad du chos ston te /
analyzed: zhes chos ston to; ;sems can tshul khrims ngan pa can ji snyed pa de dag la 'di skad du chos ston te /
translated: ’ “To those who have bad conduct, they teach the Dharma as follows:

original: kye skyes bu dag /
analyzed: kye skyes bu dag /
translated: ‘Oh beings!

original: tshul khrims ngan pa ni sdug bsngal ba ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims ngan pa ni sdug bsngal ba ste /
translated: Bad conduct is suffering.

original: tshul khrims ngan pas ni bdag @441b gi don kyang bya bar mi nus na /
analyzed: tshul khrims ngan pas ni bdag @441b gi don kyang bya bar mi nus na /
translated: If you have bad conduct, you will not be able to accomplish your own goals,

original: gzhan gyi don lta ci smos te /🔽tshul khrims ngan pa'i rnam par smin pa ni sems can dmyal ba'am /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don lta ci smos te / tshul khrims ngan pa'i rnam par smin pa ni sems can dmyal ba'am /
translated: let alone the goals of others.🔽The ripening of bad conduct is rebirth as a hell being,🔽an animal,

original: byol song gi skye gnas sam /
analyzed: byol song gi skye gnas sam /
translated: or a

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten yin te; de ltar khyed ngan song gsum du lhung na /
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten yin te; de ltar khyed ngan song gsum du lhung na /
translated: If you fall into the three lower realms,

original: bdag cag kyang gdon par mi nus na /
analyzed: bdag cag kyang gdon par mi nus na /
translated: we will not be able to save you,

original: gzhan gdon pa lta ci smos kyi /
analyzed: gzhan gdon pa lta ci smos kyi /
translated: let alone others.

original: de'i phyir khyod kyis tshul khrims ngan pa'i sems 'ga' tsam gyi go skabs kyang mi dbye'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyod kyis tshul khrims ngan pa'i sems 'ga' tsam gyi go skabs kyang mi dbye'o //
translated: Therefore, you must not allow even the slightest opportunity for a negative attitude toward discipline.

original: phyis 'gyod pa can du gyur ta re /🔽zhes chos ston to //
analyzed: phyis 'gyod pa can du gyur ta re / zhes chos ston to //
translated: Be careful not to regret it later.🔽’

original: sems can phan tshun gnod sems su gyur pa ji snyed pa de dag la 'di skad du chos ston te /
analyzed: sems can phan tshun gnod sems su gyur pa ji snyed pa de dag la 'di skad du chos ston te /
translated: To those sentient beings who have harmful thoughts toward each other, they teach the Dharma like this:

original: de lta de ltar khyed gcig la gcig gnod sems sum byed cig /
analyzed: de lta de ltar khyed gcig la gcig gnod sems sum byed cig /
translated: ‘You should harm each other in this way and that.

original: sems 'khrugs par gyur pa la dge ba'i chos gang yang skye bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems 'khrugs par gyur pa la dge ba'i chos gang yang skye bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: When the mind is disturbed, no virtuous qualities can arise.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: khyed phan tshun sems 'khrugs par gyur na /🔽sems can dmyal bar skye ba'am /🔽byol song gi skye gnas su skye ba'am /
analyzed: khyed phan tshun sems 'khrugs par gyur na / sems can dmyal bar skye ba'am / byol song gi skye gnas su skye ba'am /
translated: if you disturb each other’s minds,🔽you will be reborn in the hells,🔽in the animal realm,

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten du skye ba'i gnas yin gyi /
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten du skye ba'i gnas yin gyi /
translated: or in the world of the Lord of Death.

original: de bas na khyed kyis 'khrugs pa'i sems 'ga' tsam gyi go skabs kyang mi dbye'o //
analyzed: de bas na khyed kyis 'khrugs pa'i sems 'ga' tsam gyi go skabs kyang mi dbye'o //
translated: Therefore, you should not give an opportunity to even a single thought of agitation.

original: phyis 'gyod pa can du gyur ta re /
analyzed: phyis 'gyod pa can du gyur ta re /
translated: Later, you will regret it.

original: zhes chos ston to //
analyzed: zhes chos ston to //
translated: Thus do they teach the Dharma.

original: sems can le lo can gang ji snyed pa de dag la 'di skad du chos ston te /
analyzed: sems can le lo can gang ji snyed pa de dag la 'di skad du chos ston te /
translated: “As for those sentient beings who are lazy, they are taught the Dharma like this:

original: kye skyes bu dag /
analyzed: kye skyes bu dag /
translated: ‘Oh people!

original: le lo ni sdug bsngal ba ste; le los ni bdag gi don kyang bya bar mi nus na /
analyzed: le lo ni sdug bsngal ba ste; le los ni bdag gi don kyang bya bar mi nus na /
translated: Laziness is suffering. If you are unable to accomplish your own purpose because of laziness,

original: gzhan gyi don lta ci smos te /🔽le lo'i rnam par srin pa ni sems can dmyal ba'am /🔽byol song gi skye gnas sam /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don lta ci smos te / le lo'i rnam par srin pa ni sems can dmyal ba'am / byol song gi skye gnas sam /
translated: what need is there to mention accomplishing the purpose of others?🔽The result of the maturation of laziness is the hells,🔽the animal realms,

original: gshin rje'i 'jig @442a *//🔽rten yin te /
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig @442a *// rten yin te /
translated: or the world of Yama.

original: de ltar khyed ngan song gsum du lhung na /
analyzed: de ltar khyed ngan song gsum du lhung na /
translated: If you fall into the three lower realms,

original: bdag cag kyang gdon par mi nus na /
analyzed: bdag cag kyang gdon par mi nus na /
translated: we will not be able to save you,

original: gzhan gdon pa lta ci smos kyi /
analyzed: gzhan gdon pa lta ci smos kyi /
translated: what need is there to mention saving others?

original: de'i phyir khyod kyis le lo'i sems 'ga' tsam gyi go skabs kyang mi dbye'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyod kyis le lo'i sems 'ga' tsam gyi go skabs kyang mi dbye'o //
translated: Therefore, you should not give an opportunity to even a single thought of laziness.

original: phyis 'gyod pa can du gyur ta re /
analyzed: phyis 'gyod pa can du gyur ta re /
translated: Later, you will regret it.

original: zhes chos ston to //
analyzed: zhes chos ston to //
translated: Thus do they teach the Dharma.

original: sems can sems g-yeng ba gang ji snyed pa de dag la 'di skad du chos ston te /
analyzed: sems can sems g-yeng ba gang ji snyed pa de dag la 'di skad du chos ston te /
translated: He teaches the Dharma to those sentient beings whose minds are distracted, saying:

original: kye skyes bu dag /
analyzed: kye skyes bu dag /
translated: ‘Oh, you men!

original: sems g-yeng ba ni sdug bsngal ba ste /
analyzed: sems g-yeng ba ni sdug bsngal ba ste /
translated: A distracted mind is suffering.

original: gang sems g-yeng ba'i rnam par smin pa ni sems can dmyal pa'am /🔽byol song gi skye gnas sam /
analyzed: gang sems g-yeng ba'i rnam par smin pa ni sems can dmyal pa'am / byol song gi skye gnas sam /
translated: The ripening of a distracted mind is the hells,🔽the animal world,

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten yin te /
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten yin te /
translated: or the world of Yama.

original: de ltar khyed ngan song gsum du lhung na /
analyzed: de ltar khyed ngan song gsum du lhung na /
translated: If you fall into the three lower realms,

original: bdag cag kyang gdon par mi nus na /
analyzed: bdag cag kyang gdon par mi nus na /
translated: we will not be able to save you,

original: gzhan gdon par lta ci smos kyi /
analyzed: gzhan gdon par lta ci smos kyi /
translated: let alone others.

original: de'i phyir khyed kyis g-yeng ba'i sems 'ga' tsam gyi go skabs kyang mi dbye'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyed kyis g-yeng ba'i sems 'ga' tsam gyi go skabs kyang mi dbye'o //
translated: Therefore, you should not allow even the opportunity for a distracted mind to arise.

original: phyis 'gyod pa can du gyur ta re /🔽zhes chos ston to //
analyzed: phyis 'gyod pa can du gyur ta re / zhes chos ston to //
translated: Later on, you will regret it.🔽’

original: sems can shes rab 'chal pa can gang ji snyed pa de dag la 'di skad du chos ston te /
analyzed: sems can shes rab 'chal pa can gang ji snyed pa de dag la 'di skad du chos ston te /
translated: He teaches the Dharma to those sentient beings who have bad wisdom, saying:

analyzed: kye skyes bu dag /

original: shes rab 'chal pa ni sdug bsngal ba ste /
analyzed: shes rab 'chal pa ni sdug bsngal ba ste /
translated: Bad wisdom is suffering.

original: shes rab 'chal bas ni bdag gi don kyang bya bar mi nus na /
analyzed: shes rab 'chal bas ni bdag gi don kyang bya bar mi nus na /
translated: “Those with poor wisdom are unable to accomplish even their own aims,

original: gzhan gyi don lta ci smos te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don lta ci smos te /
translated: let alone the aims of others.

original: gang shes rab 'chal pa'i rnam par smin pa ni sems can dmyal ba'am /

analyzed: byel song gi skye gnas sam / gshin rje'i 'jig rten yin te /

analyzed: de ltar khyed kyis shes rab 'chal pas sems 'ga' tsam gyi go skabs kyang mi @442b dbye'o //
translated: In this way, you will not even allow a single thought of poor wisdom to arise.

original: phyis 'gyod pa can du gyur ta re /
analyzed: phyis 'gyod pa can du gyur ta re /
translated: Later on, you will have regrets.

original: zhes chos ston to //
analyzed: zhes chos ston to //
translated: ” In this way, they teach the Dharma.

original: 'dod chags kyi spyod pa can gang ji snyed pa de dag ni mi sdug pa la sbyor ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi spyod pa can gang ji snyed pa de dag ni mi sdug pa la sbyor ro //

analyzed: zhe sdang gi spyod pa can gang ji snyed pa de dag ni byams pa la sbyor ro //
translated: Those who engage in anger are connected to love.

original: gti mug gi spyod pa can gang ji snyed pa de dag ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung pa la sbyor ro //
analyzed: gti mug gi spyod pa can gang ji snyed pa de dag ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung pa la sbyor ro //
translated: Those who engage in delusion are connected to dependent origination.

original: lam ngan par zhugs pa gang ji snyed pa de dag ni yang dag pa'i lam la sbyor te /
analyzed: lam ngan par zhugs pa gang ji snyed pa de dag ni yang dag pa'i lam la sbyor te /
translated: Those who have entered bad paths are connected to the right path.

original: nyan thos kyi lam mam /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi lam mam /
translated: the śrāvaka path,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi lam mam /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi lam mam /
translated: the pratyekabuddha path,

original: sangs rgyas kyi lam la sbyor zhing de dag la 'di skad du chos ston te //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi lam la sbyor zhing de dag la 'di skad du chos ston te //
translated: or the Buddha path, and he teaches them the doctrine as follows:

original: byed chos gang la mngon par zhen par gyur pa'i chos de dag ni ngo po nyid kyis stong ste /
analyzed: byed chos gang la mngon par zhen par gyur pa'i chos de dag ni ngo po nyid kyis stong ste /
translated: ‘Those doctrines to which you have become attached are empty of an intrinsic nature.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i chos rnams ni mngon par zhen par mi nus te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i chos rnams ni mngon par zhen par mi nus te /
translated: Doctrines that are empty of an intrinsic nature cannot be attached to.

original: stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa med do zhes chos ston te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa med do zhes chos ston te /
translated: Emptiness is not attached.’

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti, in this way, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: mngon par shes pa rnams la gnas shing sems can rnams kyi don byed pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams la gnas shing sems can rnams kyi don byed pa yin no //
translated: they remain in the superknowledges and work for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni mngon par shes pa rnams la ma gnas par sems can rnams la chos bstan par mi nus te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni mngon par shes pa rnams la ma gnas par sems can rnams la chos bstan par mi nus te /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings cannot teach the doctrine to sentient beings without remaining in the superknowledges.

original: lam gol bar zhugs pa'i sems can rnams kyang lam du gzud par mi nus so //
analyzed: lam gol bar zhugs pa'i sems can rnams kyang lam du gzud par mi nus so //
translated: and they are unable to lead beings who have entered wrong paths to the right path.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / bya 'dab ma med pas nam mkha' la 'gro bar mi nus so //
analyzed: dper na / bya 'dab ma med pas nam mkha' la 'gro bar mi nus so //
translated: a bird without wings is unable to fly in the sky.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' @443a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' @443a *//
translated: Subhūti, in the same way,

original: sems dpa' chen pos kyang mngon par shes pa rnams la ma brten par sems can rnams la chos bstan par mi nus so /
analyzed: sems dpa' chen pos kyang mngon par shes pa rnams la ma brten par sems can rnams la chos bstan par mi nus so /
translated: bodhisattva great beings are unable to teach the Dharma to beings without relying on the superknowledges.

original: rab 'byor / de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti, therefore, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: mngon par shes pa rnams mngon par sgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams mngon par sgrub par bya ste /
translated: they should accomplish the superknowledges.

original: de mngon par shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa de dag gis sems can rnams kyi don ci bya bar dga' pa de bde bar byed do //
analyzed: de mngon par shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa de dag gis sems can rnams kyi don ci bya bar dga' pa de bde bar byed do //
translated: With those accomplished superknowledges, they happily do whatever needs to be done for the sake of beings.

original: des lha'i mig gis shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag mthong ste /
analyzed: des lha'i mig gis shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag mthong ste /
translated: With the divine eye he sees the world systems of the eastern direction, as many as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā river.

original: de dag tu sems can gang ji snyed cig skyes pa de dag kyang mthong ngo //
analyzed: de dag tu sems can gang ji snyed cig skyes pa de dag kyang mthong ngo //
translated: He sees all the sentient beings who have been born there.

original: de ltar mthong nas kyang rdzu 'phrul gyis de dag tu song zhing sems can de dag gi sems sems kyis khong du chud par byas nas de dang mthun par sbyin pa'i gtam mam /
analyzed: de ltar mthong nas kyang rdzu 'phrul gyis de dag tu song zhing sems can de dag gi sems sems kyis khong du chud par byas nas de dang mthun par sbyin pa'i gtam mam /
translated: Having seen them, he goes there by means of his magical power, and having understood the minds of those sentient beings, he teaches them the Dharma in accordance with that, with a discourse on generosity,

original: tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi gtam mam /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi gtam mam /
translated: or a discourse on morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, and wisdom,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa'i gtam mam; 'byung ba'i gtam gyi bar du chos ston te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa'i gtam mam; 'byung ba'i gtam gyi bar du chos ston te /
translated: or a discourse on the noble truths, up to a discourse on dependent origination.

original: des lha'i mig gis lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed mthong ste /
analyzed: des lha'i mig gis lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed mthong ste /
translated: With the divine eye he sees the worlds in the southern, western, northern, northeastern, southeastern, southwestern, northwestern, lower, and upper directions, as many as there are sand particles in the Ganges river.

original: de dag tu sems can gang ji snyed cig skyes pa de dag kyang mthong ngo //
analyzed: de dag tu sems can gang ji snyed cig skyes pa de dag kyang mthong ngo //
translated: He sees all the sentient beings who are born in those worlds.

original: de ltar mthong nas kyang rdzu 'phrul gyis de dag tu song zhing @443b sems can de dag gi sems sems kyis khong du chud par byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar mthong nas kyang rdzu 'phrul gyis de dag tu song zhing @443b sems can de dag gi sems sems kyis khong du chud par byas nas /
translated: Having seen them, he goes to them by means of his magical power, and having understood their minds with his knowledge of the thoughts of others,🔽he teaches them the Dharma in accordance with their dispositions,

original: de dang mthun par sbyin pa'i gtam mam /🔽tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang shes rab kyi gtam mam /
analyzed: de dang mthun par sbyin pa'i gtam mam / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang shes rab kyi gtam mam /
translated: whether a talk on generosity,🔽a talk on morality, a talk on heaven,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa'i gtam mam /🔽'byung ba'i gtam gyi bar du chos ston to //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa'i gtam mam / 'byung ba'i gtam gyi bar du chos ston to //
translated: or a talk on the four noble truths.

original: des lha'i rna ba'i khams kyis 'di lta ste /
analyzed: des lha'i rna ba'i khams kyis 'di lta ste /
translated: With the divine ear, which is pure and surpasses the human, he hears both kinds of sounds, divine and human, those that are far and those that are near.

original: lha dang mi gnyis ka'i sgra'ang thos te; de shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na /
analyzed: lha dang mi gnyis ka'i sgra'ang thos te; de shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na /
translated: In the eastern direction, in as many world systems as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig chos ston pa de dag gi chos lha'i rna bas nyan te thos nas kyang de bzhin nyid du 'dzin to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig chos ston pa de dag gi chos lha'i rna bas nyan te thos nas kyang de bzhin nyid du 'dzin to //
translated: he hears the Dharma taught by as many blessed buddhas as there are. Having heard it, he retains it as it is.

original: de bzhin nyid du bzung nas de bzhin nyid du sems can rnams la chos ston te /🔽sbyin pa'i gtam mam /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du bzung nas de bzhin nyid du sems can rnams la chos ston te / sbyin pa'i gtam mam /
translated: Having retained it as it is, he teaches the Dharma to beings as it is.🔽He teaches the Dharma as a discourse on generosity,

original: tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi gtam mam /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi gtam mam /
translated: or on discipline, patience, diligence, concentration, and insight,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa'i gtam mam /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa'i gtam mam /
translated: or on the noble truths,

original: 'byung ba'i gtam gyi bar du chos ston to //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i gtam gyi bar du chos ston to //
translated: up to a discourse on emergence.

original: de lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig chos ston pa de dag gi chos lha'i rna bas nyan te thos nas kyang de bzhin nyid du 'dzin to //
analyzed: de lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig chos ston pa de dag gi chos lha'i rna bas nyan te thos nas kyang de bzhin nyid du 'dzin to //
translated: In the southern, western, northern, northeastern, southeastern, southwestern, and northwestern directions, below and above, in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, however many Bhagavān buddhas are teaching the Dharma, he listens to their Dharma with the divine ear. Having heard it, he retains it as it is.

original: de bzhin nyid du bzung nas /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du bzung nas /
translated: Having retained it as it is,

original: de bzhin nyid du sems can rnams la chos ston te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du sems can rnams la chos ston te /
translated: he teaches the Dharma to beings as it is.

original: sbyin pa'i gtam mam /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i gtam mam /
translated: He teaches the Dharma as a discourse on generosity,

original: tshul khrims @444a *//
analyzed: tshul khrims @444a *//
translated: on moral discipline,

original: dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi gtam mam /
analyzed: dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi gtam mam /
translated: on patience, perseverance, meditative concentration, and wisdom,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa'i gtam mam /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa'i gtam mam /
translated: or on the noble truths,

original: 'byung ba'i gtam gyi bar du chos ston to //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i gtam gyi bar du chos ston to //
translated: up to a discourse on emergence.

original: de sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa shin tu rnam par dag pa dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: de sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa shin tu rnam par dag pa dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: He possesses the knowledge of the categories of mind that is very pure.

original: de sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa des /
analyzed: de sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa des /
translated: “With that knowledge of the categories of mind,

original: sems can rnams kyi sems shes par byas shing /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi sems shes par byas shing /
translated: he knows the minds of beings

original: de dag la de bzhin nyid du chos ston te /
analyzed: de dag la de bzhin nyid du chos ston te /
translated: and teaches them the Dharma accordingly.

original: sbyin pa'i gtam mam /🔽tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi gtam mam; 'phags pa'i bden pa'i gtam mam /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i gtam mam / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi gtam mam; 'phags pa'i bden pa'i gtam mam /
translated: He teaches the Dharma of generosity,🔽the Dharma of moral discipline, patience, perseverance, concentration, and wisdom,

original: 'byung ba'i gtam gyi bar du chos ston to //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i gtam gyi bar du chos ston to //
translated: and the Dharma of the noble truths, up to the Dharma of emergence.

original: de bdag gam gzhan gyi sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma rjes su dran te /
analyzed: de bdag gam gzhan gyi sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma rjes su dran te /
translated: “He recollects his own and others’ previous lives in many ways.

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa des /
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa des /
translated: With that knowledge of recollecting past lives,

original: sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mtshan 'di zhes bya ba nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas par byung ngo zhes bya bar yang shes te /
analyzed: sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mtshan 'di zhes bya ba nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas par byung ngo zhes bya bar yang shes te /
translated: he knows that such-and-such a thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha appeared in the past, together with the saṅgha of hearers.

original: sems can sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa la mos pa gang ji snyed pa de dag la yang dag pa nyid du chos ston te /🔽sbyin pa'i gtam mam /🔽tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi gtam mam /
analyzed: sems can sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa la mos pa gang ji snyed pa de dag la yang dag pa nyid du chos ston te / sbyin pa'i gtam mam / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi gtam mam /
translated: He teaches the Dharma to those who are interested in the discourse on generosity,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa'i gtam mam /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa'i gtam mam /
translated: the discourse on moral discipline, the discourse on patience, the discourse on perseverance, the discourse on meditative stability, and the discourse on wisdom.🔽He teaches the Dharma to those who are interested in the discourse on the noble truths.

original: 'byung ba'i gtam gyis bar du chos ston to //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i gtam gyis bar du chos ston to //
translated: He teaches the Dharma to those who are interested in the discourse on arising.

original: de rdzu @444b 'phrul gyis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu song zhing /
analyzed: de rdzu @444b 'phrul gyis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu song zhing /
translated: “With his miraculous powers, he travels to the worlds in the ten directions, as numerous as the grains of sand in the Ganges river,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed de /
translated: and he serves the blessed buddhas.

original: bsnyen bkur byas nas mngon par shes pa'i ye shes kyis sems can rnams la chos ston te /
analyzed: bsnyen bkur byas nas mngon par shes pa'i ye shes kyis sems can rnams la chos ston te /
translated: Having served them, he teaches the Dharma to sentient beings with the wisdom of the superknowledges.

original: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi gtam mam /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi gtam mam /
translated: He teaches the discourse on generosity, the discourse on moral discipline, the discourse on patience, the discourse on perseverance, the discourse on meditative stability, and the discourse on wisdom.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa'i gtam mam /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa'i gtam mam /
translated: He teaches the discourse on the noble truths.

original: 'byung ba'i gtam gyi bar du chos ston to //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i gtam gyi bar du chos ston to //
translated: he teaches the Dharma up to the discourse on emergence.

original: de zag pa med pa mngon du bya ba'i shes pa shin tu rnam par dag pa dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: de zag pa med pa mngon du bya ba'i shes pa shin tu rnam par dag pa dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: “He is endowed with the knowledge of manifesting the uncontaminated,

original: de zag pa med pa mngon du bya ba'i shes pa shin tu rig pa des sems can rnams la chos ston te /🔽spyin pa'i gtam mam /
analyzed: de zag pa med pa mngon du bya ba'i shes pa shin tu rig pa des sems can rnams la chos ston te / spyin pa'i gtam mam /
translated: and with that knowledge of manifesting the uncontaminated he teaches the Dharma to sentient beings.🔽He teaches the Dharma up to the discourse on generosity,🔽the discourse on moral discipline,🔽the discourse on patience,

original: tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus par /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus par /
translated: the discourse on perseverance,🔽the discourse on meditative stabilization,

original: bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi gtam mam /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi gtam mam /
translated: the discourse on wisdom,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa'i gtam mam /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa'i gtam mam /
translated: the discourse on the noble truths,

original: 'byung ba'i gtam gyi bar du chos ston to //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i gtam gyi bar du chos ston to //
translated: and the discourse on emergence.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: mngon par shes pa rnams mngon par bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams mngon par bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: like that should accomplish the clairvoyances.

original: de mngon par shes pa shin tu 'dris pa de dag gis lus ci dang ji lta bu mongs su gzung bar 'dod pa de dang de lta bu'i lus yongs su bzung zhing mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
analyzed: de mngon par shes pa shin tu 'dris pa de dag gis lus ci dang ji lta bu mongs su gzung bar 'dod pa de dang de lta bu'i lus yongs su bzung zhing mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
translated: With those very well-developed superknowledges, he takes on whatever kind of body he wishes, and he works for the welfare of beings in accordance with their wishes.

original: bde ba'am sdug bsngal ba de dag gis gos par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba'am sdug bsngal ba de dag gis gos par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He is not affected by their happiness or suffering.

original: rab 'byor / 'di @445a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di @445a *//
translated: Subhūti,

original: lta ste / dper na /
analyzed: lta ste / dper na /
translated: it is like this:

original: de bzhin gshegs pas sprul pa'i skyes bu ni dgos pa thams cad byed kyang bde ba'am sdug bsngal des gos par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas sprul pa'i skyes bu ni dgos pa thams cad byed kyang bde ba'am sdug bsngal des gos par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: a person emanated by a Tathāgata would perform all the necessary actions, but would not be affected by happiness or suffering.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing mngon par shes pas rnam par rtse zhing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing mngon par shes pas rnam par rtse zhing /
translated: Subhūti, in the same way, a bodhisattva great being standing in the perfection of wisdom, playing with the superknowledges,

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos ston kyang bde ba'am sdug bsngal pa des 'phrogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos ston kyang bde ba'am sdug bsngal pa des 'phrogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: although they teach the Dharma in accordance with their aspirations in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges in the ten directions, they are not carried away by that happiness or suffering.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom

original: de ltar mngon par shes pas rnam par rtse bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar mngon par shes pas rnam par rtse bar bya ste /
translated: they should play with the superknowledges in that way.

original: ci nas kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par 'gyur ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par 'gyur pa de ltar rtse bar bya ste /
analyzed: ci nas kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par 'gyur ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par 'gyur pa de ltar rtse bar bya ste /
translated: They should play in such a way that they purify a buddhafield and bring beings to maturity.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par ma byas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par ma byas /
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings have not purified a buddhafield

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin par ma byas par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin par ma byas par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so //
translated: Without bringing beings to maturity, one cannot fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rab 'byor / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Subhūti, why is that?

original: lam gyi yan lag dang mi ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub med do //
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag dang mi ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub med do //
translated: Unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is not in a bodhisattva great being who is not endowed with the branches of the path.

original: rab 'byor gyis @445b gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis @445b gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lam gyi yan lag yongs su rdzogs par bgyis shing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lam gyi yan lag yongs su rdzogs par bgyis shing /
translated: how do bodhisattva great beings complete the branches of the path

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i lam de dag gang lags /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i lam de dag gang lags /
translated: and fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / dge ba'i chos thams cad ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lam gyi yan lag go /
analyzed: rab 'byor / dge ba'i chos thams cad ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lam gyi yan lag go /
translated: “Subhūti, all wholesome dharmas are branches of the path of bodhisattva great beings.🔽” Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: lam gyi yan lag gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos de dag gang lags ////
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos de dag gang lags ////
translated: what are those wholesome dharmas that are branches of the path by which they will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa /🔽bam po bdun cu bzhi pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa / bam po bdun cu bzhi pa /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-Five Thousand Lines

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: “Starting from the first production of the thought,

original: dge ba'i chos sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing de yongs su gtong pa'i tshe; ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing de yongs su gtong pa'i tshe; ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni sbyin pa'o //
translated: they practice wholesome dharmas, the perfection of generosity, but do not conceptualize it. When they give it away, because of the emptiness of inherent existence, they think, ‘This is generosity.

original: 'di la yongs su gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la yongs su gtang bar bya'o //
translated: I should give this away.

original: bdag gis sbyin par bya'o zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: bdag gis sbyin par bya'o zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
translated: One does not conceptualize in terms of I will give, this is the gift, and I am giving to him.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
translated: The perfection of generosity by which one liberates oneself from cyclic existence and liberates others is a virtuous quality that is a factor of the path.

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /🔽dge ba'i chos tshul khrims @446a *//
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste / dge ba'i chos tshul khrims @446a *//
translated: From the time one first generates the mind of enlightenment🔽up to the time one sits on the seat of enlightenment,

original: kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang /
analyzed: kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang /
translated: one practices the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of effort, the perfection of meditation, and the perfection of wisdom.

original: de la mi rtog cing shes rab sgom pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de la mi rtog cing shes rab sgom pa'i tshe /
translated: When one cultivates wisdom, one does not conceptualize in terms of🔽this is wisdom, I am cultivating wisdom, and I am cultivating wisdom for the sake of this.

original: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni shes rab bo //
translated: Because of the emptiness of essential nature, this is wisdom.

original: bdag gis shes rab sgom mo //
analyzed: bdag gis shes rab sgom mo //
translated: I am cultivating wisdom.

original: 'di'i don du shes rab sgom mo zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: 'di'i don du shes rab sgom mo zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
translated: For the sake of this, I am cultivating wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
translated: The perfection of wisdom by which one liberates oneself from cyclic existence and liberates others is the virtuous factor that is a branch of the path.

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: From the time of generating the first thought of awakening,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i chos stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i chos stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang /
translated: the virtuous factors of the bodhisattva mahāsattva are all the emptinesses, the factors of awakening, the four noble truths, the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions,

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang /
translated: the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions, the emptiness gate of liberation, the signlessness gate of liberation, the wishlessness gate of liberation, the higher perceptions, the meditative stabilizations,

original: gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje @446b chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyod kyang /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje @446b chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyod kyang /
translated: They practice the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas,

original: de la mi rtog cing sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad bsgom pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de la mi rtog cing sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad bsgom pa'i tshe /
translated: but they do not conceptualize them. When they are cultivating the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas,

original: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams so //
translated: because of the emptiness of inherent existence, they do not conceptualize the three—‘these are the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas,’

original: bdag gis sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams bsgom par bya'o //
translated: ‘I should cultivate the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas,’

original: 'di'i don du sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams bsgom mo zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: 'di'i don du sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams bsgom mo zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
translated: and ‘I am cultivating the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas for the sake of this.’

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
translated: The unshared qualities of the Buddha are the virtuous qualities that are branches of the path, by which one liberates oneself from cyclic existence and liberates others.

original: rab 'byor / dge pa'i chos de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / dge pa'i chos de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam ste /
translated: Subhūti, those virtuous qualities are the path of the bodhisattva great beings’ unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: lam des 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams sems can tshad med pa rnams ded de /
analyzed: lam des 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams sems can tshad med pa rnams ded de /
translated: By that path, bodhisattva great beings of the past, present, and future have led, are leading, and will lead innumerable beings

original: 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las brgal bar gyur pa dang / rgal ba dang / brgal bar 'gyur ba ste; lam de yongs su rdzogs par byas shing /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las brgal bar gyur pa dang / rgal ba dang / brgal bar 'gyur ba ste; lam de yongs su rdzogs par byas shing /
translated: across the ocean of cyclic existence, and by perfecting that path,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed do //
translated: the bodhisattva great beings have attained, are attaining, and will attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byas nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byas nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro //
translated: Having attained the knowledge of all modes, he turns the wheel of the Dharma.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor te /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor te /
translated: Having turned the wheel of the Dharma,

original: sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
translated: he works for the welfare of beings.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-five Thousand Lines

original: le'u @447a *// drug cu bdun no ////
analyzed: le'u @447a *// drug cu bdun no ////
translated: Chapter: Sixty-Seven

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: gal te chos de dag byang chub sems dpa'i chos lags na /
analyzed: gal te chos de dag byang chub sems dpa'i chos lags na /
translated: if those dharmas are the bodhisattva’s dharmas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos gang lags /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos gang lags /
translated: what are the dharmas of a buddha?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / gang 'di skad du gal te chos de dag byang chub sems dpa'i chos yin na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang 'di skad du gal te chos de dag byang chub sems dpa'i chos yin na /
translated: “Subhūti, you have said, ‘If those dharmas are the bodhisattva’s dharmas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos gang yin zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos gang yin zhes zer ba ni /
translated: what are the dharmas of a buddha?’

original: rab 'byor / sangs rgyas kyi chos kyang chos de dag nyid rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar zad de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sangs rgyas kyi chos kyang chos de dag nyid rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar zad de /
translated: “Subhūti, the qualities of a buddha are just those dharmas, which are fully awakened to in every way.

original: de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob nas bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad yongs su spong ngo //
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob nas bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad yongs su spong ngo //
translated: Having attained the knowledge of all aspects, he abandons all the latent dispositions.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva is the one who is fully awakened.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni chos thams cad skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni chos thams cad skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas /
translated: The tathāgata, arhat, perfectly awakened buddha is the one who is fully awakened to all dharmas with the wisdom that is conjoined with a single instant.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro ste /
translated: He is counted as a tathāgata.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la khyad par de yod do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la khyad par de yod do //
translated: There is this difference between the bodhisattva mahāsattva and the tathāgata, arhat, perfectly awakened buddha.”🔽“Lord, if all dharmas are like a dream, like a mirage, like an apparition, like a phantom, like a reflected image, like an echo, like an optical illusion, like a magical creation, and like an emanation, how, Lord, can one distinguish the ten wholesome paths of action from the ten unwholesome paths of action, and so on up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha?

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / zhugs pa yang gzhan la /
analyzed: dper na / zhugs pa yang gzhan la /
translated: the one who is on the path and

original: 'bras bu la gnas pa'ang @447b gzhan te /
analyzed: 'bras bu la gnas pa'ang @447b gzhan te /
translated: the one who is abiding in the result are different,

original: de gnyis ka'ang 'phags pa'i gang zag ma yin zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis ka'ang 'phags pa'i gang zag ma yin zhes mi bya'o //
translated: but it is not the case that neither of them is an ārya being.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bar chad med pa'i lam du zhugs pa yin; de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni chos thams cad la sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes brnyes pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bar chad med pa'i lam du zhugs pa yin; de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni chos thams cad la sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes brnyes pa ste /
translated: Subhūti, in the same way, the bodhisattva mahāsattva is on the uninterrupted path, and the tathāgata, arhat, perfectly enlightened buddha has attained the wisdom that is unobstructed with regard to all phenomena.

original: rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom ba yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom ba yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi khyad par ro //
translated: Subhūti, that is the difference between the bodhisattva mahāsattva and the tathāgata, arhat, perfectly enlightened buddha.”

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gal te chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa lags na rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos de dag la 'di ni sems can dmyal ba pa'o //🔽'di ni byol song gi skye gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa lags na rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos de dag la 'di ni sems can dmyal ba pa'o // 'di ni byol song gi skye gnas pa'o //
translated: “If all phenomena are empty of their own characteristics, how can one distinguish and differentiate these phenomena that are empty of their own characteristics, saying, ‘This is a hell being,🔽this is an animal,

original: 'di ni gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'o //
translated: this is a hungry ghost,

original: 'di ni lha'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lha'o //
translated: this is a god,

original: 'di ni mi'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mi'o //
translated: this is a human,

original: 'di ni rigs kyi sa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rigs kyi sa'o //
translated: this is the level of the spiritual family,

original: 'di ni brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni brgyad pa'o //
translated: this is the eighth,

original: 'di ni rgyun du zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyun du zhugs pa'o //
translated: this is a stream enterer,

original: 'di ni lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'o //
translated: this is a once-returner,

original: 'di ni phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
translated: this is a non-returner,

original: 'di ni dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: this is a worthy one,

original: 'di ni rang sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: 'di ni rang sangs rgyas so //
translated: this is a pratyekabuddha,

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: this is a bodhisattva,

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so; ;zhes bgyi bar khyad par dang / rnam par dbye bar ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so; ;zhes bgyi bar khyad par dang / rnam par dbye bar ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: and this is a thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha’?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ji ltar gang zag de dag dmigs su ma mchis pa de bzhin du las kyang dmigs su ma mchis @448a *//
analyzed: ji ltar gang zag de dag dmigs su ma mchis pa de bzhin du las kyang dmigs su ma mchis @448a *//
translated: Just as those persons are not apprehended, so too karma is not apprehended.

original: las ji ltar dmigs su ma mchis pa de bzhin du las kyi rnam par smin pa la'ang dmigs su ma mchis so //
analyzed: las ji ltar dmigs su ma mchis pa de bzhin du las kyi rnam par smin pa la'ang dmigs su ma mchis so //
translated: Just as karma is not apprehended, so too the ripening of karma is not apprehended.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //🔽de de bzhin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no // de de bzhin te /
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!🔽It is just as you have said!

original: ji skad du smras pa de bzhin te /
analyzed: ji skad du smras pa de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said!

original: chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa la las dang las kyi rnam par smin pa mi dmigs so; ;rab 'byor /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa la las dang las kyi rnam par smin pa mi dmigs so; ;rab 'byor /
translated: In the emptiness of inherent characteristics, karma and the ripening of karma are not apprehended.

original: gang gis rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos thams cad de ltar ma shes pa de dag ni ngan par spyod pa 'am /
analyzed: gang gis rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos thams cad de ltar ma shes pa de dag ni ngan par spyod pa 'am /
translated: Subhūti, those who do not know in that way that all phenomena are empty of inherent characteristics, they create karma that is bad,

original: legs par spyad pa 'am /
analyzed: legs par spyad pa 'am /
translated: karma that is good,

original: mi g-yo ba'i las mngon par 'du byed de /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i las mngon par 'du byed de /
translated: and karma that is unshakable.

original: de dag ngan par spyad pa'i las kyis ngan song gsum du lhung ngo //
analyzed: de dag ngan par spyad pa'i las kyis ngan song gsum du lhung ngo //
translated: Due to their bad karma, they fall into the three lower realms.

original: legs par spyad pa'i las kyis lha dang mir skye'o //🔽nyams pa med pa'i las kyis gzugs kyi khams sam /
analyzed: legs par spyad pa'i las kyis lha dang mir skye'o // nyams pa med pa'i las kyis gzugs kyi khams sam /
translated: By means of wholesome actions, one is reborn as a god or human.🔽By means of uncorrupted actions, one is reborn in the form realm or

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su skye'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su skye'o //
translated: the formless realm.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad /
translated: “Therein, the bodhisattva mahāsattva practices the perfection of generosity,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad /
translated: the perfection of discipline, the perfection of patience, the perfection of diligence, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom.

original: nang stong pa nyid la spyod /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid la spyod /
translated: He practices inner emptiness,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la spyad /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la spyad /
translated: up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la spyad /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la spyad /
translated: He practices the applications of mindfulness,

original: yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa @448b rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyad /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa @448b rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyad /
translated: and the noble eightfold path.🔽“They practice the noble truths,🔽the concentrations,🔽the immeasurables,🔽the formless absorptions,🔽the liberations,🔽the serial absorptions,🔽the emptiness gate of liberation,🔽the signlessness gate of liberation,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang; tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang; tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang /
translated: and the wishlessness gate of liberation.🔽“They practice the clairvoyances,🔽the meditative stabilizations,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la spyod /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la spyod /
translated: and the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyad de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyad de /
translated: They practice the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: nyams pa med pa'i spyod pas byang chub kyi lam bskyed nas /
analyzed: nyams pa med pa'i spyod pas byang chub kyi lam bskyed nas /
translated: Having generated the path to enlightenment through practice that is not deficient,

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin byang chub kyi yan lag gi 'khor dang ldan pa la mnyam par bzhag cing /
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin byang chub kyi yan lag gi 'khor dang ldan pa la mnyam par bzhag cing /
translated: they rest in equipoise in the vajra-like meditative stabilization that is accompanied by the factors of awakening.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /
translated: They fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: Having fully awakened,

original: sems can rnams kyi don byed de /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don byed de /
translated: they work for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: don byas nas ci nas kyang phyis chud zos shing rgyud lnga'i 'khor bar mi ltung ba de ltar don byed do //
analyzed: don byas nas ci nas kyang phyis chud zos shing rgyud lnga'i 'khor bar mi ltung ba de ltar don byed do //
translated: Having worked for their welfare, they work for the welfare of sentient beings in such a way that they will not later fall into the five transmigrations of cyclic existence and be wasted.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Blessed One,

original: ci lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas @449a *//
analyzed: ci lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas @449a *//
translated: “Is it that the Lord, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: rgyud lnga'i 'khor ba gzigs sam /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: rgyud lnga'i 'khor ba gzigs sam / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: has seen the five classes of transmigrating beings in cyclic existence?”

original: rab 'byor / ma yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / ma yin no //
translated: The Lord said, “No, Subhūti, it is not like that.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Lord,

original: ci lags / de bzhin gshegs pas chos nag po'am /
analyzed: ci lags / de bzhin gshegs pas chos nag po'am /
translated: is it that the Tathāgata has apprehended a dharma that is black,

original: dkar po'am / gnag pa'am /
analyzed: dkar po'am / gnag pa'am /
translated: or white, or dark,

original: dkar ba'am / mi gnag mi dkar ba dmigs lags sam /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dkar ba'am / mi gnag mi dkar ba dmigs lags sam / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: or light, or not black and not not black, not white and not not white?”

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: The Lord said, “No, Subhūti, it is not like that.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Lord,

original: de ste ma dmigs na /🔽sems can dmyal ba'am /🔽byol song gi skye gnas sam /
analyzed: de ste ma dmigs na / sems can dmyal ba'am / byol song gi skye gnas sam /
translated: if it is not like that,🔽how will you designate a hell being,🔽an animal,

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten du ji ltar gdags pa mdzad /
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten du ji ltar gdags pa mdzad /
translated: or a world of Yama,

original: lha dang mir ji ltar gdags pa mdzad /
analyzed: lha dang mir ji ltar gdags pa mdzad /
translated: or designate a god or a human?”

original: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas su ji ltar gdags pa mdzad /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas su ji ltar gdags pa mdzad /
translated: the once-returner, the non-returner, the worthy one, and the pratyekabuddha?

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su ji ltar gdags pa mdzad /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su ji ltar gdags pa mdzad /
translated: how does he designate the bodhisattva and the tathāgata, worthy one, perfectly complete buddha?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / ci sems can 'di dag chos rnams rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par shes sam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ci sems can 'di dag chos rnams rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par shes sam /
translated: “Subhūti, do these sentient beings know that dharmas are empty of their own marks?”

original: gsol pa / ma lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa / ma lags so //
translated: He replied, “No, they do not.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / gal te sems can 'di dag 'di ltar chos rnams rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong ngo zhes bya bar shes na ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te sems can 'di dag 'di ltar chos rnams rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong ngo zhes bya bar shes na ni /
translated: “Subhūti, if these sentient beings knew that dharmas are empty of their own marks,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs @449b pa'i byang chub tu mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs @449b pa'i byang chub tu mi 'jug ste /
translated: then the bodhisattva great beings would not enter into unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ma zhugs na /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ma zhugs na /
translated: If they had not entered into unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: sems can rnams kyang ngan song gsum dang / 'khor ba'i rgyud rnams nas mi 'grol te /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang ngan song gsum dang / 'khor ba'i rgyud rnams nas mi 'grol te /
translated: they would not liberate beings from the three lower realms and the realms of cyclic existence.

original: rab 'byor / sems can de dag chos rnams rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par mi shes la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sems can de dag chos rnams rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par mi shes la /
translated: Subhūti, those beings do not know that dharmas are empty of their own marks,

original: mi shes pas rgyud lnga'i 'khor ba las yongs su mi 'grol bas /
analyzed: mi shes pas rgyud lnga'i 'khor ba las yongs su mi 'grol bas /
translated: and because they do not know that, they are not liberated from the five realms of cyclic existence.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par thos nas sems can rnams kyi don du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'jug ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par thos nas sems can rnams kyi don du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'jug ste /
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings, having heard from those buddha bhagavāns that all dharmas are empty of their own marks, enter into unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening for the sake of beings.

original: chos 'di dag ni ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis mngon par chags par bya ba de ltar yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis mngon par chags par bya ba de ltar yod pa ma yin na /
translated: “These dharmas do not exist as they are clung to by foolish, ordinary beings.

original: de dag ni med cing yang dag pa ma yin pa'i chos rnams la yod par btags shing /
analyzed: de dag ni med cing yang dag pa ma yin pa'i chos rnams la yod par btags shing /
translated: They are imputations of existence onto nonexistent and unreal phenomena.

original: sems can med pa la sems can du 'du shes /
analyzed: sems can med pa la sems can du 'du shes /
translated: They are perceptions of sentient beings where there are no sentient beings.

original: gzugs med pa la gzugs su 'du shes /
analyzed: gzugs med pa la gzugs su 'du shes /
translated: They are perceptions of form where there is no form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa med pa la rnam par shes par 'du shes /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa med pa la rnam par shes par 'du shes /
translated: They are perceptions of consciousness where there is no feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness.

original: skye mched rnams med pa la skye mched du 'du shes /
analyzed: skye mched rnams med pa la skye mched du 'du shes /
translated: They are perceptions of sense sources where there are no sense sources.

original: khams rnams med pa la khams su 'du shes /🔽rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams med pa la /
analyzed: khams rnams med pa la khams su 'du shes / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams med pa la /
translated: They are perceptions of elements where there are no elements.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar 'du shes /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar 'du shes /
translated: They are perceptions of dependent origination

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos med pa la /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos med pa la /
translated: where there is no dependent origination.

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos su 'du shes /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos su 'du shes /
translated: They are perceptions of mundane phenomena

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos med pa la /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos med pa la /
translated: where there are no mundane phenomena.

original: 'jig @450a *// rten las 'das pa'i chos su 'du shes /
analyzed: 'jig @450a *// rten las 'das pa'i chos su 'du shes /
translated: They are perceptions of supramundane phenomena

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos med pa la /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos med pa la /
translated: where there are no supramundane phenomena.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos su 'du shes /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos su 'du shes /
translated: They are perceptions of phenomena with defilements🔽where there are no phenomena with defilements.🔽They are perceptions of phenomena without defilements

original: zag pa med pa'i chos med pa la /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos med pa la /
translated: where there are no phenomena without defilements.

original: zag pa med pa'i chos su 'du shes /🔽'dus byas kyi chos med pa la /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos su 'du shes / 'dus byas kyi chos med pa la /
translated: They perceive uncontaminated phenomena.

original: 'dus byas kyi chos su 'du shes /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos su 'du shes /
translated: They perceive conditioned phenomena

original: 'dus ma byas kyi chos med pa la /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi chos med pa la /
translated: where there are no conditioned phenomena.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi chos su 'du shes nas /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi chos su 'du shes nas /
translated: They perceive unconditioned phenomena🔽where there are no unconditioned phenomena.

original: yod pa ma yin pa'i phyin ci log gis /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa'i phyin ci log gis /
translated: Through the error of what does not exist,🔽those who have minds that are erroneous create karmic formations of body, speech, and mind.

original: phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i sems dang ldan pa rnams lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las mngon par 'du byed pa de dag rgyud lnga'i 'khor ba las yongs su mi 'grol ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i sems dang ldan pa rnams lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las mngon par 'du byed pa de dag rgyud lnga'i 'khor ba las yongs su mi 'grol ba'i phyir /
translated: Because of that, they are not liberated from the five existences in saṃsāra.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par dge ba'i chos thams cad 'dus par byas te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par dge ba'i chos thams cad 'dus par byas te /
