translated: Bodhisattva great beings, having gathered all wholesome dharmas into the perfection of wisdom,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod cing /
translated: practice bodhisattva conduct

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: and fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas rgyud lnga'i 'khor ba las sems can rnams yongs su 'grel to //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas rgyud lnga'i 'khor ba las sems can rnams yongs su 'grel to //
translated: having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, they liberate sentient beings from the five forms of rebirth in cyclic existence.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: gal te chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa lags na /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa lags na /
translated: “If all phenomena are empty of their own defining characteristics,

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: how will bodhisattva great beings fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: rgyud lnga'i 'khor ba las sems can rnams yongs su 'grel ba @450b lags /
analyzed: rgyud lnga'i 'khor ba las sems can rnams yongs su 'grel ba @450b lags /
translated: and liberate sentient beings from the five forms of rebirth in cyclic existence?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: “Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,🔽and

original: sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba dang / sdug bsngal 'gog pa dang / sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam sems can rnams la ston to //🔽'chad do // 'jog go /🔽'god do // 'grel to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba dang / sdug bsngal 'gog pa dang / sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam sems can rnams la ston to // 'chad do // 'jog go / 'god do // 'grel to //
translated: He teaches beings the four noble truths: suffering, the origin of suffering, the cessation of suffering, and the path leading to the cessation of suffering.🔽He explains, establishes,🔽and elucidates them.

original: rnam par 'grel to //
analyzed: rnam par 'grel to //
translated: He elucidates,

original: gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: gsal bar byed do //
translated: makes them clear,

original: yang dag par brjod do //
analyzed: yang dag par brjod do //
translated: and expresses them correctly.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po 'dir dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi phyogs gang ji snyed pa gang gis dkon mchog gsum rnam par dgod pa de thams cad yongs su 'dus te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po 'dir dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi phyogs gang ji snyed pa gang gis dkon mchog gsum rnam par dgod pa de thams cad yongs su 'dus te /
translated: All the wholesome states that are aspects of awakening, in which the Three Jewels are established, are included in these four noble truths.

original: sangs rgyas dkon mchog dang / chos dkon mchog dang / dge 'dun dkon mchog gsum 'jig rten du byung bas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dkon mchog dang / chos dkon mchog dang / dge 'dun dkon mchog gsum 'jig rten du byung bas /
translated: Because the Three Jewels—the Buddha Jewel, the Dharma Jewel, and the Saṅgha Jewel—have appeared in the world,

original: sems can rnams lam rgyud lnga'i 'khor ba las yongs su 'grel lo //
analyzed: sems can rnams lam rgyud lnga'i 'khor ba las yongs su 'grel lo //
translated: beings are liberated from the five classes of beings in saṃsāra.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: sdug bsngal 'tshal bas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'tshal bas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ram /
translated: will they attain complete nirvāṇa by knowing suffering?

original: 'on te sdug bsngal gyis mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on te sdug bsngal gyis mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur /
translated: Or is nirvana attained through suffering?🔽Is nirvana attained through the knowledge of the origin of suffering?

original: kun 'byung ba 'tshal bas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ram /🔽'on te kun 'byung bas mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur /🔽sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'tshal bas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ram /🔽'on te sdug bsngal @451a *//
analyzed: kun 'byung ba 'tshal bas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ram / 'on te kun 'byung bas mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur / sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'tshal bas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ram / 'on te sdug bsngal @451a *//
translated: Or is nirvana attained through the origin of suffering?🔽Is nirvana attained through the knowledge of the cessation of suffering?

original: 'gog pas mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur /🔽lam 'tshal pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: 'gog pas mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur / lam 'tshal pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ram /
translated: Or is nirvana attained through the cessation of suffering?🔽Is nirvana attained through the knowledge of the path?

original: 'on te lam gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on te lam gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur /
translated: Or is nirvana attained through the path?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: rab 'byor / sdug bsngal shes pas yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sdug bsngal shes pas yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ste /
translated: Subhūti, nirvana is not attained through the knowledge of suffering,

original: sdug bsngal gyis kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis kyang ma yin no //
translated: nor is it attained through suffering.

original: kun 'byung ba shes pas yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba shes pas yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ste /
translated: Nirvana is not attained through the knowledge of the origin of suffering,

original: kun 'byung bas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: kun 'byung bas kyang ma yin no //
translated: nor is it attained through the origin of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal 'gog pa shes pas yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog pa shes pas yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ste /
translated: One does not attain final Nirvaṇa through the knowledge of the cessation of suffering,

original: sdug bsngal 'gog pas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog pas kyang ma yin no //
translated: nor does one attain final Nirvaṇa through the cessation of suffering.

original: lam shes pas yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: lam shes pas yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ste /
translated: One does not attain final Nirvaṇa through the knowledge of the path,

original: lam gyis kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: lam gyis kyang ma yin no //
translated: nor does one attain final Nirvaṇa through the path.

original: rab 'byor / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po de dag mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa de ni mya ngan las 'da' bar ngas gsungs te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po de dag mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa de ni mya ngan las 'da' bar ngas gsungs te /
translated: Subhūti, I have taught that final Nirvaṇa is the sameness of those four noble truths.

original: sdug bsngal shes pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma yin /
analyzed: sdug bsngal shes pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma yin /
translated: One does not attain final Nirvaṇa through the knowledge of suffering,

original: sdug bsngal gyis kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis kyang ma yin no //
translated: nor does one attain final Nirvaṇa through suffering.

original: kun 'byung ba shes pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma yin /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba shes pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma yin /
translated: One does not attain final Nirvaṇa through the knowledge of the origin,

original: kun 'byung bas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: kun 'byung bas kyang ma yin no //
translated: nor does one attain final Nirvaṇa through the origin.

original: sdug bsngal 'gog pa shes pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma yin /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog pa shes pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma yin /
translated: One does not attain final Nirvaṇa through the knowledge of the cessation of suffering,

original: sdug bsngal 'gog pas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog pas kyang ma yin no //
translated: nor does one attain final Nirvaṇa through the cessation of suffering.

original: lam shes pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma yin /
analyzed: lam shes pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma yin /
translated: One does not attain final Nirvaṇa through the knowledge of the path,

original: lam gyis kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: lam gyis kyang ma yin no //
translated: nor does one attain final Nirvaṇa through the path.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: gang la sdug bsngal yang ma mchis @451b sdug bsngal 'tshal ba'ang ma mchis /🔽kun 'byung ba'ang ma mchis /
analyzed: gang la sdug bsngal yang ma mchis @451b sdug bsngal 'tshal ba'ang ma mchis / kun 'byung ba'ang ma mchis /
translated: Where there is no suffering and no one who knows suffering,🔽no origin,

original: kun 'byung ba 'tshal ba'ang ma mchis /🔽'gog pa'ang ma mchis /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba 'tshal ba'ang ma mchis / 'gog pa'ang ma mchis /
translated: and no one who knows origin,🔽no cessation,

original: 'gog pa 'tshal ba'ang ma mchis /
analyzed: 'gog pa 'tshal ba'ang ma mchis /
translated: and no one who knows cessation,

original: lam yang ma mchis /
analyzed: lam yang ma mchis /
translated: no path,

original: lam 'tshal ba'ang ma mchis pa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi mnyam pa nyid ces bgyi ba de dag gang lags /
analyzed: lam 'tshal ba'ang ma mchis pa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi mnyam pa nyid ces bgyi ba de dag gang lags /
translated: and no one who knows the path, what are those called the ‘four noble truths that are the same as suchness’?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: de ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po de dag gi de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos kyi gnas nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang /🔽yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
analyzed: de ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po de dag gi de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos kyi gnas nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
translated: “It is the suchness of those four noble truths, the unmistaken suchness, the unaltered suchness, the nature, the dharma-constituent, the establishment of dharmas, the certification of dharmas,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste /
translated: whether tathāgatas appear or not.

original: de bzhin gnas pa'i dbyings chos kyi dbyings mi nyams mi 'grib par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gnas pa'i dbyings chos kyi dbyings mi nyams mi 'grib par 'jug pa ste /
translated: and likewise, the realm of phenomena, the expanse of reality, is entered into without decline or diminution.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: bden pa khong du chud bar ji ltar bya ba bzhin du bden pa khong du chud par bya ba'i don du spyod do //
analyzed: bden pa khong du chud bar ji ltar bya ba bzhin du bden pa khong du chud par bya ba'i don du spyod do //
translated: they practice for the sake of realizing the truth just as it is.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar spyod na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar spyod na /
translated: how do bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom

original: bden pa rtogs pa'i don du spyod pa lags /
analyzed: bden pa rtogs pa'i don du spyod pa lags /
translated: in order to realize the truth?

original: ji ltar spyod na bden pa rtogs shing 'tshal te /🔽khong du chud nas nyan thos kyi sa'am /🔽rang sangs rgyas kyi @452a *//
analyzed: ji ltar spyod na bden pa rtogs shing 'tshal te / khong du chud nas nyan thos kyi sa'am / rang sangs rgyas kyi @452a *//
translated: How do they practice, realizing and understanding the truth,🔽without falling into the level of the śrāvakas

original: sar mi ltung zhing /
analyzed: sar mi ltung zhing /
translated: or the level of the pratyekabuddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par 'jug pa lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par 'jug pa lags /
translated: and enter into the faultlessness of the bodhisattvas?🔽The Blessed One said,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhuti: Here a Bodhisattva, a great being who courses in the perfection of wisdom,

original: chos de dag ci nas kyang chos gang yang dmigs su med pa de ltar mthong ste /🔽chos thams cad ma dmigs pas bden par rtogs pa'am /
analyzed: chos de dag ci nas kyang chos gang yang dmigs su med pa de ltar mthong ste / chos thams cad ma dmigs pas bden par rtogs pa'am /
translated: sees all these dharmas in such a way that he does not apprehend any dharma at all.🔽Since he does not apprehend any dharma, he does not review any dharma as true or untrue.

original: bden par ma gtogs pa'i chos thams cad stong par mthong ste /🔽des de ltar mthong bas skyon med par chud pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rigs kyi sa la gnas par gyur te /
analyzed: bden par ma gtogs pa'i chos thams cad stong par mthong ste / des de ltar mthong bas skyon med par chud pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rigs kyi sa la gnas par gyur te /
translated: He sees all dharmas as empty.🔽When he sees thus, he enters on the certainty that he will win the supreme enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de rigs kyi sa la gnas par gyur nas spyi bor ltung bar mi 'gyur te /🔽de la nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de rigs kyi sa la gnas par gyur nas spyi bor ltung bar mi 'gyur te / de la nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: When he has entered on the certainty that he will win the supreme enlightenment, he does not fall on the level of Disciple or Pratyekabuddha.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung ba'i spyi bor ltung ba med do //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung ba'i spyi bor ltung ba med do //
translated: He does not fall on the level of Disciple or Pratyekabuddha,🔽but he stands on the irreversible Bodhisattva-stage.

original: de byang chub sems dpa'i rigs kyi sa de la gnas shing bsam gtan bzhi sgrub bo //
analyzed: de byang chub sems dpa'i rigs kyi sa de la gnas shing bsam gtan bzhi sgrub bo //
translated: He who stands on the irreversible Bodhisattva-stage, he will fulfil the four trances.

original: tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi sgrub bo //
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi sgrub bo //
translated: He accomplishes the four immeasurables and the four formless absorptions.

original: de lhag mthong gi sa de la gnas shing chos thams cad rab tu shes par byed de /
analyzed: de lhag mthong gi sa de la gnas shing chos thams cad rab tu shes par byed de /
translated: “He who is on this level of insight knows all dharmas.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi khong du chud par byed do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi khong du chud par byed do //
translated: He penetrates the four noble truths.

original: de sdug bsngal yongs su shes kyang sdug bsngal la dmigs pa'i sems mi bskyed do //
analyzed: de sdug bsngal yongs su shes kyang sdug bsngal la dmigs pa'i sems mi bskyed do //
translated: He knows suffering, but he does not generate a mind that is focused on suffering.

original: kun 'byung ba rab tu spangs kyang kun 'byung ba la dmigs pa'i sems mi bskyed do //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba rab tu spangs kyang kun 'byung ba la dmigs pa'i sems mi bskyed do //
translated: He abandons the origin, but he does not generate a mind that is focused on the origin.

original: 'gog pa mngon @452b du byed kyang 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i sems mi bskyed do //
analyzed: 'gog pa mngon @452b du byed kyang 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i sems mi bskyed do //
translated: He manifests cessation, but he does not generate a mind that is focused on cessation.

original: lam bsgom yang lam la dmigs pa'i sems mi bskyed de /
analyzed: lam bsgom yang lam la dmigs pa'i sems mi bskyed de /
translated: He cultivates the path, but he does not generate a mind that is focused on the path.

original: gzhan du na byang chub la gzhol ba'i sems kyis chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong bar byed do //
analyzed: gzhan du na byang chub la gzhol ba'i sems kyis chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong bar byed do //
translated: Rather, with a mind that is directed toward awakening, he sees all dharmas as they are in reality.”🔽Śāriputra then asked,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: chos thams cad kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin zhes bgyi ba de gang lags /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin zhes bgyi ba de gang lags /
translated: What is the suchness of all phenomena?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; stong pa nyid do //
translated: The Blessed One replied, “Emptiness.”

original: gsol pa / stong pa nyid gang lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / stong pa nyid gang lags /
translated: “What is emptiness?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid de /
translated: “The emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics.”

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i lhag mthong gis /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i lhag mthong gis /
translated: “With such insight,

original: chos thams cad stong pa'o zhes bya bar lta ste /🔽ngo bo nyid gang la gnas zhes byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa'o zhes bya bar lta ste / ngo bo nyid gang la gnas zhes byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid /
translated: one should view all phenomena as empty.

original: chos gang la'ang ngo bo nyid yod par mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: chos gang la'ang ngo bo nyid yod par mi mthong ngo //
translated: One should not see any phenomenon as having an essence that is real and that abides.

original: dngos po med pa ni byang chub ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni byang chub ste /
translated: Non-entity is awakening.

original: de ni sangs rgyas kyis ma mdzad /
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas kyis ma mdzad /
translated: It is not created by the buddhas,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyis ma byas /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyis ma byas /
translated: not created by the solitary buddhas,

original: dgra bcom pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / rgyun du zhugs pas ma byas /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / rgyun du zhugs pas ma byas /
translated: not created by the arhats, the non-returners, the once-returners, or the stream-enterers,

original: de dag la zhugs pas kyang ma byas /
analyzed: de dag la zhugs pas kyang ma byas /
translated: They are not created by those who have entered them.

original: gang byang chub 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gis kyang ma byas te /
analyzed: gang byang chub 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gis kyang ma byas te /
translated: They are not created by those bodhisattva great beings who practice this awakening.

original: gzhan du yang dag pa ji lta ba de sems can rnams kyis mi shes mi mthong bas /🔽de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing thabs mkhas pas sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: gzhan du yang dag pa ji lta ba de sems can rnams kyis mi shes mi mthong bas / de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing thabs mkhas pas sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: Otherwise, since sentient beings do not know and do not see that suchness is real,

original: @453a *// shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /🔽le'u drug cu brgyad do ////🔽de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /🔽bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //🔽bcom ldan 'das /🔽gal te chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis te /🔽de dag sangs rgyas kyis kyang ma mdzad /
analyzed: @453a *// shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /🔽le'u drug cu brgyad do ////🔽de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /🔽bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //🔽bcom ldan 'das /🔽gal te chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis te /🔽de dag sangs rgyas kyis kyang ma mdzad /
translated: for that reason bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom teach the Dharma to sentient beings with skillful means.”

original: rang sangs rgyas dang / dgra bcom pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / rgyun du zhugs pas kyang ma bgyis /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dang / dgra bcom pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / rgyun du zhugs pas kyang ma bgyis /
translated: nor by pratyekabuddhas, nor by arhats, nor by nonreturners, nor by once-returners, nor by stream enterers;

original: de dag la zhugs pas kyang ma bgyis /
analyzed: de dag la zhugs pas kyang ma bgyis /
translated: nor by those who have entered those states;

original: gang byang chub 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gis kyang ma bgyis na /
analyzed: gang byang chub 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gis kyang ma bgyis na /
translated: nor by bodhisattva great beings who practice this enlightenment.🔽“Those phenomena are not made by anyone.

original: chos de dag la 'di dag ni sems can dmyal ba pa'o //🔽'di dag ni byol song gi skye gnas pa'o //
analyzed: chos de dag la 'di dag ni sems can dmyal ba pa'o // 'di dag ni byol song gi skye gnas pa'o //
translated: Those phenomena are not made by those in the hells,🔽those in the animal realms,

original: 'di dag ni gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'o //
translated: those in the world of Yama,

original: 'di dag ni lha'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni lha'o //
translated: those who are gods,

original: 'di dag ni mi'o //🔽las 'dis ni sems can dmyal ba pa dang / byol song gi skye gnas pa dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di dag ni mi'o // las 'dis ni sems can dmyal ba pa dang / byol song gi skye gnas pa dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten par 'gyur ro //
translated: or those who are humans.🔽‘This action leads to the hells, the animal realms, and the world of Yama.

original: las 'dis ni rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lhar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las 'dis ni rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lhar 'gyur ro //
translated: This action leads to the gods of the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika realm.

original: las 'dis ni sum cu rtsa gsum dang / mtsho ma dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang / tshangs ris dang / tshangs lha nye phan dang / tshangs pa kun 'khor dang / tshangs chen dang / snang ba dang /🔽chung snang dang / tshad med snang ba dang / kun snang dang ba dang / dge ba dang / chung dge dang / tshad med dge ba dang / dge rgyas @453b dang / che ba dang / chung che dang / tshad med che ba dang /
analyzed: las 'dis ni sum cu rtsa gsum dang / mtsho ma dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang / tshangs ris dang / tshangs lha nye phan dang / tshangs pa kun 'khor dang / tshangs chen dang / snang ba dang / chung snang dang / tshad med snang ba dang / kun snang dang ba dang / dge ba dang / chung dge dang / tshad med dge ba dang / dge rgyas @453b dang / che ba dang / chung che dang / tshad med che ba dang /
translated: Through this karma, one becomes a god of the Thirty-Three,🔽Tuṣita, Yāma, Nirmāṇarati, Paranirmitavaśavartin, Brahmakāyika, Brahmapurohita, Brahmapārṣadya, Mahābrahma, Parīttābha,

original: 'bras bu che ba dang / mi che ba dang / mi gdung ba dang / shin tu mthong ba dang / gya nom snang ba dang / 'og min gyi lhar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu che ba dang / mi che ba dang / mi gdung ba dang / shin tu mthong ba dang / gya nom snang ba dang / 'og min gyi lhar 'gyur ro //
translated: Apramāṇābha, Ābhāsvara, Parīttaśubha, Apramāṇaśubha, Śubhakṛtsna, Bṛhatphala, Avṛha, Atapa, Sudarśana, and Akaniṣṭha.

original: las 'dis ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi lhar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las 'dis ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi lhar 'gyur ro //
translated: This action leads to rebirth as a god in the Sphere of Infinite Space, the Sphere of Infinite Consciousness, the Sphere of Nothingness, or the Sphere of Neither-Perception-nor-Non-Perception.

original: las 'dis ni rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las 'dis ni rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro //
translated: This action leads to the state of a Stream-Enterer, a Once-Returner, a Non-Returner, a Worthy One, or a Solitary Buddha.

original: las 'dis ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las 'dis ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: This action leads to the state of a Bodhisattva, a Great Being.🔽This action leads to the state of a Tathāgata, a Saint, genuinely and fully awake to reality.”

original: las 'dis ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes bgyi bar tha dad du dbye ba'am /
analyzed: las 'dis ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes bgyi bar tha dad du dbye ba'am /
translated: “Blessed One,🔽how can one distinguish

original: rnam par dgod par yang ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam par dgod par yang ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: or categorize🔽non-entities?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: dngos po ma mchis pa la ni /
analyzed: dngos po ma mchis pa la ni /
translated: non-entities

original: bgyi ba gang yang ma mchis te /
analyzed: bgyi ba gang yang ma mchis te /
translated: cannot be done anything with.

original: bgyi ba gang gis sems can dmyal bar mchi ba'am /
analyzed: bgyi ba gang gis sems can dmyal bar mchi ba'am /
translated: By doing what could one go to the hells?

original: byol song gi skye gnas su mchi ba'am /
analyzed: byol song gi skye gnas su mchi ba'am /
translated: or to be reborn as an animal,

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten du mchi ba'am /
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten du mchi ba'am /
translated: or in the world of Yama,

original: mir skye ba'am /
analyzed: mir skye ba'am /
translated: or as a human,

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lhar skye ba'am /
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lhar skye ba'am /
translated: or in the god realm of the Four Great Kings,

original: sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lhar skye ba'am /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lhar skye ba'am /
translated: or in the god realm of the Thirty-Three,

original: mtshe ma dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang / tshangs ris dang / tshangs lha nye phan dang / tshangs pa kun 'khor dang / tshangs chen dang / snang ba dang / chung snang dang / tshad med snang ba dang /🔽kun snang dang ba dang / dge ba dang / @454a *//
analyzed: mtshe ma dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang / tshangs ris dang / tshangs lha nye phan dang / tshangs pa kun 'khor dang / tshangs chen dang / snang ba dang / chung snang dang / tshad med snang ba dang / kun snang dang ba dang / dge ba dang / @454a *//
translated: or in the god realms of Yāma, Tuṣita, Nirmāṇarati, and Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin, or in the god realms of Brahmakāyika, Brahmapurohita, Brahmapārṣadya, Mahābrahma, Parīttābha, Apramāṇābha,🔽Ābhāsvara, Parīttaśubha, Apramāṇaśubha,

original: chung dge dang / tshad med dge ba dang / dge rgyas dang / che ba dang / chung che dang / tshad med che ba dang / 'bras bu che ba dang / mi che ba dang / mi gdung ba dang / shin tu mthong ba dang /
analyzed: chung dge dang / tshad med dge ba dang / dge rgyas dang / che ba dang / chung che dang / tshad med che ba dang / 'bras bu che ba dang / mi che ba dang / mi gdung ba dang / shin tu mthong ba dang /
translated: Śubhakṛtsna, Bṛhatphala, Avṛha, Atapa, Sudarśana,🔽and Akaniṣṭha,

original: gya nom snang ba dang / 'og min gyi lhar skye ba'am /
analyzed: gya nom snang ba dang / 'og min gyi lhar skye ba'am /
translated: the appearance of the sublime, and rebirth as a god in the Unsurpassed Heaven.🔽

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi lhar skye ba'am /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi lhar skye ba'am /
translated: or in the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception,

analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: or attain the fruit of entering the stream,🔽or the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth,🔽or the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth,🔽or arhatship,

analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub thob par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: or a pratyekabuddha’s awakening,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lam la spyod par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lam la spyod par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: or practice the Great Vehicle,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: or attain the knowledge of all aspects,

analyzed: thob par gyur nas sems can rnams 'khor ba las yongs su dgrol bar 'gyur ro zhes bgyi ba de lta bu gang yang ma mchis so //

analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One replied to the venerable Su­bhūti as follows:

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Su­bhūti, that is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: That is exactly how it is!

original: ji skad du smras pa bzhin te /
analyzed: ji skad du smras pa bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said!

original: rab 'byor / dngos po med pa la ni las kyang med /
analyzed: rab 'byor / dngos po med pa la ni las kyang med /
translated: Su­bhūti, in the absence of entities, there are no karmic actions,

original: bya ba'ang med /
analyzed: bya ba'ang med /
translated: there is no activity,

original: 'bras bu'ang med na /
analyzed: 'bras bu'ang med na /
translated: and there is no result.

original: 'on kyang byis pa so so'i skye bo 'phags pa'i chos la mi mkhas pa rnams kyis chos rnams dngos po med pa'i @454b ngo bo nyid du mi shes te /
analyzed: 'on kyang byis pa so so'i skye bo 'phags pa'i chos la mi mkhas pa rnams kyis chos rnams dngos po med pa'i @454b ngo bo nyid du mi shes te /
translated: Nevertheless, foolish, ordinary beings, who are unskilled in the sacred doctrine, do not understand that all things have the essential nature of being insubstantial.

original: phyin ci log las byung ba'i sems kyis las sna tshogs mngon par 'du byed pas de dag gi lus rnam pa de bzhin du mngon par 'grub ste /🔽sems can dmyal ba'am /

original: byol song gi skye gnas sam /
analyzed: byol song gi skye gnas sam /
translated: in the animal realm,

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten nam /
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten nam /
translated: in the world of Yama,🔽among humans,

original: mi'am / rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha'am /
analyzed: mi'am / rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha'am /

translated: the gods of the Thirty-Three, the Yāma gods, the gods of Tuṣita, the gods who delight in creation, the gods who control others’ creations, the gods of Brahmā’s group, the gods of Brahmā’s retinue, the gods of great Brahmā, the gods of limited radiance, the gods of immeasurable radiance,🔽the gods of complete radiance, the gods of limited splendor, the gods of immeasurable splendor, the gods of abundant splendor, the gods of the cloudless realm, the gods of the realm of increased merit, the gods of the realm of great reward, the gods of the non-percipient realm, the gods of the realm of the five superknowledges, the gods of the highest heaven,

analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi lha'i nang du lus mngon par 'grub ste /
translated: and the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.🔽In the absence of an entity,

analyzed: dngos po med pa la ni las sam /
translated: there is no karma,

original: bya ba'am / 'bras bu med de /
analyzed: bya ba'am / 'bras bu med de /

analyzed: dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa nyid do //
translated: That which is an absence is just an absence.🔽Subhūti, in this regard, it is said:

analyzed: rab 'byor / de la 'di skad du dngos po med pa la ni bya ba gang yang med de /

analyzed: bya ba gang gis sems can dmyal bar 'gro ba'am /

analyzed: byol song gi skye gnas su 'gro ba'am / gshin rje'i @455a *//
translated: go to the animal realm,

original: 'jig rten du 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: 'jig rten du 'gro ba'am /

analyzed: mir skye ba'am /

analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lhar skye ba'am /
translated: be born as a god of the class of the Four Great Kings,

original: sum cu rtsa gsum dang / mtshe ma dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang / tshangs ris dang / tshangs lha nye phan dang / tshangs pa kun 'khor dang / tshangs chen dang / snang ba dang / chung snang dang /🔽tshad med snang ba dang / kun snang dang ba dang / dge ba dang / chung dge dang / tshad med dge ba dang / dge rgyas dang / che ba dang / chung che dang / tshad med che ba dang / 'bras bu che ba dang /

translated: the Heaven of the Thirty-three, the Yāma Heaven, the Tuṣita Heaven, the Nirmāṇarati Heaven, the Paranirmitavaśavartin Heaven, the Brahmakāyika Heaven, the Brahmapurohita Heaven, the Brahmapārṣadya Heaven, the Mahābrahmā Heaven, the Ābhāsvara Heaven, the Parīttābha Heaven,🔽the Apramāṇābha Heaven, the Ābhāsvara Heaven, the Śubhakṛtsna Heaven, the Parīttaśubha Heaven, the Apramāṇaśubha Heaven, the Śubhakṛtsna Heaven, the Bṛhatphala Heaven,

original: mi che ba dang / mi gdung ba dang / shin tu mthong ba dang / gya nom snang ba dang / 'og min gyi lhar skye ba'am /
analyzed: mi che ba dang / mi gdung ba dang / shin tu mthong ba dang / gya nom snang ba dang / 'og min gyi lhar skye ba'am /
translated: the Avṛha Heaven, the Atapa Heaven, the Sudarśana Heaven, and the Akaniṣṭha Heaven.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi lhar skye ba'am /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi lhar skye ba'am /
translated: or in the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: or attain the fruit of entering the stream,🔽or the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth,🔽or the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub thob par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub thob par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: or arhatship,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lam la spyod pa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lam la spyod pa'am /
translated: or practice the path of a bodhisattva great being,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: or attain the knowledge of all aspects,

analyzed: de thob nas sems can rnams 'khor ba las yongs su 'grol bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i bya ba gang yang @455b med do zhes zer ba ni /

original: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Subhūti, what do you think,

original: lam dngos po med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: lam dngos po med pa ma yin nam /
translated: is the path not a non-entity?”

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dngos po med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dngos po med pa ma yin nam /
translated: “Are the fruit of entering the stream,🔽the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dngos po med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dngos po med pa ma yin nam /
translated: and arhatship, individual enlightenment, and unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening non-things?”

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du dngos po med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du dngos po med pa ma yin nam /
translated: “Are all dharmas non-things?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Lord,

original: lam ni dngos po ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: lam ni dngos po ma mchis pa'o //
translated: the path is a non-thing.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ni dngos po ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ni dngos po ma mchis pa'o //
translated: The fruit of entering the stream is a non-thing.

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub ni dngos po ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub ni dngos po ma mchis pa'o //
translated: The fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, arhatship, individual enlightenment, and unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening are non-things.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ni dngos po ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ni dngos po ma mchis pa'o //
translated: All dharmas are non-things.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “What do you think, Subhūti,

original: dngos po med pa'i chos shig dngos po med pa'i chos thob par byed snyam mam /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i chos shig dngos po med pa'i chos thob par byed snyam mam /
translated: “Do you think that a non-entity dharma can cause a non-entity dharma to be attained?”

original: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Bhagavān,

original: de ni ma lags so //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de ni ma lags so // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: it cannot.”

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na dngos po med pa gang yin pa dang / lam gang yin pa'i chos de gnyis ka'ang ldan pa'ang ma yin /🔽mi ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na dngos po med pa gang yin pa dang / lam gang yin pa'i chos de gnyis ka'ang ldan pa'ang ma yin / mi ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: The Bhagavān said, “Subhūti, thus, those two dharmas—that which is a non-entity and that which is a path—are not conjoined and are not disjoined;

original: gzugs med pa /
analyzed: gzugs med pa /
translated: they are formless,

original: bstan du med pa /
analyzed: bstan du med pa /
translated: cannot be demonstrated,

original: thogs pa med pa /🔽mtshan nyid gcig pa ste /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa / mtshan nyid gcig pa ste /
translated: cannot be apprehended,

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med pa'o /
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med pa'o /
translated: and have one mark—that is to say, no mark.

original: @456a *// rab 'byor /🔽de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: @456a *// rab 'byor / de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti,

original: thabs mkhas pas sems can phyin ci log bzhis phung po lnga la mngon par zhen pa /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas sems can phyin ci log bzhis phung po lnga la mngon par zhen pa /
translated: there, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom, with skillful means, see that beings, through the four errors, are attached to the five aggregates,

original: mi rtag pa la rtag pa'i 'du shes su gyur pa /
analyzed: mi rtag pa la rtag pa'i 'du shes su gyur pa /
translated: that impermanence is taken as permanence,

original: sdug bsngal ba la bde ba'i 'du shes su gyur pa /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba la bde ba'i 'du shes su gyur pa /
translated: that suffering is taken as happiness,🔽and that the insubstantial is taken as substantial.

original: bdag med pa la bdag gi 'du shes su gyur pa /
analyzed: bdag med pa la bdag gi 'du shes su gyur pa /
translated: “They are those who have the notion of a self where there is no self,

original: mi sdug pa la sdug pa'i 'du shes su gyur pa /
analyzed: mi sdug pa la sdug pa'i 'du shes su gyur pa /
translated: the notion of beauty where there is ugliness,

original: dngos po la mngon par zhen pa rnams dngos po las rnam par 'grel to //
analyzed: dngos po la mngon par zhen pa rnams dngos po las rnam par 'grel to //
translated: and who are attached to things.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ci lags / byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams la dngos por zhen nas /🔽mngon par zhen par gyur pa de lta bu'i dngos po de bzhin /
analyzed: ci lags / byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams la dngos por zhen nas / mngon par zhen par gyur pa de lta bu'i dngos po de bzhin /
translated: are the things to which childish ordinary beings are attached🔽and to which they cling,

original: ma nor ba de bzhin zhes bgyi pa ma mchis sam /
analyzed: ma nor ba de bzhin zhes bgyi pa ma mchis sam /
translated: things that are not mistaken, not distorted, and not false?

original: de ste ma mchis na ni /
analyzed: de ste ma mchis na ni /
translated: If they are not,

original: mngon par 'du bgyid par yang ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: mngon par 'du bgyid par yang ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: how can they be brought into existence?

original: sug las des kyang shul rgyud lnga'i 'khor ba nas ci ste mi 'grol /
analyzed: sug las des kyang shul rgyud lnga'i 'khor ba nas ci ste mi 'grol /
translated: How can they be liberated from the five realms of saṃsāra through that karma?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / phyin ci log ma gtogs par gang la gnas te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / phyin ci log ma gtogs par gang la gnas te /
translated: “Subhūti, apart from error,

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams las mngon par 'du byed pa'i dngos po ni chung ngu na skra'i rtse mo'i cha shas bzhag pa tsam yang med do //
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams las mngon par 'du byed pa'i dngos po ni chung ngu na skra'i rtse mo'i cha shas bzhag pa tsam yang med do //
translated: There is not even a single thing, down to the tip of a hair, that is created by ordinary, foolish beings.

original: rab 'byor / de lta bas na ci nas kyang don 'di gsal zhing rdzogs pa dang / mkhas @456b pas shes par bya ba'i phyir khyod la dpe bshad do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de lta bas na ci nas kyang don 'di gsal zhing rdzogs pa dang / mkhas @456b pas shes par bya ba'i phyir khyod la dpe bshad do //
translated: “Subhūti, I will now give you a parable to further clarify this meaning, so that the wise may understand it.

original: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
translated: Subhūti, what do you think?

original: rmi lam du mthong ba la rmi lam du mthong ba de gang la gnas shing 'dod pa'i yon tan lngas yongs su spyod pa de lta bu'i dngos po gang yang yod dam /
analyzed: rmi lam du mthong ba la rmi lam du mthong ba de gang la gnas shing 'dod pa'i yon tan lngas yongs su spyod pa de lta bu'i dngos po gang yang yod dam /
translated: Is there any such thing as someone who, while dreaming, experiences the five kinds of desires based on something that exists in the dream?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti replied, “No, Bhagavān.

original: rmi lam nyid kyang ma mchis na /
analyzed: rmi lam nyid kyang ma mchis na /
translated: Since even the dream itself does not exist,

original: rmi lam mthong ba de dag gang la gnas shing 'dod pa'i yon tan lngas yongs su spyod pa lta smos kyang ci 'tshal te ma mchis so //
analyzed: rmi lam mthong ba de dag gang la gnas shing 'dod pa'i yon tan lngas yongs su spyod pa lta smos kyang ci 'tshal te ma mchis so //
translated: how could there be anything that exists in the dream on which one could rely and experience the five kinds of desires? That would be impossible.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān continued, “Subhūti, what do you think?

original: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /🔽'jig rten pa'am /🔽'jig rten las 'das pa'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems / 'jig rten pa'am / 'jig rten las 'das pa'am /
translated: Subhūti, what do you think?

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'am /🔽zag pa med pa'am /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'am / zag pa med pa'am /
translated: Are there any phenomena, whether worldly or transcendent,

original: 'dus byas sam /
analyzed: 'dus byas sam /
translated: whether contaminated or uncontaminated,🔽whether compounded or uncompounded,

original: 'dus ma byas kyi chos gang la rmi lam dang 'dra ba ma yin pa de lta bu yod dam /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi chos gang la rmi lam dang 'dra ba ma yin pa de lta bu yod dam /
translated: that are not like a dream?

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /🔽'jig rten pa'am /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / 'jig rten pa'am /
translated: ” “Blessed One,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'am /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'am /
translated: there are no phenomena, whether worldly or transcendent,

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa ma mchis pa'am /🔽'dus byas sam /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa ma mchis pa'am / 'dus byas sam /
translated: whether contaminated or uncontaminated,🔽whether compounded or uncompounded,

original: 'dus ma byas kyi chos gang yang rmi lam lta bu ma lags pa de lta bu ma mchis so //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi chos gang yang rmi lam lta bu ma lags pa de lta bu ma mchis so //
translated: that are not like a dream.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Blessed One said,

original: ci rmi lam la rgyud lnga'i 'khor ba yod dam /
analyzed: ci rmi lam la rgyud lnga'i 'khor ba yod dam /
translated: “Are the five classes of wandering beings present in a dream?

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ” “Blessed One,

original: de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma lags so //
translated: they are not.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Subhūti, what do you think?

original: rmi lam la lam bsgoms pas @457a *//
analyzed: rmi lam la lam bsgoms pas @457a *//
translated: Is it possible to cultivate the path in a dream

original: kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: and thereby become afflicted?

original: rnam par byang bar yang mi 'gyur ba de lta bu'i lam bsgom pa yod dam /
analyzed: rnam par byang bar yang mi 'gyur ba de lta bu'i lam bsgom pa yod dam /
translated: Is there such a path to be cultivated that would not lead to purification?

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

original: de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma lags so //
translated: there is not.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de ni dngos po ma mchis pa ste /
analyzed: de ni dngos po ma mchis pa ste /
translated: it is a non-entity.

original: brjod pa dang / sgra dang / tshig dang / yi ge thams cad kyis gdags su ma mchis pa'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: brjod pa dang / sgra dang / tshig dang / yi ge thams cad kyis gdags su ma mchis pa'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: It cannot be labeled by any expressions, sounds, words, or letters.”

original: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Subhūti, what do you think?

original: me long la gzugs brnyan snang ba de la gang las mngon par 'du byed cing mngon par 'du byas pas sems can dmyal bar 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: me long la gzugs brnyan snang ba de la gang las mngon par 'du byed cing mngon par 'du byas pas sems can dmyal bar 'gro ba'am /
translated: Is there any entity in the reflection of a form in a mirror that is formed and by which a being would go to the hells,

analyzed: byol song gi skye gnas su 'gro ba'am /

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten du 'gro ba'am /

translated: or become a human or god?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

original: de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma lags so //
translated: there is not.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de ni gzhan du na byis pa rnams la slu ba ma gtogs par dngos por ma mchis pa ste /
analyzed: de ni gzhan du na byis pa rnams la slu ba ma gtogs par dngos por ma mchis pa ste /

analyzed: gzugs brnyan nyid kyang ma mchis na /

analyzed: mi dang lhar 'gyur ba'i sug las lta smos kyang ci 'chal te ma mchis so //
translated: or to the gods or humans?

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

translated: “What do you think, Subhūti?🔽Is there a path to be cultivated by which one would not become afflicted

analyzed: rnam par byang bar yang mi 'gyur ba de lta bu'i lam bsgom pa yod dam / gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: lam bsgoms pas kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur la /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “What do you think, Subhūti?

analyzed: nags stug po dang / ri dang / gcong rong dang / lung pa nas sgra brnyan byung na /

analyzed: byol song gi skye gnas su 'gro ba'am /

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten du 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten du 'gro ba'am /
translated: or go to the world of Yama,

original: lha dang / mir 'gyur ba de lta bu'i dngos po yod dam /🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: lha dang / mir 'gyur ba de lta bu'i dngos po yod dam / gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: or become a god or human?”

original: de ni ma lags te /
analyzed: de ni ma lags te /
translated: He replied, “No, Lord.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

analyzed: sgra brnyan de nyid kyang dngos po ma mchis na /

analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lhar skye ba'am /

analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum dang / mtshe ma dang / dga' ldan dang / @458a *//
translated: or in the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, or the Yāma Heaven, or the Heaven of Joy,

original: 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang / tshangs ris dang / tshangs lha nye phan dang / tshangs pa kun 'khor dang / tshangs chen dang / snang ba dang / chung snang dang / tshad med snang ba dang / kun snang dang ba dang /
analyzed: 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang / tshangs ris dang / tshangs lha nye phan dang / tshangs pa kun 'khor dang / tshangs chen dang / snang ba dang / chung snang dang / tshad med snang ba dang / kun snang dang ba dang /
translated: or the Heaven of Delighting in Emanations, or the Heaven of Making Use of Others’ Emanations, or the Brahmā Group, or the Heaven of Brahmā’s Ministers, or the Heaven of Brahmā’s Assembly, or Great Brahmā, or the Luminous Heaven, or the Heaven of Lesser Luminousness, or the Heaven of Limitless Luminousness, or the Heaven of Radiant Luminousness,🔽or the Heaven of Goodness, or the Heaven of Lesser Goodness, or the Heaven of Limitless Goodness, or the Heaven of Perfected Goodness, or the Heaven of Great Fruit, or the Heaven of No Hardship, or the Heaven of Excellent Vision,

original: dge ba dang / chung dge dang / tshad med dge ba dang / dge rgyas dang / che ba dang / chung che dang / tshad med che ba dang / 'bras bu che ba dang / mi che ba dang / mi gdung ba dang / shin tu mthong ba dang /
analyzed: dge ba dang / chung dge dang / tshad med dge ba dang / dge rgyas dang / che ba dang / chung che dang / tshad med che ba dang / 'bras bu che ba dang / mi che ba dang / mi gdung ba dang / shin tu mthong ba dang /
translated: or the Heaven of Certainty, or the Heaven of Great Certainty, or the Highest Heaven, or the Heaven of the Highest Peak.

original: gya nom snang ba dang / 'og min gyi lhar skye ba'am /
analyzed: gya nom snang ba dang / 'og min gyi lhar skye ba'am /
translated: the appearance of the sublime, rebirth as a god in the Highest Heaven,

translated: or rebirth as a god in the sphere of infinite space, the sphere of infinite consciousness, the sphere of nothingness, or the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception?

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

translated: “Subhūti, what do you think?🔽Is there a path on which one meditates in such a way that one does not become afflicted,

analyzed: rnam par byang bar yang mi 'gyur ba de lta bu'i lam bsgom pa yod dam /
translated: and does not become purified?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

original: de ni ma lags te /
analyzed: de ni ma lags te /
translated: there is not.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: sgra brnyan nyid kyang shin tu ma mchis pa lags na; lam gang sgom pas kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: sgra brnyan nyid kyang shin tu ma mchis pa lags na; lam gang sgom pas kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: since an echo itself does not exist at all, what path could one meditate on in such a way that one does not become afflicted,🔽and does not become purified?”

analyzed: rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur ba'i lam sgom pa lta smos kyang ci 'tshal te ma mchis so //

original: bcom ldan @458b 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan @458b 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Subhūti, what do you think?

original: smig rgyu la chu med par chu'i 'du shes su gyur pa dang / klung med par chu klung gi 'du shes su gyur pa dang / grong khyer med par grong khyer gyi 'du shes su gyur pa dang / skyed mos tshal med par skyed mos tshal gyi 'du shes su gyur pa de la /
analyzed: smig rgyu la chu med par chu'i 'du shes su gyur pa dang / klung med par chu klung gi 'du shes su gyur pa dang / grong khyer med par grong khyer gyi 'du shes su gyur pa dang / skyed mos tshal med par skyed mos tshal gyi 'du shes su gyur pa de la /
translated: In the case of a mirage, where there is no water but there is a perception of water, no river but there is a perception of a river, no city but there is a perception of a city, and no park but there is a perception of a park,

analyzed: 'du shes kyi lam gang mngon par 'du byas pas /

analyzed: sems can dmyal bar 'gro ba'am /

original: byol song gi skye gnas sam /
analyzed: byol song gi skye gnas sam /
translated: or to the animal realm,

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten du 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten du 'gro ba'am /
translated: or to the world of Yama,

original: mir skye ba'am /
analyzed: mir skye ba'am /
translated: or be born as a human,

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lhar skye ba'am /
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lhar skye ba'am /

analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum dang / mtshe ma dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang / tshangs ris dang / tshangs lha nye phan dang / tshangs pa kun 'khor dang / tshangs chen dang / snang ba dang / chung snang dang / tshad med snang ba dang / kun snang dang ba dang / dge ba dang / chung dge dang / chad med dge ba dang / dge rgyas dang / che ba dang / chung che dang / tshad med che ba dang / 'bras bu che ba dang /
translated: the Heaven of the Thirty-three, the Yāma Heaven, the Tuṣita Heaven, the Nirmāṇarati Heaven, the Paranirmitavaśavartin Heaven, the Brahmakāyika Heaven, the Brahmapurohita Heaven, the Brahmapārṣadya Heaven, the Mahābrahmā Heaven, the Ābhāsvara Heaven, the Parīttābha Heaven,🔽the Apramāṇābha Heaven, the Ābhāsvara Heaven, the Śubhakṛtsna Heaven, the Parīttaśubha Heaven, the Apramāṇaśubha Heaven, the Śubhakṛtsna Heaven, the Bṛhatphala Heaven,
