original: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems sprul pa de la lam gang bsgoms pas kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems sprul pa de la lam gang bsgoms pas kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: Subhūti, what do you think?

original: rnam par byang bar yang mi 'gyur ba de lta bu'i lam bsgom pa yod dam /
analyzed: rnam par byang bar yang mi 'gyur ba de lta bu'i lam bsgom pa yod dam /
translated: Is there a path cultivated by that emanation through which there would be neither affliction nor purification?

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

original: de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma lags so //
translated: there is not.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /🔽de la gang la la zhig kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems / de la gang la la zhig kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
translated: “Subhūti, what do you think?🔽Is there anyone who would become afflicted

original: rnam par byang @461b bar yang 'gyur ba yod dam /
analyzed: rnam par byang @461b bar yang 'gyur ba yod dam /
translated: or purified?

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

original: de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma lags so //
translated: there is not.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin te /🔽ji ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /🔽rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba gang yang med pa de bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin te / ji ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa'am / rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba gang yang med pa de bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
translated: “Subhūti, it is just so.🔽Just as there is no affliction or purification at all,

original: rnam par byang ba yang med do //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba yang med do //
translated: in the same way there is no affliction or purification.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bdag dang bdag gir bya ba la gnas shing /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir bya ba la gnas shing /
translated: They abide in the notion of ‘I’ and ‘mine.’

original: sems can rnams kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
analyzed: sems can rnams kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
translated: Sentient beings are either afflicted

original: rnam par byang bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rnam par byang bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: or purified.

original: yang dag par mthong ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
analyzed: yang dag par mthong ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
translated: Those who see reality are neither afflicted

original: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba med do;/🔽ji ltar yang dag par mthong ba la kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
analyzed: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba med do;/ ji ltar yang dag par mthong ba la kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
translated: nor purified.🔽Just as those who see reality are neither afflicted nor purified,

original: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba med pa de bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba med do //
analyzed: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba med pa de bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba med do //
translated: so there is neither affliction nor purification.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-Five Thousand Lines,

original: le'u drug cu dgu'o ////🔽de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: le'u drug cu dgu'o //// de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
translated: this was chapter sixty-nine:🔽The Perfection of Patience.

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to;/
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to;/
translated: Then the venerable Su­bhūti said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: yang dag pa mthong ba la kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: yang dag pa mthong ba la kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: those who see reality are neither afflicted

original: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba yang ma mchis pa de bzhin du yang dag pa ma mthong ba la'ang kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
analyzed: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba yang ma mchis pa de bzhin du yang dag pa ma mthong ba la'ang kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
translated: Similarly, for one who does not see reality, there is no defilement or purification.

original: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba ma mchis te /
analyzed: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba ma mchis te /
translated: Similarly, for one who does not see reality, there is no defilement or purification.

original: de ni chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid pas /
analyzed: de ni chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid pas /
translated: Because all phenomena are essentially unreal,

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽dngos po @462a *//🔽ma mchis pa la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / dngos po @462a *// ma mchis pa la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
translated: Blessed One,

original: rnam par byang bar ma mchis te /
analyzed: rnam par byang bar ma mchis te /
translated: unreal things are neither defiled nor purified.

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽ngo bo nyid la kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / ngo bo nyid la kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
translated: Blessed One,

original: rnam par byang ba ma mchis te /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ma mchis te /
translated: the intrinsic nature is neither defiled nor purified.

original: dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid la'ang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba ma mchis na /
analyzed: dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid la'ang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba ma mchis na /
translated: And if unreal things and the intrinsic nature are neither defiled nor purified,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par byang bar gsungs pa de ji lta bu lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par byang bar gsungs pa de ji lta bu lags /
translated: Blessed One, how is it that you have taught purification?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,🔽“Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa de ni ngas rnam par byang bar gsungs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa de ni ngas rnam par byang bar gsungs so //
translated: “Subhūti, I have said that the sameness of all dharmas is purification.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ” Subhūti said, “Blessed One,

original: chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid de gang lags /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid de gang lags /
translated: what is the sameness of all dharmas?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Blessed One said,

original: de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings nyid dang / chos kyi gnas nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' gang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings nyid dang / chos kyi gnas nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' gang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
translated: “The suchness, the unmistaken suchness, the unaltered suchness, the dharma-constituent, the establishment of dharmas, the certification of dharmas, the very limit of reality, the inconceivable element, and the unthinkable element—whether Tathāgatas appear or not—

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste /
translated: remain just as they are.

original: de bzhin du gnas pa'i chos kyi gnas nyid dang / dbyings 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas pa'i chos kyi gnas nyid dang / dbyings 'di lta ste /
translated: This is the establishment of dharmas, the element, and the realm.

original: chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ba 'di ni /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ba 'di ni /
translated: This is called the dharma-constituent.

original: rab 'byor / rnam par byang ba ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam par byang ba ste /
translated: Subhūti, this is purification.

original: de ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis brjod kyi /
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis brjod kyi /
translated: This is expressed by the conventions of the world.

original: de ni brjod du med cing smos su med pa ste /
analyzed: de ni brjod du med cing smos su med pa ste /
translated: It is inexpressible and indescribable.

original: sgra dang tshig thams cad kyi lam las 'das pa'i chos so //
analyzed: sgra dang tshig thams cad kyi lam las 'das pa'i chos so //
translated: It is a phenomenon that transcends all paths of sound and words.

original: @462b gsol pa /
analyzed: @462b gsol pa /
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gal te chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu /🔽sgra brnyan lta bu /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu / sgra brnyan lta bu /
translated: if all phenomena are like a dream,🔽like an echo,

original: mig yor lta bu /🔽smig rgyu lta bu /🔽sgyu ma lta bu /
analyzed: mig yor lta bu / smig rgyu lta bu / sgyu ma lta bu /
translated: like an optical illusion,🔽like a mirage,🔽like an illusion,

original: sprul pa lta bu lags na /
analyzed: sprul pa lta bu lags na /
translated: and like a magical creation,

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu dang / sgra brnyan lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / chos thams cad sprul pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu dang / sgra brnyan lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / chos thams cad sprul pa lta bu ste /
translated: how can bodhisattva great beings, when all phenomena are like a dream, like an echo, like an optical illusion, like a mirage, like an illusion, and like a magical creation,

original: dngos po ma mchis pa /
analyzed: dngos po ma mchis pa /
translated: which are unreal and insubstantial,

original: rdzas ma mchis pa la bdag gis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rdzas ma mchis pa la bdag gis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: perfect the perfection of generosity?

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom;

original: thabs mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: the perfection of skill in means, the perfection of vows, the perfection of power, and the perfection of knowledge.

original: nang stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: He should complete the emptiness of internal phenomena,

original: phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of external and internal phenomena, and the emptiness of emptiness, up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: He should complete the four applications of mindfulness,

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags @463a *//
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags @463a *//
translated: the four right efforts,🔽the four legs of magical emanation,🔽the five faculties,🔽the five powers,🔽the seven branches of enlightenment,🔽and the noble eightfold path.🔽

original: pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: “I will perfect the four right efforts, the four legs of magical power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven aspects of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyom par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyom par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang /
translated: “I will perfect the four noble truths, the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, the eight aspects of liberation, the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, emptiness,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa lnga dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa lnga dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: signlessness, and aspirationlessness, the five kinds of supernormal knowledge, all the meditative stabilizations, and all the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: I will perfect the ten powers of the Tathāgata, the four confidences, the four unhindered discernments, great loving kindness, great compassion, and the eighteen special qualities of the Buddha.

original: mi chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: mi chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: I will perfect the thirty-two major marks of a great being.

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: I will perfect the eighty minor marks.

original: 'od chen po yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'od chen po yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: I will perfect the great radiance.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams kyi sems kyi rtog pa sems kyis yongs su shes par byas te /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams kyi sems kyi rtog pa sems kyis yongs su shes par byas te /
translated: I will know the thoughts of sentient beings in the worlds of the ten directions with my mind, and

original: dbyangs gcig gis mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos bstan pa'i tshangs pa'i dbyangs yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: dbyangs gcig gis mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos bstan pa'i tshangs pa'i dbyangs yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: with a single voice I will teach the Dharma in accordance with their aspirations, perfecting the Brahmā voice.

original: zhes bgyi bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems @463b bskyed pa lags /
analyzed: zhes bgyi bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems @463b bskyed pa lags /
translated: Thus, I will generate the mind of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “What do you think, Subhūti?

original: gang khyod kyis brjod pa'i chos de dag rmi lam lta bu dang / sgra brnyan lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu ma yin nam /
analyzed: gang khyod kyis brjod pa'i chos de dag rmi lam lta bu dang / sgra brnyan lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu ma yin nam /
translated: Are those dharmas that you have described not like a dream, like an echo, like an apparition, like an optical illusion, like a mirage, like a magical creation, and like an imagined object?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

original: gal te chos de dag rmi lam lta bu dang / sgra brnyan lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu lags na /
analyzed: gal te chos de dag rmi lam lta bu dang / sgra brnyan lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu lags na /
translated: if those dharmas are like a dream, like an echo, like an apparition, like an optical illusion, like a mirage, like a magical creation, and like an imagined object,

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bgyi /
translated: how should a bodhisattva great being practice the perfection of wisdom?”

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rmi lam ni yang dag pa ma lags /
analyzed: rmi lam ni yang dag pa ma lags /
translated: “Subhūti, a dream is not real.

original: sgra brnyan dang / mig yor dang / smig rgyu dang / sgyu ma dang / sprul pa ni yang dag pa ma lags te /
analyzed: sgra brnyan dang / mig yor dang / smig rgyu dang / sgyu ma dang / sprul pa ni yang dag pa ma lags te /
translated: An echo, an apparition, an optical illusion, a mirage, a magical creation, and an imagined object are not real.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: yang dag pa ma lags pas /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma lags pas /
translated: and is not real,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: and the practice of the perfection of giving, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa dang / nang stong pa nyid la spyad pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la spyad pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa dang / nang stong pa nyid la spyad pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la spyad pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang /
translated: and the perfection of wisdom, and the practice of inner emptiness, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, and the practice of the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening,🔽the four noble truths, the four concentrations,🔽and the four formless absorptions,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / @464a *//
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / @464a *//
translated: and the practice of the eight liberations, the eight bases of subjugation, the ten tathāgata powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,🔽and the practice of the knowledge of all aspects, and the practice of the knowledge of path aspects, and the practice of the knowledge of all aspects and the knowledge original: tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang /
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang /
translated: the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, the eight aspects of liberation, the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness,

original: mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyad pas /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyad pas /
translated: the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four kinds of exact knowledge, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so //
translated: they will not be able to attain manifestly perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te; yang dag pa ma yin pas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: de de bzhin te; yang dag pa ma yin pas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: Those who practice the perfection of generosity, the perfection of conduct, the perfection of patience, the perfection of diligence,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa dang / nang stong pa nyid la spyad pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la spyad pa dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa dang / nang stong pa nyid la spyad pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la spyad pa dang /
translated: the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom, who practice inner emptiness, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la spyad pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / @464b gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la spyad pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / @464b gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
translated: who practice the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the liberations, the serial absorptions,

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad la spyad pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad la spyad pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang /
translated: emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, the superknowledges, the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses,🔽

original: so so yang dag par rig pa dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyad pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyad pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so //
translated: the emptiness, the signless, the wishless, the doors of liberation, the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, and he is not able to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Subhūti, what do you think?

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'am /🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'am / gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Is the perfection of giving able to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma lags so //
translated: ” He replied, “No it is not, Blessed One.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti, what do you think?

original: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
translated: Subhuti, what do you think?

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'am /🔽stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams bla na med pa yang @465a *//
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'am / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams bla na med pa yang @465a *//
translated: Is the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom fully awakened into unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment?

analyzed: dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'am /
translated: Are all the emptinesses, and the factors of awakening fully awakened into unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment?

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the liberations, the complete liberations, the emptiness, signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'am /

translated: and the wishlessness, the higher cognitions, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'am /

translated: the ten tathāgata powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?”

analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //

analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya'o //

translated: The perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom do not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

analyzed: nang stong pa nyid bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya'o //

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya'o //

translated: up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature does not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya'o //

translated: The right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the aspects of awakening, and the noble eightfold path do not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

translated: the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the deliverances, the sequential meditative absorptions, emptiness,

analyzed: med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya'o //

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya'o //

translated: the powers of the tathāgatas, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rab 'byor / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, if you ask why,

original: 'di ltar chos de dag thams cad kyang 'dus byas pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos de dag thams cad kyang 'dus byas pa /
translated: it is because all those dharmas are compounded,

original: mngon par 'dus byas pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par 'dus byas pa ste /
translated: and are manifestly compounded.

original: 'dus byas pa dang / mngon par 'dus byas pa'i chos kyis ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi nus so //
analyzed: 'dus byas pa dang / mngon par 'dus byas pa'i chos kyis ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi nus so //
translated: A compounded dharma and a manifestly compounded dharma cannot attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / 'on kyang chos de dag ni thams cad kyang lam bsgrub pa dang / lam bskyed pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'on kyang chos de dag ni thams cad kyang lam bsgrub pa dang / lam bskyed pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba ste /
translated: “Subhūti, moreover, those dharmas are all causes for the accomplishment of the path and the generation of the path,

original: 'bras bu thob pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu thob pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //

original: de dag gi mi skye ba dang / mi 'byung ba gang yin pa ni mtshan nyid med pa'ang de yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi mi skye ba dang / mi 'byung ba gang yin pa ni mtshan nyid med pa'ang de yin te /
translated: The non-arising and non-occurrence of those is also the absence of characteristics.🔽Therefore, starting from the first production of the thought,

analyzed: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /

analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun nam /

analyzed: bsam gtan rnams sam /

analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams sam /

analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad dam /

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams sam /

analyzed: snying rje chen po'am /

translated: the perfection of generosity, the perfection of moral discipline, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom;

original: nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong pa rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / @467a *//
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong pa rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / @467a *//
translated: inner emptiness, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature; the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power,

original: dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang /
analyzed: dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang /
translated: the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, the noble eightfold path, the noble truths, the meditative stabilizations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions,

original: rnam par thar pa rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad po de dag yongs su rdzogs par ma byas par sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'am /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad po de dag yongs su rdzogs par ma byas par sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'am /
translated: the gateways of mnemonic incantation,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya bar mi nus pas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya bar mi nus pas /
translated: the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, great loving kindness, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas, and without having completed the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, great loving kindness, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas, it is impossible to bring beings to maturity or to attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de'i phyir de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: de'i phyir de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom should train in the perfection of wisdom like that.

original: dge ba'i chos gang dang gang rtsom yang de thams cad rmi lam lta bur shes so //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos gang dang gang rtsom yang de thams cad rmi lam lta bur shes so //
translated: Whatever wholesome dharmas he undertakes, he knows them all to be like a dream.

original: sgra brnyan lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bur shes so //
analyzed: sgra brnyan lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bur shes so //
translated: He knows them to be like an echo, like an optical aberration, like a mirage, like an illusion, like a magical creation.

original: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu @467b phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu @467b phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: When he practices the perfection of wisdom,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: he knows the perfection of giving, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom

original: nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang /
translated: the emptiness of internal phenomena, up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities, the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers,

original: byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
translated: the branches of awakening, the noble eightfold path, the noble truths, the meditative stabilizations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the liberations, the serial absorptions,

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang /
translated: the emptiness, the signless, the wishless, the clairvoyances, all the meditative stabilizations, all the dhāraṇī gateways, the powers of the tathāgatas, the fearlessnesses,

original: so so yang dag par rig pa dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du rmi lam lta bur shes so //🔽sgra brnyan lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bur @468a *//
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du rmi lam lta bur shes so // sgra brnyan lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bur @468a *//
translated: He knows that the analytical knowledges, the great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, up to and including omniscience, are like a dream.

original: rab tu shes so //
analyzed: rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows that they are like an echo, like an optical aberration, like a mirage, like a magical creation, and like a phantom.

original: sems can de dag thams cad kyang rmi lam la spyod do zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: sems can de dag thams cad kyang rmi lam la spyod do zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: He knows that all those sentient beings are experiencing a dream.

original: sgra brnyan dang / mig yor dang / smig rgyu dang / sgyu ma dang / sprul pa la spyod do zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: sgra brnyan dang / mig yor dang / smig rgyu dang / sgyu ma dang / sprul pa la spyod do zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: He knows that they are experiencing an echo, an optical aberration, a mirage, a magical creation, and a phantom.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: rmi lam lta bu'i chos rnams dngos po med par 'dzin te /
analyzed: rmi lam lta bu'i chos rnams dngos po med par 'dzin te /
translated: they apprehend that dharmas that are like a dream are non-existent.

original: de ltar bzung zhing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar bzung zhing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed do //
translated: Having apprehended it in that way, he will attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: When he practices the perfection of wisdom,

original: sgra brnyan lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu'i chos rnams dngos po med par 'dzin te /
analyzed: sgra brnyan lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu'i chos rnams dngos po med par 'dzin te /
translated: he apprehends the dharmas that are like an echo, like an apparition, like an optical aberration, like a mirage, like a magical creation, and like a dream as non-existent.

original: de ltar bzung zhing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar bzung zhing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed do //
translated: Having apprehended it in that way, he will attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang gzung du med do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang gzung du med do //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is also ungraspable.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang gzung du med do //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang gzung du med do //
translated: The perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of giving are also ungraspable.

original: nang stong pa nyid kyang gzung du med do; ;dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du'ang gzung du med do //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid kyang gzung du med do; ;dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du'ang gzung du med do //
translated: The emptiness of internal phenomena is ungraspable. The other aspects of emptiness, up to and including the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities, are ungraspable.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po @468b dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'ang gzung du med do //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po @468b dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'ang gzung du med do //
translated: The applications of mindfulness, the correct exertions, the supports for miraculous ability, the faculties, the powers, the branches of awakening, and the path of the noble ones are ungraspable.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: The noble truths, the meditative concentrations, the immeasurable aspirations, the formless absorptions, the aspects of liberation, the aspects of correct spiritual practice, the emptiness, the signless, and the wishless are ungraspable.

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyang gzung du med do //
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyang gzung du med do //
translated: The superknowledges, the meditative stabilities, and the dhāraṇī gateways are ungraspable.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyang gzung du med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyang gzung du med do //
translated: the powers of the tathāgatas, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are ungraspable.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad gzung du med par shes par byas shing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub don du gnyer to //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad gzung du med par shes par byas shing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub don du gnyer to //
translated: Therefore, bodhisattva great beings, having understood that all dharmas are ungraspable, strive for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni gzung du med cing dngos po med pa ste; rmi lam lta bu /🔽sgra brnyan lta bu /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni gzung du med cing dngos po med pa ste; rmi lam lta bu / sgra brnyan lta bu /
translated: Because all dharmas are ungraspable and insubstantial, like a dream,🔽like a phantom,

original: mig yor lta bu /🔽smig rgyu lta bu /🔽sgyu ma lta bu /
analyzed: mig yor lta bu / smig rgyu lta bu / sgyu ma lta bu /
translated: like an apparition,🔽like a mirage,🔽like an illusion,

original: sprul pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: sprul pa lta bu ste /
translated: like a magical creation.

original: sems can rnams kyis chos de dag ma shes /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyis chos de dag ma shes /
translated: Sentient beings do not understand those dharmas.

original: ma mthong / ma rtogs par gzung du med pa'i chos kyis gzung du med pa'i chos gang yang thob par mi nus pas de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can thams cad kyi don du bla @469a *//
analyzed: ma mthong / ma rtogs par gzung du med pa'i chos kyis gzung du med pa'i chos gang yang thob par mi nus pas de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can thams cad kyi don du bla @469a *//
translated: Without seeing and without realizing, the unapprehendable dharmas cannot attain any unapprehendable dharmas at all. Therefore, bodhisattva mahāsattvas, for the sake of all sentient beings,🔽

original: na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par 'jug ste /
analyzed: na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par 'jug ste /
translated: “Without seeing and without realizing, the unapprehendable Dharma cannot be attained by the unapprehendable Dharma. Therefore, bodhisattva great beings genuinely set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening for the sake of all sentient beings.

original: de sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: de sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: “From the time they first give rise to the mind of awakening,

original: sbyin pa gang ci gtong yang sems can thams cad kyi don du gtong ngo //
analyzed: sbyin pa gang ci gtong yang sems can thams cad kyi don du gtong ngo //
translated: whatever generosity they give, they give for the sake of all sentient beings.

original: tshul khrims gang ci srung ba dang / bzod pa gang ci sgom pa dang / brtson 'grus gang ci rtsom pa dang / bsam gtan gang ci la mnyam par gzhog pa dang / shes rab gang ci sgom yang sems can thams cad kyi don du sgom ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims gang ci srung ba dang / bzod pa gang ci sgom pa dang / brtson 'grus gang ci rtsom pa dang / bsam gtan gang ci la mnyam par gzhog pa dang / shes rab gang ci sgom yang sems can thams cad kyi don du sgom ste /
translated: Whatever morality they guard, whatever patience they cultivate, whatever perseverance they make an effort in, whatever concentration they rest evenly in, and whatever wisdom they cultivate, they cultivate it for the sake of all sentient beings.

original: bdag gi don du ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag gi don du ma yin no //
translated: It is not for their own sake.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems can rnams kyi don ma gtogs par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mi 'jug ste /🔽de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe; sems can gang sems can med pa la sems can gyi 'du shes su gnas pa dang / bdag med pa la bdag gi 'du shes su gnas pa dang / srog med pa la srog gi 'du shes su gnas pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems can rnams kyi don ma gtogs par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mi 'jug ste / de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe; sems can gang sems can med pa la sems can gyi 'du shes su gnas pa dang / bdag med pa la bdag gi 'du shes su gnas pa dang / srog med pa la srog gi 'du shes su gnas pa dang /
translated: Bodhisattva great beings do not set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening except for the sake of beings.🔽When they practice the perfection of wisdom, they see that any being who dwells in the perception of a being where there is no being, who dwells in the perception of a self where there is no self, who dwells in the perception of a living being where there is no living being,

original: 'gro ba med pa la 'gro ba'i 'du shes su gnas pa dang / gso ba med pa la gso ba'i 'du shes su gnas pa dang / skyes bu med pa la skyes bu'i 'du shes su gnas pa dang / gang zag med pa la gang zag gi 'du shes su gnas pa dang /
analyzed: 'gro ba med pa la 'gro ba'i 'du shes su gnas pa dang / gso ba med pa la gso ba'i 'du shes su gnas pa dang / skyes bu med pa la skyes bu'i 'du shes su gnas pa dang / gang zag med pa la gang zag gi 'du shes su gnas pa dang /
translated: who dwells in the perception of a person where there is no person, who dwells in the perception of an individual where there is no individual, who dwells in the perception of an embodied spirit where there is no embodied spirit, who dwells in the perception of an observer where there is no observer, who dwells in the perception of an experiencer where there is no experiencer, who dwells in the perception of a knower where there is no knower, who dwells in the perception of one who sees where there is no one who sees, who dwells in the perception of a hearer where there is no hearer, who dwells in the perception of a speaker where there is no speaker, who dwells in the perception of a cognizer where there is no cognizer, who dwells in the perception of a goer where there is no goer, who dwells in the perception of a knower where there is no knower, who dwells in the perception of a knower where there is no knower, who dwells in the perception of a knower where there is no knower, who dwells in the perception of a knower where there is no knower, who dwells in the perception of a knower where there is no knower, who dwells in the perception of a knower where there is no knower, who dwells in the perception of a knower where there is no knower, who dwells in the perception of a knower where there is no knower, who dwells in the perception of a knower where there is no knower, who dwells in the perception of a knower where there is no knower, who dwells in the perception of a knower where there is no knower, who dwells in the perception of a knower where there is no knower, who dwells in the perception of a knower where there is no knower, who dwells in the perception of a knower where there is no knower, who dwells in the perception of a knower where there is no knower, who dwells in the perception of a knower where there is no knower, who dwells in the perception of

original: shed can med pa la shed can gyi 'du shes su gnas pa dang / @469b shed bdag med pa la shed bdag gi 'du shes su gnas pa dang / byed pa po med pa la byed pa po'i 'du shes su gnas pa dang / byed du 'jug pa po med pa la byed du 'jug pa po'i 'du shes su gnas pa dang /
analyzed: shed can med pa la shed can gyi 'du shes su gnas pa dang / @469b shed bdag med pa la shed bdag gi 'du shes su gnas pa dang / byed pa po med pa la byed pa po'i 'du shes su gnas pa dang / byed du 'jug pa po med pa la byed du 'jug pa po'i 'du shes su gnas pa dang /
translated: They are to remain with the perception of a being where there is no being, to remain with the perception of a self where there is no self, to remain with the perception of an agent where there is no agent, to remain with the perception of an instigator where there is no instigator,

original: slong ba po med pa la slong ba po'i 'du shes su gnas pa dang / slong du 'jug pa po med pa la slong du 'jug pa po'i 'du shes su gnas pa dang / tshor ba po med pa la tshor ba po'i 'du shes su gnas pa dang /
analyzed: slong ba po med pa la slong ba po'i 'du shes su gnas pa dang / slong du 'jug pa po med pa la slong du 'jug pa po'i 'du shes su gnas pa dang / tshor ba po med pa la tshor ba po'i 'du shes su gnas pa dang /
translated: to remain with the perception of a motivator where there is no motivator, to remain with the perception of an instigator of motivation where there is no instigator of motivation, to remain with the perception of a feeler where there is no feeler,

original: tshor du 'jug pa po med pa la tshor du 'jug pa po'i 'du shes su gnas pa dang / shes pa po med pa la shes pa po'i 'du shes su gnas pa dang / mthong ba po med pa la mthong ba po'i 'du shes su gnas pa de dag phyin ci log las rnam par 'grol te /
analyzed: tshor du 'jug pa po med pa la tshor du 'jug pa po'i 'du shes su gnas pa dang / shes pa po med pa la shes pa po'i 'du shes su gnas pa dang / mthong ba po med pa la mthong ba po'i 'du shes su gnas pa de dag phyin ci log las rnam par 'grol te /
translated: and those who are attached to the notion of a seer, although there is no seer.

original: phyin ci log las rnam par bkrol zhing 'chi ba med pa'i dbyings su 'god do //
analyzed: phyin ci log las rnam par bkrol zhing 'chi ba med pa'i dbyings su 'god do //
translated: They liberate them from error and establish them in the realm of deathlessness.

original: de la bkod nas rgyu ba 'di dag yongs su mi rgyu ste /
analyzed: de la bkod nas rgyu ba 'di dag yongs su mi rgyu ste /
translated: Having established them there, they do not engage in the following:

original: bdag gi 'du shes sam /
analyzed: bdag gi 'du shes sam /
translated: the notion of a self,

original: sems can gyi 'du shes sam /
analyzed: sems can gyi 'du shes sam /
translated: the notion of a sentient being,

original: srog gi 'du shes sam /
analyzed: srog gi 'du shes sam /
translated: the notion of a life-force,🔽the notion of a human being,

original: 'gro ba'i 'du shes sam /🔽gso ba'i 'du shes sam /🔽skyes bu'i 'du shes sam /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i 'du shes sam / gso ba'i 'du shes sam / skyes bu'i 'du shes sam /
translated: the notion of a person,🔽the notion of an individual,🔽the notion of a human,🔽the notion of a human being,🔽the notion of a creator,

original: gang zag gi 'du shes sam /🔽shed can gyi 'du shes sam /
analyzed: gang zag gi 'du shes sam / shed can gyi 'du shes sam /
translated: the notion of a causer,🔽the notion of an instigator,🔽the notion of an agent,🔽the notion of a subject,🔽the notion of an experiencer,🔽the notion of a knower,🔽the notion of a seer,🔽the notion of a hearer,🔽the notion of a feeler,🔽the notion of an observer,🔽the notion of a knower,🔽the notion of a perceiver,🔽the notion of a thinker,🔽the notion of a cognizer,🔽the notion of a speaker,🔽the notion of a doer,🔽the notion of a non-doer,🔽the notion of a knower,🔽the notion of a non-knower,🔽the notion of a seer,

original: shed bdag gi 'du shes sam /🔽byed pa po'i 'du shes sam /
analyzed: shed bdag gi 'du shes sam / byed pa po'i 'du shes sam /
translated: the notion of a non-seer,🔽the notion of a hearer,🔽the notion of a non-hearer,🔽the notion of a feeler,🔽the notion of a non-feeler,🔽the notion of an observer,🔽the notion of a non-observer,🔽the notion of a cognizer,🔽the notion of a non-cognizer,🔽the notion of a thinker,🔽the notion of a non-thinker,🔽the notion of a perceiver,🔽the notion of a non-perceiver,🔽the notion of a knower,🔽the notion of a non-knower,🔽the notion of a speaker,🔽the notion of a non-speaker,🔽the notion of a doer,🔽the notion of a non-doer,🔽the notion of a creator,

original: byed du 'jug pa po'i 'du shes sam /
analyzed: byed du 'jug pa po'i 'du shes sam /
translated: the notion of a non-creator,

original: slong ba po'i 'du shes sam /
analyzed: slong ba po'i 'du shes sam /
translated: the notion of a causer,🔽the notion of a non-

original: slong du 'jug pa po'i 'du shes sam /🔽tshor ba po'i 'du shes sam /🔽tshor du 'jug pa po'i @470a *//
analyzed: slong du 'jug pa po'i 'du shes sam / tshor ba po'i 'du shes sam / tshor du 'jug pa po'i @470a *//
translated: the notion of one who makes them beg,🔽the notion of one who feels,

original: 'du shes sam /
analyzed: 'du shes sam /
translated: the notion of one who makes them feel,

original: shes pa po'i 'du shes sam /
analyzed: shes pa po'i 'du shes sam /
translated: the notion of one who knows,🔽the notion of one who sees,

original: mthong ba po'i 'du shes yongs su mi rgyu ste /
analyzed: mthong ba po'i 'du shes yongs su mi rgyu ste /
translated: do not occur to him.

original: de g-yo ba dang / rlom sems dang / 'bar ba dang / spros pa 'di dag btang nas /
analyzed: de g-yo ba dang / rlom sems dang / 'bar ba dang / spros pa 'di dag btang nas /
translated: Having given up this movement, conceit, burning, and proliferation,

original: spros pa med pa'i sems kyis nye bar bsgrubs shing mang du spyod de /
analyzed: spros pa med pa'i sems kyis nye bar bsgrubs shing mang du spyod de /
translated: he practices with a mind that is free of proliferation.

original: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti, for these reasons, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: bdag nyid kyang chos gang la'ang mngon par zhen pa med la /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang chos gang la'ang mngon par zhen pa med la /
translated: they themselves do not settle down on any phenomenon at all,

original: sems can thams cad kyang mngon par zhen pa med pa la rab tu 'god de /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang mngon par zhen pa med pa la rab tu 'god de /
translated: and they also establish all sentient beings in a state of nonsettling down.

original: de ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi /
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi /
translated: This is in terms of worldly convention,

original: don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: but not in terms of the ultimate.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas chos gang mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas sam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas chos gang mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas sam /
translated: “The Tathāgata’s perfect awakening to any dharma at all is a perfect awakening to the world’s conventional truth.🔽”

original: ma lags kyi /
analyzed: ma lags kyi /
translated: “No, Blessed One.

original: don dam par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas /
analyzed: don dam par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas /
translated: It is a perfect awakening to the ultimate truth.🔽”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas chos 'di mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas chos 'di mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “When it is said, ‘The Tathāgata has perfectly awakened to this dharma,’

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du brjod pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du brjod pa ste /
translated: this is expressed in terms of the world’s conventional truth.

original: de la chos 'dis chos 'di lta bu zhig mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba de lta bu gang yang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: de la chos 'dis chos 'di lta bu zhig mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba de lta bu gang yang mi dmigs te /
translated: In this regard, no dharma whatsoever is apprehended as ‘This dharma has perfectly awakened to such and such a dharma.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is because

original: chos 'dis chos 'di lta bu zhig mngon @470b par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa ste /🔽gnyis kyis ni gang yang thob pa'am /
analyzed: chos 'dis chos 'di lta bu zhig mngon @470b par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa ste / gnyis kyis ni gang yang thob pa'am /
translated: ‘This dharma has perfectly awakened to such and such a dharma’ is an apprehension.

original: mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: There is no attainment or realization whatsoever through duality.🔽”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Blessed One,

original: de ste gnyis kyis thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba ma mchis na /
analyzed: de ste gnyis kyis thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba ma mchis na /
translated: if there is no attainment and no clear knowledge through duality,

original: gnyis su ma mchis pas thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: gnyis su ma mchis pas thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ram /
translated: is there attainment and clear knowledge through non-duality?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: gnyis kyis kyang thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: gnyis kyis kyang thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba med de /
translated: “There is no attainment and no clear knowledge through duality.

original: gnyis su med pas kyang thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: gnyis su med pas kyang thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba med de /
translated: There is no attainment and no clear knowledge through non-duality.

original: gang la gnyis kyang med la /
analyzed: gang la gnyis kyang med la /
translated: Where there is neither duality

original: mi gnyis pa'ang med pa ni thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi gnyis pa'ang med pa ni thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: nor non-duality, that is called attainment and clear knowledge.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar 'di ni thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di ni thob pa'o //
translated: Because this is attainment

original: 'di ni mngon par rtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni spros pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni mngon par rtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni spros pa ste /
translated: and this is clear knowledge is conceptual elaboration.

original: chos mnyam pa nyid la spros pa med de /
analyzed: chos mnyam pa nyid la spros pa med de /
translated: In the sameness of dharmas there is no conceptual elaboration.

original: spros pa med pa ni chos mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: spros pa med pa ni chos mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: The absence of conceptual elaboration is the sameness of dharmas.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Blessed One,

original: chos dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid rnams la chos kyi mnyam pa nyid ces bgyi ba'ang gang zhig mchis /
analyzed: chos dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid rnams la chos kyi mnyam pa nyid ces bgyi ba'ang gang zhig mchis /
translated: What is the ‘sameness of phenomena’ of phenomena that are essentially inexistent?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: gang dngos po med pa dang / dngos po med pa'ang ma yin pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa dang / yongs su brjod pa med pa 'di ni chos mnyam pa nyid de /
analyzed: gang dngos po med pa dang / dngos po med pa'ang ma yin pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa dang / yongs su brjod pa med pa 'di ni chos mnyam pa nyid de /
translated: “That which is neither existent nor inexistent, which is essenceless and inexpressible, is the sameness of phenomena.

original: chos mnyam pa nyid po de ni brjod du med pa'o //🔽chos mnyam pa nyid ma @471a *//
analyzed: chos mnyam pa nyid po de ni brjod du med pa'o // chos mnyam pa nyid ma @471a *//
translated: That sameness of phenomena is inexpressible.

original: gtogs par yang dmigs par 'gyur ba'i chos gang yang med de /
analyzed: gtogs par yang dmigs par 'gyur ba'i chos gang yang med de /
translated: Apart from the sameness of phenomena, there is no phenomenon that can be apprehended.

original: chos mnyam pa nyid ni chos thams cad las rnam par 'das pa'o //🔽chos mnyam pa nyid ni byis pa'am /
analyzed: chos mnyam pa nyid ni chos thams cad las rnam par 'das pa'o // chos mnyam pa nyid ni byis pa'am /
translated: The sameness of phenomena transcends all phenomena.🔽The sameness of phenomena is not to be known by any phenomenon, whether of foolish beings,

original: 'phags pa'am / chos gang gis kyang shes par mi rung zhing yul ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'am / chos gang gis kyang shes par mi rung zhing yul ma yin pa'o //
translated: noble beings, or anything else. It is not an object.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ” The bodhisattva Sarva­nīvaraṇa­viṣkam­bhin said,

original: chos mnyam pa nyid po de dag la de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul yang ma lags sam /
analyzed: chos mnyam pa nyid po de dag la de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul yang ma lags sam /
translated: “Blessed One, is the domain of the Thus-Gone One not that sameness of phenomena?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: rab 'byor / chos mnyam pa nyid ni 'phags pa thams cad kyi yul ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos mnyam pa nyid ni 'phags pa thams cad kyi yul ma yin pa ste /
translated: “Subhūti, the sameness of dharmas is not the domain of any noble ones.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'am /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'am /
translated: It is not the domain of stream-enterers,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'am /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'am /
translated: once-returners,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'am /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'am /
translated: non-returners,

original: dgra bcom pa'am /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'am /
translated: arhats,

original: rang byang chub bam /
analyzed: rang byang chub bam /
translated: solitary buddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'am /
translated: bodhisattvas,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul ma yin no //
translated: or tathāgatas.🔽” Subhūti asked:

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni chos thams cad kyi yul la mnga' sgyur ba ma lags sam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni chos thams cad kyi yul la mnga' sgyur ba ma lags sam /
translated: aren’t tathāgatas, arhats, and completely awakened buddhas masters of the domain of all dharmas?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Blessed One replied:

original: rab 'byor / gal te chos mnyam pa nyid kyang gzhan la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te chos mnyam pa nyid kyang gzhan la /
translated: “Subhūti, if the sameness of dharmas were one thing

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang gzhan zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang gzhan zhig yin na ni /
translated: and tathāgatas, arhats, and completely awakened buddhas were another,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas chos thams cad @471b kyi yul la mnga' sgyur bar yang 'gyur na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas chos thams cad @471b kyi yul la mnga' sgyur bar yang 'gyur na /
translated: they will become tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas who have power over all dharmas.

original: rab 'byor / so so'i skye bo rnams kyi chos mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa rnams dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams dang / phyir mi 'ong ba rnams dang / dgra bcom pa rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / so so'i skye bo rnams kyi chos mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa rnams dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams dang / phyir mi 'ong ba rnams dang / dgra bcom pa rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang /
translated: “Su­bhūti, the sameness of the dharmas of ordinary people, and the sameness of the dharmas of the stream enterers, once-returners, non-returners, arhats, pratyekabuddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa de ni mnyam pa nyid gcig pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa de ni mnyam pa nyid gcig pa ste /
translated: bodhisattvas, and tathāgatas, is a single sameness.

original: mnyam pa nyid dang / mi mnyam pa nyid la bye brag gang yang med do //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid dang / mi mnyam pa nyid la bye brag gang yang med do //
translated: There is no distinction whatsoever between sameness and difference.

original: de ltar so so'i skye bo rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa dang / 'phags pa thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: de ltar so so'i skye bo rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa dang / 'phags pa thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa de ni /
translated: Thus, the sameness of ordinary people and the sameness of all the noble beings

original: mnyam pa nyid gcig pa ste /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid gcig pa ste /
translated: is a single sameness.

original: mnyam pa nyid gcig pa la 'di ni so so'i skye bo'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid gcig pa la 'di ni so so'i skye bo'o //
translated: In the sameness of what is one, there is no duality in the sense that ‘this is an ordinary person,’

original: 'di ni rgyun du zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyun du zhugs pa'o //
translated: ‘this is a stream enterer,’

original: 'di ni lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: ‘this is a once-returner,’ ‘this is a non-returner,’ ‘this is an arhat,’ ‘this is a pratyekabuddha,’ ‘this is a bodhisattva,’

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so zhes bya bar gnyis su bya ba med de /
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so zhes bya bar gnyis su bya ba med de /
translated: and ‘this is a tathāgata, worthy one, perfectly complete buddha.’

original: rnam par rtog pa de dag ni mnyam pa nyid la mi dmigs so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de dag ni mnyam pa nyid la mi dmigs so //
translated: Those conceptual thoughts are not apprehended in sameness.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti replied, “Blessed One,

original: de ste chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid la /
analyzed: de ste chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid la /
translated: if in the sameness of all phenomena

original: 'di ni so so'i skye bo'o //
analyzed: 'di ni so so'i skye bo'o //
translated: there is no duality in the sense that ‘this is an ordinary person,’

original: 'di ni rgyun du zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyun du zhugs pa'o //
translated: ‘this is a stream enterer,’

original: 'di ni lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba @472a *//
analyzed: 'di ni lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba @472a *//
translated: ‘this is a once-returner,’ ‘this is a non-returner,’

original: dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: ‘this is an arhat,’ ‘this is a pratyekabuddha,’ ‘this is a bodhisattva,’🔽and ‘this is a tathāgata, worthy one, perfectly complete buddha,’

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so zhes bgyi ba'i rnam par rtog pa de dag mi dmigs na /
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so zhes bgyi ba'i rnam par rtog pa de dag mi dmigs na /
translated: If one does not apprehend the idea that ‘this is a Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One,’

original: des so so'i skye bo rnams dang / rgyun du zhugs pa rnams dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams dang / phyir mi 'ong ba rnams dang / dgra bcom pa rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang /
analyzed: des so so'i skye bo rnams dang / rgyun du zhugs pa rnams dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams dang / phyir mi 'ong ba rnams dang / dgra bcom pa rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang /
translated: then there is no difference between ordinary persons, and those who have entered the stream, and those who are tied to one more rebirth, and those who will not be reborn, and arhats, and pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams khyad par ma mchis par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams khyad par ma mchis par 'gyur ro //
translated: and tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly awakened buddhas.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said!

original: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid la so so'i skye bo rnams dang / rgyun du zhugs pa rnams dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams dang / phyir mi 'ong ba rnams dang / dgra bcom pa rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid la so so'i skye bo rnams dang / rgyun du zhugs pa rnams dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams dang / phyir mi 'ong ba rnams dang / dgra bcom pa rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang /
translated: In the equality of all phenomena, there is no distinction between ordinary beings,🔽stream-enterers, once-returners, non-returners, arhats, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattvas,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams khyad par med do //
